THIS 12-MONTH PROJECT WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES TO 100 UNDUPLICATED ADULTS AND 50 UNDUPLICATED YOUTH. THE ACTIVITIES WILL RANGE FROM TRAIL HIKING AND CAMPING IN SOUTHERN NEVADA TO MOUNTAIN HIKING AND FLY-FISHING IN NORTHERN NEVADA. THE RTP FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF HIKING GEAR, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION, LABOR, AND EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION TO TAKE 100 UNDUPLICATED ADULTS TO VISIT 5 OUTDOOR SPACES IN NEVADA.

MAINTENANCE PROJECTS WILL FOCUS ON IMPROVING USER ACCESS AND SAFETY, AS WELL AS IMPROVING TRAIL SUSTAINABILITY. PROJECTS INCLUDE BRUSHING AND CLEARING THE TRAIL CORRIDOR, IMPROVING TRAIL TREAD, AND ADDRESSING AREAS IMPACTED BY EROSION.

TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL UTILIZE ITS EXISTING NATIONAL POSTER PROGRAM TO RECEIVE AND PROCESS ORDERS. TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL ALSO UTILIZE ITS EXISTING SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING PLAN FOR THE NATIONAL POSTER PROGRAM TO ANNOUNCE THE AVAILABILITY OF EDUCATIONAL POSTERS TO THE NEVADA RECREATION COMMUNITY.

THE TRAILS WILL BE OPEN TO BOTH BIKING AND HIKING AND ARE PROPOSED IN A MANNER TO AVOID ECOLOGICALLY SENSITIVE AREAS, CAPTURE UNIQUE TERRAIN, ADD TO THE OVERALL QUALITY OF THE TRAIL EXPERIENCE AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SINGLE TRACK RIDING OPPORTUNITIES. MOUNTAIN BIKE TRAIL AS IDENTIFIED IN THE TRAIL PROPOSAL WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT THE FOLLOWING ACTIONS, CONDITIONS, AND TRAIL MODIFICATIONS ARE IMPLEMENTED. NEW TRAIL WILL BE ROUTED ONTO EXISTING TRAIL TO MINIMIZE WATER CROSSINGS AND TO AVOID WET AREAS EXCEPT WHERE NEW STREAM CROSSINGS ARE APPROVED.   CURRENTLY, THE REVISED PROPOSAL WILL REQUIRE 2 NEW CROSSINGS WITH APPROXIMATELY 80' OF DECKING AT EACH CROSSING SITE. DAYS RIVER, BRAMPTON TWP, DELTA COUNTY - PROJECT SITE IS LOCATED EAST OF M-35 AND NORTH OF DAYS RIVER 24.5 ROAD.

PROJECT TITLE: TAMMANY TRACE TO HERITAGE PARK, PHASE 1 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THIS PORTION OF THE TRACE TO HERITAGE PARK PROJECT WILL START AT BAYOU LANE NEAREST TO THE INTERSECTION OF WEST HALL AVENUE. THIS PHASE WILL CREATE NEW TRAILS THAT ARE 10' WIDE BY 2,875' LONG. THESE TRAILS WILL ATTACH TO THE EXISTING 10' WIDE BY 800' LONG PAVED TRAIL THAT LEADS INTO THE ENTRANCE OF HERITAGE PARK. THIS 10' X 800' SECTION WILL ALSO BE CLEANED, STRIPED, CURBED, AND HAVE SIGNAGE INSTALLED. THE CITY OF SLIDELL'S ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT WILL OVERSEE THIS PROJECT, THE REHABILITATION OF THE NEW CONCRETE TRAIL, AND ANY IMPROVEMENTS, NECESSARY FOR THE EXISTING TRAIL LEADING INTO HERITAGE PARK. PORTIONS OF THE CONCRETE TRAIL PROJECT WILL BE PLACED OUT FOR BID/QUOTE PROCESS FOR CONTRACTORS.

PROJECT TITLE: REMY LANDRY PARK TRAIL AND TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: : THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF THE CONST. OF A NEW CONCRETE RECREATIONAL TRAIL AT LANDRY PARK IN THE TOWN OF DELCAMBRE AND A KAYAK LAUNCH AT THE DELCAMBRE BOAT LAUNCH. THE RECREATIONAL TRAIL WILL BE APPROX. 2,922' LONG AND 6' WIDE. THE TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AROUND THE PERIMETER OF LANDRY PARK, ALLOWING THE RESIDENTS OF DELCAMBRE AND THE SURROUNDING AREA TO RECREATE NEAR THE ONGOING PARK ACTIVITIES. CULVERTS WILL BE INSTALLED IN THE EXISTING DRAINAGE DITCHES WHICH WILL BE CROSSED BY THE RECREATIONAL TRAIL TO ENSURE THAT THE DRAINAGE OF THE AREA IS MAINTAINED. ADDITIONALLY, STEEL GRATES WILL BE INSTALLED IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS TO ALLOW WATER TO DRAIN ACROSS THE WALK INTO THE ADJACENT DRAINAGE DITCHES. THE KAYAK LAUNCH WIL BE ADDED TO THE EXISTING FISHING PIER LOCATED NEXT TO THE DELCAMBRE BOAT LAUNCH ON THE DELCAMBRE CANAL. THE LAUNCH WILL BE DESIGNED SO THAT IT ADJUSTS TO CHANGING WATER LEVELS AND PROVIDES FOR STABLE ENTRY AND EXIT. THE LAUNCH WILL BE ATTACHED TO A DECK AND RAMP FOR ACCESS TO THE LAUNCH.

PROJECT TITLE: SHOUP BAY TRAIL PH 3  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: WITH THIS GRANT PHASE 3 ON THE PROJECT FOR MAINTENANCE OF SHOUP BAY TRAIL WILL BE COMPLETED.  DURING PHASE 1 GRANTEE  CLEARED FIRST 1,500 FT OF THE TRAIL, PLACED AND COMPACTED FABRIC, AND FILLED GRAVEL.  PHASE 2 ADDED DIRECTIONAL SIGNAGE, REHABILITATED BRIDGE, REPAIRED DRAINAGE TRENCH AND DID LANDSCAPING AT THE TRAILHEAD, AND INSTALLED A BENCH.
 PHASE 3 WILL FOCUS ON CUTTING  2.5 MILE SECTION FROM THE POINT JUST PAST THE MARSH TO THE CAMPING AREA AT GOLD CREEK. THE TRAIL WILL BE CUT 6 FT WIDE WITH UP TO 6 FT ENCROACHMENT ON EACH SIDE WHERE POSSIBLE TO REDUCE IMMEDIATE RE-ENCROACHMENT OF ALDER AND DEVIL'S CLUB, AND IMPROVE VISIBILITY FOR BETTER SAFETY.

PROJECT TITLE: CAMPBELL TRACT NEW SINGLE TRACK CONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW YEAR-ROUND, MULTI-USE SINGLE TRACK TRAIL APPROXIMATELY 1.5 MILES IN LENGTH AND 2 TO 3 FEET WIDE, WITH A 100-FOOT BUFFER EITHER SIDE. THE TRAIL SURFACE WILL BE A MIXTURE OF NATURAL MATERIALS, GRAVEL, GEO-BLOCK, ETC. APPROXIMATELY 0.5 ACRE WOULD BE DISTURBED FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THIS TRAIL. THE NEW TRAIL WILL EXPAND THE EXISTING TRAIL NETWORK AND ENHANCE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN CAMPBELL TRACK AND WOULD LIKELY REDUCE CONFLICT BETWEEN VARIOUS USER GROUPS.

PROJECT TITLE: WOODY ISLAND TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE WOODY ISLAND STATE RECREATION SITE TRAILS CONNECTING OCEAN BEACH, PUBLIC USE CABIN, LONG LAKE,  CRAB LAGOON AND SALT LAKE AREAS BY BRUSHING, CLEARING AND IMPROVING TREAD ON EXISTING TRAIL; REPLACING A SMALL PUNCHEON, INSTALLING PUNCHEON IN WET AND MUDDY SECTIONS; INSTALLING TRAIL SIGNS AND TRAIL MARKERS.

PROJECT TITLE: MATANUSKA LAKES TRAIL ENHANCEMENT PROJECT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE 2 MILES OF EXISTING NON-MOTORIZED TRAIL WITHIN THE MATANUSKA LAKES STATE RECREATION AREA. THE PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE ON BRUSHING AND LODGING OUT THE TRAIL CORRIDORS AND REPAIRING A 200 SQ. FT SECTION OF BADLY ERODED EXISTING TRAIL TREAD AT THE CARRY-IN CANOE LANDING AT MATANUSKA LAKE. THIS WORK WILL TAKE PLACE IN THE SUMMER OF 2023.

PROJECT TITLE: HOWL STEWARDSHIP EXPEDITION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: HOWL, INC. WILL LEAD MULTIPLE REMOTE TRAIL IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS IN KACHEMAK BAY STATE PARK DURING 2023 AND 2024 FIELD SEASONS. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BRUSHING, IMPROVING TRAIL VISIBILITY IN AIRPLANE AREAS, AND MAINTAINING CAMPSITE TRAILS. HOWL STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WILL COMPLETE THE TRAIL WORK ON 5-DAYS BACKCOUNTRY EXPEDITIONS DURING WHICH HOWL STAFF WILL TEACH WILDERNESS SAFETY AND SURVIVAL, LEADERSHIP, LEAVE NO TRACE ETHICS, STEWARDSHIP AND TEAMWORK.

PROJECT TITLE: CHINA POOT LAKE TRAIL - FLOOD REROUTE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KACHEMAK STATE PARK PLANS TO RE-ROUTE 700-FOOT SECTION OF THE CHINA POOT TRAIL THAT IS FLOODED DUE TO A PERMANENT CHANGE OF COURSE OF A STREAM. 

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE NEW TRAIL ALIGNMENT WITH TREAD CONSTRUCTION, BRIDGE CONSTRUCTION, AND TUMPIKE CONSTRUCTION WITH CROSS DRAINS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO FINISH CONSTRUCTION OF TWO EXISTING LOG BRIDGES THAT WERE BUILT IN 2020 AND 2022 IN THE FLOODED AREA OF THE CHINA POOT LAKE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: CAINES HEAD SRA TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS - RAINFOREST/ALPINE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KENAI REGION PLANS TO REPAIR AND REHABILITATE PORTION OF THECAINES HEAD STATE RECREATION AREA (CHSRA)TRAILS SYSTEM.

THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES GENERAL MAINTENANCE NEEDS SUCH AS REPAIRING AND HARDENING TRAIL TREAD, BUILDING LOG AND TREATED PUNCHEON, IMPROVING DRAINAGE TO INCREASE SAFETY AND MAINTAIN GREATER LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY OF CHSRA TRAILS.  WORK WILL TAKE PLACE ON THE RAINFOREST AND ALPINE TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: BYERS LAKE LOOP TRAIL BRUSHING AND TREAD REPAIR :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE VEGETATION AND MAKE REPAIRS TO DAMAGED TRAIL TREAD ALONG THE BYERS LAKE LOOP TRAIL ADJUSENT TO THE BYERS LAKE CAMPGROUND IN DENALI STATE PARK.  BUCKING FALLEN SNAGS, CUTTING BACK VIGOROUS GROWTH OF ALDER, DEVILS CLUB, FALSE HUCKLEBERRY AND VICCINIUM SP. ALONG THE TRAIL'S CORRIDOR WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY 5 MILES LONG, CONSTITUTE THE MAJORITY OF ACTIVITIES ON THIS PROJECT.

TASK 1: PROJECT INITIATION, HIRE TRAIL CREW, EQUIPMENT PURCHASES. [1 WEEK]
TASK 2: PLANNING AND PROCUREMENT. [1 WEEK]
TASK 3: TRAIL CREW TRAINING. [1 WEEK]
TASK 4: TRAIL LOG OUT. [1 WEEK]
TASK 5: TRAIL BRUSHING. [4 WEEKS]
TASK 6: TRAIL TREAD REPAIRS. [1 WEEK]
TASK 7: PROJECT CLOSE-OUT, FINAL RREPORTING. [1 WEEK]
TOTAL 10 WEEKS PLUS 4 WEEKS CONTINGENCY FOR DELAYS CAUSED BY WEATHER, MATERIAL SHORTAGES, STAFF EMERGENCIES, ETC.

THIS TRAIL RESTORATION PROJECT WILL REPLACE THE ENTIRE 4278 LINEAR FEET OF TRAIL IN THE CITY OF LACKAWANNA IN ERIE COUNTY. WORK WILL INCLUDE UNDERCUT AND BACKFILL, INSTALLATION OF 4' HDPE UNDERDRAIN, INSTALLATION OF 12' HDPE STORM SEWER, PRECAST CONCRETE CATCH BASIN AND APPLICATION OF TACK COAT, ASPHALT TOP COURSE AND ASPHALT BINDER COURSE. OPRHP PROJECT NUMBER 154121.

PROJECT TITLE: WELCH TRAIL RESTORATION, CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF THE WELCH RECREATIONAL TRAIL, A NON-MOTORIZED, SHARED-USE SEGMENT, APPROXIMATELY 1.25 MILES LONG LOCATED WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE VILLAGE OF WESTFIELD, RUNNING ADJACENT TO CHAUTAUQUA CREEK ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE TOWN OF WESTFIELD, CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY. OPRHP PROJECT NUMBER 151803.

PROJECT TITLE: TRUCKEE MEADOWS TRAIL PLAN PHASE II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TRUCKEE MEADOWS PARKS FOUNDATION (TMPF) IS PROPOSING FURTHER WORK ON THE TRUCKEE MEADOWS TRAIL PLAN (TMT). THE GOALS OF TMT PHASE 2 IS TO COMPLETE AND ENHANCE THE 29 REGIONAL MAPS IN THE TMT PLAN AND REPORT IN COORDINATION WITH THE TRUCKEE MEADOWS REGIONAL PLANNING AGENCY, AND THE CONTINUED SUPPORT OF A FULL-TIME TMT COORDINATOR. MAPS IN THE PLAN REPRESENT EXISTING TRAILS, AND DESIRED ALIGNMENTS THAT WERE A RESULT OF PUBLIC OUTREACH AND SURVEYS ARE INCLUDED. THESE MAPS NEED A LABELING SYSTEM, AS WELL AS A MUCH HIGHER LEVEL OF DETAIL OR RESOLUTION. THE ENHANCEMENT AND COMPLETION OF THESE MAPS REPRESENTS A MAJOR STEP IN DEVELOPING THE LIST OF TRAIL ACTION ITEMS FOR FURTHER TMT IMPLEMENTATION. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITY.

PROJECT TITLE: IMPROVING ACCESSIBILITY AT TAHOE MEADOWS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TAHOE RIM TRAIL ASSOCIATION’S (TRTA) IMPROVING ACCESSIBILITY AT TAHOE MEADOWS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON PLANNING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING WORKING WITH THE USFS TO DETERMINE THE FEASIBILITY OF DESIGNATED HANDICAPPED PARKING SPACES AT THE TAHOE MEADOWS TRAILHEAD PARKING LOT, INCLUSIVE AND ACCESSIBLE INTERPRETIVE AND WAYFINDING SIGNAGE TO IMPROVE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE OF RECREATING ON THE LOOP, AND DETERMINING WHETHER THE LOOP SHOULD BE BI-DIRECTIONAL OR ONE-WAY TO ACCOMMODATE USE FOR THOSE WITH PHYSICAL BARRIERS BETTER. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE AND COMPLEMENT THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN ADA-COMPLIANT RAMP TO BE BUILT FROM HWY 431 NEAR THE TAHOE MEADOWS BOARDWALK TRAIL AND OPHIR CREEK MINOR TRAILHEAD. NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR DURING THIS PROJECT, IT WILL SOLELY FOCUS ON THE PERMITTING AND DESIGNS LEADING TO FUTURE ACTIVITIES AND ADA/ADA TRAIL COMPLIANCE.

PROJECT TITLE: LAMOILLE SUMMIT TRAIL SYSTEMS NEPA :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE NEVADA OUTDOOR SCHOOL (NOS) WILL CONTINUE THE PLANNING AND NEPA DOCUMENTATION FOR NEW, 50-MILE NON-MOTORIZED MULTI-USE STACKED LOOP TRAIL SYSTEM LOCATED BETWEEN ELKO AND SPRING CREEK THAT WAS BEGUN WITH RTP 2022-25. THE PLANNING FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDES A TRAIL DESIGN AND LAYOUT CONTRACT; ROUTE FINDING; CORRIDOR FLAGGING; GPS FILE CREATION; CONFIRMING PREVIOUS WORK ON THE FIRST 12 MILES OF CONCEPT; CONSULTANT TRAVEL AND A 2-DAY TRAIL DESIGN AND LAYOUT CLASS. THE NEPA CONTRACT WILL SATISFY BOLM REQUIREMENTS TO ADVANCE CONSTRUCTION. THE CURRENT PROJECT END GOAL IS A 50 MILE NON-MOTORIZED MULTI-USE STACKED-LOOP TRAIL SYSTEM LOCATED BETWEEN ELKO AND SPRING CREEK. NEPA CLEARANCE WILL REQUIRE ADDITIONAL FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITY.

PROJECT TITLE: FRIENDS OF PAHRANAGAT VALLEY TRAIL PLANNING :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE FRIENDS OF PAHRANAGAT VALLEY CORPORATION (FPVC) WILL BE CONTRACTING A TRAIL INDUSTRY CONSULTANT EXPERIENCED IN PLANNING, DESIGN, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF NATURAL SURFACE SHARE-USE RECREATIONAL TRAILS. FPVC WILL WORK TO DEVELOP A TRAIL SYSTEM THAT WILL ADD TO EXISTING OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES IN PAHRANAGAT VALLEY. FPVC WILL BE CONTRACTING A TRAIL INDUSTRY CONSULTANT EXPERIENCED IN PLANNING, DESIGN, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF NATURAL SURFACE SHARE-USE RECREATIONAL TRAILS AND CREATE A TRAILS CONCEPT PLAN THAT MEETS OUR IDENTIFIED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITY.

PROJECT TITLE: NEVADA TRAIL FINDER :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE NEVADA DIVISION OF OUTDOOR RECREATION (NDOR) IS TAKING OVER MANAGEMENT FOR THE SUPPORT, FUTURE DEVELOPMENT, AND ONGOING MAINTENANCE OF THE NEVADA TRAIL FINDER (NVTF) WEBSITE. HTTPS://WWW.NVTRAILFINDER.COM/. LAUNCHED IN OCTOBER 2022 THIS WEBSITE PROVIDES FREE-TO-THE-PUBLIC INFORMATION, MAPS, AND ASSOCIATED RESOURCES ON MOTORIZED AND NON-MOTORIZED TRAILS ACROSS NEVADA. CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THE WEBSITE IN ADDITION TO THE MAPPING OF TRAILS AND TRAIL SYSTEMS ACROSS NEVADA NOT CURRENTLY INVENTORIED ON THE TRAIL FINDER WEBSITE AND DATABASE. COMMON TASKS SUCH AS IMPLEMENTING MINOR WEBSITE ENHANCEMENTS, WEBSITE TRACKING AND EVALUATION, GIS DATA MANAGEMENT AND SCRIPT REFINEMENT, AND/OR GRAPHIC DESIGN. RESPONDING TO WEBSITE INQUIRIES, PUBLIC AND PARTNER DATA AND INFORMATION REQUESTS, WEBSITE PROMOTION, AND USER ENGAGEMENT. NDOR WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES TO SECURE DATASETS, GIS DATA DEVELOPMENT, ETC.

PROJECT TITLE: SUPPORTING LAND MANAGERS WITH TRAIL MAINTENANCE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS RELIABLE ACCESS TO WELL-MAINTAINED, SUSTAINABLE, MULTI-USE TRAILS THAT PERMIT MOUNTAIN BIKING NEAR LAS VEGAS AND PROVIDE FREE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT WILL FOCUS ON, AMONG OTHER THINGS, RIDING SAFETY, LOW-IMPACT RIDING (LEAVE NO TRACE PRINCIPLES) AND REDUCING USER CONFLICTS (TRAILS ARE COMMON GROUND PRINCIPLES).

PROJECT TITLE: ALTA-TOQUIMA/TABLE MOUNTAIN WILDERNESS RECREATION MAP :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FRIENDS OF NEVADA WILDERNESS (FONVW) WILL PRODUCE AND PRINT HIGH-QUALITY FIELD MAPS FOR THE ALTA TOQUIMA/TABLE MOUNTAIN WILDERNESS AND HIGH SCHELLS WILDERNESS RECREATION. ON-THE-GROUND DATA COLLECTION, PROCESSING AND DESIGN WORK WILL TAKE PLACE DURING 2023 AND 2024 WITH FOREST SERVICE PARTNERS PROVIDING CONSULTATION. ALL DATA COLLECTED WILL BE SHARED WITH AGENCY PARTNERS AND WILL PROMOTE RECREATION WHILE INFORMING THE FOREST SERVICES’ EFFORT TO IMPROVE ACCESS IN THE HUMBOLDT-TOIYABE NATIONAL FOREST. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITY.

PROJECT TITLE: INTERSECTION SIGNAGE AND KIOSK :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THERE IS NOT SIGNIFICANT SIGNAGE AT MULTIUSE ROAD/TRAIL INTERSECTIONS WITHIN A LARGE AREA OVERSEEN BY THE BLM AND THE GOLD BUTTE MONUMENT THAT IS BORDERED BY THE VIRGIN RIVER ON THE NORTH AND WEST, THE STATE LINE ON THE EAST AND SOUTH, AND THE GRAND CANYON AND LAKE MEAD ON THE SOUTH. TO ADDRESS THIS SAFETY AND EASE OF USE ISSUE FOR ALL RECREATIONAL (MULTIUSE) ACTIVITIES, THE VIRGIN RIVER COALITION (VRC) WILL PLAN FOR INSTALLATION OF 150 CARSONITE SIGNS AT INTERSECTIONS ON MAIN ROADS/TRAILS IN THIS AREA. VRC WILL ALSO INSTALL ONE TWO-PANEL KIOSK SOUTH OF MESQUITE ON WHITE ROCK ROAD. THE LOCATION OF THE INTERSECTION SIGNS WILL BE DETERMINED AS VRC PLANS FOR AND GET APPROVAL FROM THE CLARK COUNTY BLM AND GOLD BUTTE OFFICES. THIS FIRST PROJECT WILL ADDRESS SIGNAGE NEAREST TO MESQUITE ON ROADS AND TRAILS THAT ARE MOST UTILIZED AND ALL PROJECT WORK WILL TAKE PLACE IN NEVADA.

PROJECT TITLE: EXPLORE SAFE, EXPLORE SMART :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE NEVADA OUTDOOR SCHOOL (NOS) WILL CONDUCT A VARIETY OF OUTDOOR EDUCATION CLASSES THROUGHOUT NEVADA THROUGH OUR SCHOOL-BASED EDUCATION PROGRAMS, THE NATURE IN THE PARK PROGRAM, AND THE NATURE EXPLORERS CAMPS. EACH NATURE EXPLORERS CAMP INCLUDES AT LEAST 1 STEWARDSHIP ACTIVITY. THESE ACTIVITIES ALLOW PARTICIPANTS TO ACCOMPLISH ROUTINE MAINTENANCE TASKS SUCH AS TRASH CLEANUP, PAINTING, AND WEED TRIMMING. THESE STEWARDSHIP TASKS WILL NOT INVOLVE GROUND-DISTURBING ACTIVITY. NOS TRAINING FOCUSED PROGRAMS INCLUDE FORMAL TRAINING SUCH AS LEAVE NO TRACE AND TREAD LIGHTLY! TRAINER COURSES, MONTHLY OUTDOOR SKILL WORKSHOPS AND NOS’S OHV RIDE SAFE, RIDE SMART PROGRAM FOR YOUTH AND ADULTS. SPECIFICALLY, NOS IS PLANNING 3 TREAD LIGHTLY! AND 3 LEAVE NO TRACE TRAINER COURSES, 24 OUTDOOR SKILLS WORKSHOPS, OUTREACH THROUGH OUR RIDE SAFE, RIDE SMART ONLINE CAMPAIGN AND IN-PERSON OHV EDUCATION SUCH AS VIN/REGISTRATION EVENTS AND YOUTH RIDE SAFE, RIDE SMART CAMPS.

PROJECT TITLE: WINTER RANGER PROGRAM EASTERN NEVADA :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE (GBI) WILL ORGANIZE THE ACTIVITIES OF FOUR WINTER RECREATION RANGES, ON BEHALF OF THE UNITED STATES FOREST SERVICE (USFS) HUMBOLDT-TOIYABE NATIONAL FOREST RUBY MOUNTAINS, SANTA ROSA, AND ELY RANGER DISTRICTS. THE TECHNICIANS WILL CONDUCT SNOWMOBILE PATROLS IN SPECIFIC WINTER RECREATION AREAS THROUGHOUT THE IDENTIFIED RANGER DISTRICTS, INCLUDING LAMOILLE CANYON, SECRET PASS, HARRISON PASS, WARD MTN, SUCCESS SUMMIT, USFS LANDS SURROUNDING CAVE LAKE STATE PARK, HINKEY SUMMIT, AND GRANITE PEAK. DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BACKCOUNTRY SNOWMOBILE PATROL, AVALANCHE SAFETY EDUCATION & RESPONSE, NEVADA OHV REGISTRATION EDUCATION & OUTREACH, WILDERNESS BOUNDARY SIGNING, AND MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING FACILITIES. THERE WILL BE NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITY RELATED TO THIS PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: YOUTH TRAIL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROJECT N. NEVADA :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TAHOE RIM TRAIL ASSOCIATION (TRTA) WILL INCREASE YOUTH TRAIL STEWARDSHIP KNOWLEDGE AND ACTIVISM IN NORTHERN NEVADA THROUGH FREE, PLACE-BASED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING IN SCHOOLS, AT HOME, AND ON THE TRAIL. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES NO GROUND DISTURBANCE.

PROJECT TITLE: STEWARDSHIP AND TRAIL EDUCATION FOR NORTHERN NEVADA STUDENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SIERRA NEVADA JOURNEY’S (SNJ) STEWARDSHIP AND TRAIL EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR NORTHERN NEVADA STUDENTS WILL PROVIDE LOCAL ELEMENTARY STUDENTS ACCESS TO VARIOUS TRAIL SYSTEMS IN THE NORTHERN NEVADA REGION THROUGH ITS OUTDOOR SCIENCE AND NATURE EDUCATION PROGRAM, CLASSROOMS UNLEASHED. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM THEY WILL BUILD EQUITABLE ACCESS TO THE OUTDOORS AND HELP STUDENTS TO: UNDERSTAND SCIENCE CONCEPTS; USE CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS TO APPLY TO RELEVANT, REAL-WORLD ISSUES AND PROBLEMS; FEEL INSPIRED AND EXCITED ABOUT STEM SUBJECTS, EXPERIENCE FIRST-HAND THE IMPACT SCIENCE HAS ON THEIR LIVES; AND GAIN A GREATER SENSE OF CONNECTION TO AND UNDERSTANDING OF THE NATURAL WORLD AS WELL AS THEIR PERSONAL IMPACT ON THE LOCAL LAND, WATER AND AIR. NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR DURING THIS PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: RESPONSIBLE TRAIL USE FOR KIDS AND FAMILIES 2023 N. NEVADA :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN OUTDOOR SCHOOL (GBOS) PROVIDES FAMILY HIKES AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR SCHOOL CHILDREN SUCH AS SCIENCE CAMPS, FIELD STUDIES AND OUTDOOR SCHOOL BREAK DAY CAMPS IN THE RENO-TAHOE AREA. THIS PROJECT EMPHASIZES SAFETY, RESPONSIBLE USE AND ACCESS FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS BY INTRODUCING FAMILIES TO NEW TRAILS AND TEACHING LEAVE NO TRACE PRINCIPLES. THERE WILL BE NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITY RELATED TO THIS PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: GOLD BUTTE NATIONAL MONUMENT TRAILHEAD IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE FRIENDS OF GOLD BUTTE, IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT (BLM) GOLD BUTTE NATIONAL MONUMENT, PROPOSE TO ESTABLISH TRAILHEAD FACILITIES AT CABIN CANYON ENTRANCE TO GOLD BUTTE NATIONAL MONUMENT.   CURRENTLY NO FACILITIES EXIST ALONG THIS POPULAR MULTI-USE TRAIL WHICH ALSO ACCESSES AN UNDEVELOPED HIKING AREA. THE WORK INCLUDES GROUNDWORK TO PREPARE THE AREA AND TRANSPORTING AND INSTALLING A SINGLE VAULT TOILET, AN INFORMATIONAL KIOSK, AND A TRASH RECEPTACLE.  LOCATION IS AT A PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED BUT NOW LARGELY UNUSABLE CAMPGROUND SITE.

PROJECT TITLE: TREAD LIGHTLY! NEVADA 2022 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL DESIGN, PRINT, AND DISTRIBUTE 200 EDUCATIONAL POSTERS FOR USE AT TRAILHEADS, KIOSKS, AND TRAIL-SIDES OF STATE PARKS AND PUBLIC LANDS TO PROMOTE ETHICAL USE OF THE TRAILS AND PROVIDE CONSISTENT MESSAGING ACROSS BOUNDARIES. TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL UTILIZE ITS EXISTING NATIONAL POSTER PROGRAM TO RECEIVE AND PROCESS ORDERS. TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL ALSO UTILIZE ITS EXISTING SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING PLAN FOR THE NATIONAL POSTER PROGRAM TO ANNOUNCE THE AVAILABILITY OF EDUCATIONAL POSTERS TO THE NEVADA RECREATION COMMUNITY.

THE TUNNEL CREEK ALTERNATIVE TRAIL IS A 2.28-MILE MULTI-USE NON-MOTORIZED TRAIL LOCATED WITHIN LAKE TAHOE NEVADA STATE PARK THAT WILL PROVIDE USERS WITH A SAFER ALTERNATIVE FROM THE CURRENT TUNNEL CREEK ROAD TO ACCESS THE EAST SHORE TRAIL FROM THE POPULAR MARLETTE AND INCLINE FLUME TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: GIANT CITY - POST OAK TRAIL REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: GIANT CITY -THE POST OAK HIKING TRAIL AT GIANT CITY STATE PARK WAS ORIGINALLY DEVELOPED AROUND 1980 AND WAS INTENDED TO BE AN ACCESSIBLE HIKING TRAIL.  THE TRAIL IS ABOUT 1/3 MILE IN LENGTH AND TRAVERSES THE TOP OF A LARGE SANDSTONE BLUFF WITH COMMANDING VIEWS OF AN ADJOINING VALLEY.  IN 2019 AND 2021, IDNR UNDERTOOK REPAIRS TO REPLACE THE TRAIL SURFACE WITH A CONCRETE SIDEWALK 5 FT. WIDE.  THERE ARE FIVE (5) SMALL WOOD DECKS ON THE TRAIL THAT CROSS EXPOSED BEDROCK AND ONE (1) WOOD VIEWING DECK THAT DATE FROM THE ORIGINAL CONSTRUCTION THAT NEED REPLACED.  IN 2021, TWO (2) OF THE WOOD DECKS WERE REPLACED WITH NEW DECKS.  THAT LEAVES REMAINING THREE (3) DECKS AND ONE (1) VIEWING DECK TO BE REPLACED.  IN ADDITION, THE EXISTING PARKING AREA IS ON OLD SANDSTONE PAVERS THAT ARE ROUGH AND NOT COMPLIANT WITH ADA STANDARDS.  THE PARKING NEEDS TO BE RENOVATED WITH NEW PAVEMENT TO IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY AND REMOVE A TRIP HAZARDS.  UPON COMPLETION OF PH. 3, THE ENTIRE TRAIL WILL MEET ILLINOIS ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS AND BE ONE OF THE FEW ADA HIKING TRAILS IN ALL OF SOUTHERN ILLINOIS.

PROJECT TITLE: FERNE CLYFFE STATE PARK- ROUND BLUFF TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FERNE CLYFFE -ROUND BLUFF IS A ONE-MILE-LONG TRAIL WITHIN THE 53 ACRE ROUND BLUFF NATURE PRESERVE AT FERNE CLYFFE STATE PARK.  THE TRAIL TRAVERSES SOME STEEP SLOPES AND SANDSTONE OUTCROPS AT THE BASE OF ROUND BLUFF. AT THREE LOCATIONS, LONG WOODEN STAIRWAYS WERE BUILT IN THE 1980S TO NEGOTIATE SOME STEEP INCLINES.  THE STAIRWAYS HAVE NUMEROUS ROTTED SUPPORT POSTS AND STRUCTURAL PIECES THAT ARE SPLIT AND DECAYED.  THERE IS ONE SHORT BRIDGE ABOUT 20' IN LENGTH THAT NEEDS A NEW RAILING SYSTEM AND DECKING INSTALLED.  THERE ARE NUMEROUS WOOD TIMBERS USED AS A EITHER STEPS OR WATER BARS THAT BECAUSE OF EROSION, ARE MORE OF TRIP HAZARDS.  HIKERS ARE CIRCUMVENTING THE TIMBERS AND CAUSING TRAIL BRAIDING AND RESOURCE DAMAGE.   THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE ALL THREE (3) OF THE LONG WOODEN STEP ASSEMBLIES WITH NEW CONSTRUCTION IN THE SAME LOCATION AS THE EXISTING.  THE ONE BRIDGE WILL GET NEW RAILING AND DECKING.  AT ONE LOCATION, A NEW SET OF STEPS SHOULD BE BUILT WHERE THE TERRAIN IS EXTREMELY STEEP AND TO KEEP HIKERS CONFINED TO THE DESIRED ALIGNMENT.   NEW TIMBER WATER BARS OR ROLLING GRADE DIPS WILL BE INSTALLED WHERE NEEDED THROUGHOUT THE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: ARGYLE LAKE STATE PARK TRAIL REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ARGYLE LAKE -THIS PROJECT WILL MAKE REPAIRS TO THE EXISTING 0.6 MILE 'LAKE SHORE TRAIL' AT ARGYLE STATE PARK. THE LAKE SHORE TRAIL IS A PRIMITIVE HIKING TRAIL WITH A +/- T HE PROJECT WILL REPLACE FIVE (5) SETS OF WOODEN STAIRS, AND 3 EXISTING WOODEN BRIDGES.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION OF FOUR (4) NEW WOODEN BOARDWALKS IN LOW LYING WET AREAS.  THREE OF THE FIVE EXISTING WOOD STAIRWAYS WILL BE REPLACE WITH STONE STEPS INSTEAD OF WOOD AS SHOWN IN THE ATTACHED MAP. THREE-FOOT WIDE BARE-EARTH WALKING SURFACE. THE PROJECT IS REQUESTING RTP FUNDS FOR ALL LABOR AND MATERIALS TO REPLACE THESE STRUCTURES, AS WELL AS ANY DESIGN FEES NECESSARY TO PREPARE AND BID THE PROJECT

PROJECT TITLE: DELTA RIVER WALK TRAILS II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT THREE NEW TRAILS:
1. CONNECTOR TRAIL (270 FT) THAT JOINTS EXISTING LOOPING TRAIL SYSTEM WITH DIKE TRAIL, AND
2. LOOKOUT TRAIL (350 FT) THAT  LOOPS FROM  DIKE TRAIL TO THE LOOKOUT SITE AND  BACK TO DIKE TRAIL. 
3. PICNIC AREA TRAIL (170 FT) THAT  LOOPS AROUND OUTSIDE LIMIT OF PICNIC AREA AND PROVIDES ACCESS TO IT.

FINAL TREAD WILL BE IMPROVED ON 1,100 FT OF EXISTING DIKE TRAIL AND FROM THE GATE OF RIVER WALK PARK ENTRANCE TO THE CONNECTOR TRAIL. THIS PROJECT WILL CLEAR VEGETATION AND COMPACT NATIVE SOIL AT SUNDIAL/PICNIC AREA. 

TASK 1: ESTABLISH GRANT AGREEMENT. [2 WEEKS]
TASK 2: DJTA ADVERTISE AND AWARD CONTRACT. [6 WEEKS]
TASK 3: CONTRACTOR BEGINS CONSTRUCTION. [8 WEEKS]
TASK 4: PROJECT CLOSEOUT, GRANTS CLOSEOUT. [4 WEEKS]
TOTAL 20 WEEKS PLUS CONTINGENCY DUE TO WEATHER AND  SUPPLY CHAIN ISSUES.

PROJECT TITLE: EKLUTNA LAKE TRAILHEAD IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE EKLUTNA LAKE TRAILHEAD IN CHUGACH STATE PARK. THE TRAILHEAD IS ONE OF THE PRIMARY YEAR-ROUND ACCESS POINT INTO THE BACKCOUNTRY OF EKLUTNA LAKE AND CHUGACH STATE PARK. IMPROVEMENTS WILL  INCLUDE PAVING APPROXIMATELY 40,000 SQ. FT OF EXISTING DRIVEWAY AND PARKING AREA, STRIPING THE FINISHED PAVEMENT, CONSTRUCTION OF NEW ORIENTATION KIOSK, AND REPLACING SITE SIGNAGE AS NEEDED.

PROJECT TITLE: CARIBOU LAKE TRAIL REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PROJECT WILL REHABILITATE SEVERELY DEGRADED CARIBOU LAKE TRAIL, KNOWN LOCALLY AS BOARDWALK TRAIL. THE PROJECT ADDRESSES  THE FIRST 1.9 MILES OF TRAIL, OR TRAIL SEGMENT 1 AND ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CLEARING 24-FEET WIDE TRAIL CORRIDOR, INSTALLATION OF HEAVY DUTY GEOTEXTILE, AND IMPORT OF 8 INCHES OF SIZED ROAD TOPPING FOR 8-FEET WIDE TRAIL BED, AND TAPERED TO 6-FEET WIDE FINISHED TRAIL TREAD. REHABILITATION OF CARIBOU LAKE TRAIL WILL BE DIVIDED  INTO THREE EXECUTION PHASES: 0, 1, AND 2.

PROJECT TITLE: BIRD CREEK VALLEY TRAILHEAD IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE BIRD CREEK VALLEY T RAILHEAD LOCATED WITHIN THE BIRD CREEK REGIONAL PARK, OWNED BY THE MUNICIPALITY OF ANCHORAGE AND MANAGED BY DPOR UNDER COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. WITH THIS PROJECT  THE FOLLOWING IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE MADE: REGRADING AND RESURFACING 28,000 SQ.FT OF PARKING AREA; INSTALLATION OF A VAULTED TOILET; CONSTRUCTION OF ORIENTATION KIOSK; CONSTRUCTION OF ATV LOADING RAMP; INSTALLATION OF PICNIC TABLES AND BARRIER ROCKS; AND CHANGING SITE SIGNAGE AS NEEDED.

PROJECT TITLE: RUSSIAN JACK MOUNTAIN BIKE TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A MILE LONG, TWO-WAY PERIMETER TRAIL FOR MOUNTAIN BIKE RIDING  AT RUSSIAN JACK PARK ON THE EAST SIDE OF ANCHORAGE WITH CONNECTIONS TO CHESTER CREEK TRAIL AND GREENBELT TRAIL SYSTEM.  THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON CREATING A TRAIL SYSTEM THAT INCLUDES A SPECIAL SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AREA UNIQUELY DESIGNED FOR THE SAFE PROGRESSION OF MOUNTAIN BIKING SKILLS. WITH THIS PROJECT SIGNAGE WILL BE  INSTALLED  TO ENSURE WAY FINDING AND SAFE RIDING.

PROJECT TITLE: CHINA POOT LAKE TRAIL - FLOOD REROUTE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KACHEMAK STATE PARK PLANS TO RE-ROUTE 700-FOOT SECTION OF THE CHINA POOT TRAIL THAT IS FLOODED DUE TO A PERMANENT CHANGE OF COURSE OF A STREAM. 

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE NEW TRAIL ALIGNMENT WITH TREAD CONSTRUCTION, BRIDGE CONSTRUCTION, AND TUMPIKE CONSTRUCTION WITH CROSS DRAINS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO FINISH CONSTRUCTION OF TWO EXISTING LOG BRIDGES THAT WERE BUILT IN 2020 AND 2022 IN THE FLOODED AREA OF THE CHINA POOT LAKE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: HALEY CREEK TRAIL TERMINUS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS SANITATION, PARKING, EROSION CONTROL, PROTECTIONS FOR STREAM BANK AND HISTORIC PROPERTIES, SAFETY AND MANEUVERING ISSUES AT HALEY CREEK IN THE CHITNA AREA. PROJECT WILL INSTALL NEW SANITATION FACILITIES AND DECOMMISSION OLD OUTHOUSE; INSTALL STREAM BANK HABITAT PROTECTION BOARDWALKS AND SIGNAGE; CREATE A SAFE TURN-AROUND POINT AND PARKING AREA AT THE HALEY CREEK TRAIL END; AND CREATE A PLAN FOR PHASE 2 TO INSTALL EROSION CONTROL MEASURES TO PROTECT INFRASTRUCTURE AND THE HISTORIC HALEY CREEK TRESTLE, AS WELL AS PLAN FOR ADDITIONAL CAMPING AND DAY USE AREAS.

PROJECT TITLE: TAHOE-PYRAMID TRAIL - SPARKS TO MUSTANG PLANNING AND DESIGN :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TAHOE-PYRAMID TRAIL STRETCHES OVER FIFTY-NINE (59) MILES FROM TAHOE CITY, CA TO SPARKS, NV. THE TAHOE-PYRAMID TRAIL GROUP WILL USE RTP FUNDS TO ASSIST WITH PLANNING AND DESIGN ACTIVITIES FOR THE NEXT TRAIL SECTION, WHICH IS FIVE (5) MILES FROM SPARKS TO MUSTANG AND WILL CONNECT RENO/SPARKS TO THE TAHOE RENO INDUSTRIAL CENTER (TRIC).

PROJECT TITLE: TAMARACK LAKE TRAIL EXTENSION - PLANNING AND CLEARANCES :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE BIGGEST LITTLE TRAIL STEWARDSHIP (BLTS), IN COLLABORATION WITH THE U.S. FOREST SERVICE, WILL CONDUCT PLANNING OF ROUTE CORRIDOR AND TRAIL ALIGNMENT FOR THE EXTENSION OF THE EXISTING TAMARACK LAKE TRAIL FROM NEAR MT. ROSE SKI AREA TO THE GALENA CREEK PARK TRAIL NETWORK. PLANNING AND CLEARANCE ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO BE COMPLETED FOR FUTURE CONSTRUCTION OF UP TO 7.5 MILES OF MULTI-USE, NON-MOTORIZED SINGLE TRACK TRAILS THAT CONNECT RENO/TRUCKEE MEADOWS WITH THE TAHOE BASIN.

PROJECT TITLE: DESERT PEACH TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CARSON CITY WILL CONSTRUCT APPROXIMATELY 2 MILES OF NEW NONMOTORIZED, MULTI-USE, SINGLE-TRACK TRAIL TO CONNECT THE 5TH STREET LOOP TRAILS WITH THE NORTH LOOP ON THE PRISON HILL RECREATION AREA IN CARSON CITY. THE 5TH STREET LOOP TRAILS WAS ORIGINALLY CONSTRUCTED AS PART OF RTP GRANT 2016-13 - PRISON HILL RECREATION AREA-5TH STREET TRAILHEAD AND TRAILS PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: RED ROCK CANYON TRAIL MAINTENANCE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE (GBI), IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT (BLM) RED ROCK CANYON NCA, PROPOSES TO COMPLETE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ON NONMOTORIZED TRAILS THROUGH RED ROCK CANYON SCENIC LOOP AND CALICO BASIN. WITH EXTREMELY HEAVY USE, TRAIL MAINTENANCE IS REQUIRED TO ADDRESS USER SAFETY AND HABITAT DEGRADATION. DURING TRAILS MAINTENANCE CONDUCTED AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, GBI AND BLM WILL WORK TOGETHER TO PRIORITIZE INDIVIDUAL TRAILS BASED ON CURRENT CONDITIONS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE TO COMPLETE MAINTENANCE ON UP TO 20 MILES OF TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: HUMBOLDT-TOIYABE TRAIL MAINTENANCE - PHASE 2 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE (GBI) PROPOSES TO COMPLETE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ON RECREATIONAL TRAILS WITHIN THE RUBY MOUNTAIN, CARSON, ELY, AUSTIN-TONOPAH, AND SANTA ROSA DISTRICTS, AS WELL AS THE SPRING MOUNTAINS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA. MAINTENANCE PROJECTS WILL FOCUS ON IMPROVING USER ACCESS AND SAFETY, AS WELL AS IMPROVING TRAIL SUSTAINABILITY. PROJECTS INCLUDE BRUSHING AND CLEARING THE TRAIL CORRIDOR, IMPROVING TRAIL TREAD, AND ADDRESSING AREAS IMPACTED BY EROSION.

PROJECT TITLE: WILDERNESS TOIYABE CREST TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE TOIYABE CREST NATIONAL RECREATION TRAIL (TCT) IN ARC DOME WILDERNESS OF THE HUMBOLDT-TOIYABE NATIONAL FOREST. FRIENDS OF NEVADA WILDERNESS, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE USFS, PROPOSES MAINTAINING UP TO 30 MILES OF THE TCT WITHIN THE WILDERNESS BOUNDARY AND SELECT ACCESS TRAILS. BASIC MAINTENANCE WOULD INCLUDE BRUSHING, CLEARING DOWNED TREES, REPAIRING ROCK STRUCTURES, MAINTAINING DRAINAGE FEATURES, AND TREAD MAINTENANCE TO USFS STANDARDS.

PROJECT TITLE: JARBIDGE RECREATION MAP :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FRIENDS OF NEVADA WILDERNESS (FNW) WILL PRODUCE AND PRINT A JARBIDGE WILDERNESS RECREATION MAP. THIS WILL OCCUR THROUGH ON-THE-GROUND DATA COLLECTION, PROCESSING AND DESIGN WORK THAT WILL TAKE PLACE DURING 2022 AND 2023 WITH THE UNITED STATES FOREST SERVICE (USFS) PROVIDING CONSULTATION. ALL DATA COLLECTED WILL BE SHARED WITH APPROPRIATE AGENCY PARTNERS AND WILL PROMOTE RECREATION IN CONJUNCTION WITH A GREAT AMERICAN OUTDOORS ACT (GAOA) FUNDED USFS EFFORT TO IMPROVE ROADS, TRAIL ACCESS, AND TRAILHEADS IN THE JARBIDGE WILDERNESS AREA.

PROJECT TITLE: SIERRA VISTA PARK - PHASE 2 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: BIGGEST LITTLE TRAIL STEWARDSHIP (BLTS) WILL CONSTRUCT APPROXIMATELY 1.0 MILE OF NEW BEGINNER/INTERMEDIATE SINGLE-TRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING TRAILS AT SIERRA VISTA PARK (RENO) TO PROVIDE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN TRAILS AND ACCESS POINTS; PERFORM 0.25 MILES OF EXCAVATOR WORK TO ENHANCE EXISTING TRAILS; CONSTRUCT 0.5 MILES OF NEW ADVANCED/INTERMEDIATE FLOW TRAILS INCLUDING THE MOVEMENT OF NATURAL AND IMPORTED SOILS AND CONSTRUCT PROFESSIONALLY MANUFACTURED JUMPS, DROPS, AND BERMS. BLTS WILL ALSO BUILD AN ASPHALT SKILLS TRACK FOR PROGRESSIVE MOUNTAIN BIKE SKILL BUILDING.

PROJECT TITLE: TREAD LIGHTLY! NEVADA 2022 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL DESIGN, PRINT, AND DISTRIBUTE 200 EDUCATIONAL POSTERS FOR USE AT TRAILHEADS, KIOSKS, AND TRAIL-SIDES OF STATE PARKS AND PUBLIC LANDS TO PROMOTE ETHICAL USE OF THE TRAILS AND PROVIDE CONSISTENT MESSAGING ACROSS BOUNDARIES. TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL UTILIZE ITS EXISTING NATIONAL POSTER PROGRAM TO RECEIVE AND PROCESS ORDERS. TREAD LIGHTLY! WILL ALSO UTILIZE ITS EXISTING SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING PLAN FOR THE NATIONAL POSTER PROGRAM TO ANNOUNCE THE AVAILABILITY OF EDUCATIONAL POSTERS TO THE NEVADA RECREATION COMMUNITY.

PROJECT TITLE: ACTIONS. IMPACT. CHOICE.  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE NEVADA OUTDOOR SCHOOL (NOS) WILL CONDUCT A VARIETY OF OUTDOOR EDUCATION CLASSES THROUGHOUT NEVADA DESIGNED FOR YOUTH AND ADULTS AND COVER THREE BROAD AREAS: YOUTH EDUCATION, OUTDOOR ETHICS TRAINING, AND HEALTHY COMMUNITIES. YOUTH PROGRAMS WILL REACH AT LEAST 3,000 STUDENTS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CURRICULA.  THE EDUCATION CURRICULA INCLUDES THE NATURE IN MY WORLD CLASSES, NATURE AFTER SCHOOL AND NATURE AT NOON PROGRAMS AND NATURE EXPLORER SUMMER CAMPS PROVIDING OUTDOOR SKILLS TRAINING, HIKING, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH. OUTDOOR ETHICS FOCUSSES ON THE DELIVERY OF LEAVE NO TRACE AND TREAD LIGHTLY! CURRICULA TO OHV COMMUNITIES. COMMUNITY EDUCATION IS BASED AROUND THE LONGSTANDING NOS ROAD SHOW CONCEPT.

PROJECT TITLE: NEVADA MAPPING COLLABORATIVE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE WILL UTILIZE FUNDING FOR THE FINAL PHASE OF THE MAPPING COLLABORATIVE PROJECT FOR ADDITIONAL TRAIL MAPPING TO FILL IN DATA GAPS, PRODUCE FINAL MAPS AND DEVELOP A TRANSITION PLAN TO MOVE THE DATABASE FROM GBI TO THE STATE OF NEVADA.

PROJECT TITLE: ROSEWOOD LAKE NATURE STUDY AREA INTERPRETIVE LOOP :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TRUCKEE MEADOWS PARKS FOUNDATION WILL RESTORE APPROXIMATELY 2.5 MILES OF PATHS ON THE FORMER ROSEWOOD LAKES GOLF COURSE TO NATURE TRAILS; AN ADDITIONAL 0.5 MILES OF NEW TRAILS WILL ALSO BE CONSTRUCTED.

PROJECT TITLE: DAYS RIVER 24.5 RD DAYS RIVER, BRAMPTON TWP, DELTA COUNTY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: NEW TRAIL DEVELOPMENT: APPROXIMATELY 10 MILES OF NEW SINGLE TRACK TRAIL BROKEN INTO FIVE NEW LOOPS.  THE TRAILS WILL BE OPEN TO BOTH BIKING AND HIKING AND ARE PROPOSED IN A MANNER TO AVOID ECOLOGICALLY SENSITIVE AREAS, CAPTURE UNIQUE TERRAIN, ADD TO THE OVERALL QUALITY OF THE TRAIL EXPERIENCE AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SINGLE TRACK RIDING OPPORTUNITIES. MOUNTAIN BIKE TRAIL AS IDENTIFIED IN THE TRAIL PROPOSAL WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT THE FOLLOWING ACTIONS, CONDITIONS, AND TRAIL MODIFICATIONS ARE IMPLEMENTED. NEW TRAIL WILL BE ROUTED ONTO EXISTING TRAIL TO MINIMIZE WATER CROSSINGS AND TO AVOID WET AREAS EXCEPT WHERE NEW STREAM CROSSINGS ARE APPROVED.   CURRENTLY, THE REVISED PROPOSAL WILL REQUIRE 2 NEW CROSSINGS WITH APPROXIMATELY 80' OF DECKING AT EACH CROSSING SITE. DAYS RIVER, BRAMPTON TWP, DELTA COUNTY - PROJECT SITE IS LOCATED EAST OF M-35 AND NORTH OF DAYS RIVER 24.5 ROAD.

PROJECT TITLE: HAANPAA SIDNAW-BERGLAND RAIL TRAIL, INTERIOR TWP, ONTONAGON CO. :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REPLACE THE EXISTING BRIDGE DECK AND REHABILITATE THE BRIDGE PIERS/FOOTINGS.  ONE PART OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REPLACE THE BRIDGE DECK. THIS BRIDGE DESIGN WILL INCORPORATE THE INSTALLATION OF TWO VIEWING PLATFORMS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STRUCTURE FOR THE SAFE VIEWING OF THE FALLS. THE SECOND PART OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REHABILITATE THE BRIDGE PIERS/FOOTINGS PER APPROVED SHPO DESIGNS COMPLETED. SIDNAW-BERGLAND RAIL TRAIL, INTERIOR TWP, ONTONONGAN - AGATE FALLS BRIDGE LOCATED NORTH OF M-28 ON THE ONTONAGON RIVER

VARIOUS CULVERT LOCATIONS ALONG THE SIDNAW-BERGLAND RAIL TRAIL IN INTERIOR AND DUNCAN TOWNSHIPS WITHIN HOUGHTON & ONTONAGON COUNTIES.

PROJECT TITLE: MICHIGAN AIRLI MALT, WIXOM RD TO CITY BORDER, HVT TWP. BORDER TO OLD PLANK :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE CITY OF WIXOM, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH MILFORD TOWNSHIP, WILL CONSTRUCT AN EXTENSION OF THE MICHIGAN AIR LINE TRAIL AND THE HURON VALLEY TRAIL.  THE NEW SECTION OF NONMOTORIZED PATHWAY WILL BE CONSTRUCTED FROM WIXOM ROAD TO OLD PLANK ROAD; APPROXIMATELY 2.4 MILES.  ON THE EAST, THE TRAIL WILL CONNECT TO THE EXISTING MICHIGAN AIR LINE TRAIL AND CROSS WIXOM ROAD WHERE A HAWK BEACON WILL BE INSTALLED TO PROVIDE AN IMPROVED PEDESTRIAN ACTIVATED CROSSING.  THE 10-FOOT WIDE SHARED-USE PATH WILL THEN HEAD SOUTH, THROUGH MACK PARK AND CROSS OVER THE ACTIVE RAILROAD AND CONTINUE WEST ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF PONTIAC TRAIL.  FROM WIXOM ROAD TO MANISTEE STREET, THE TRAIL WILL CONSIST OF A TWO-WAY CYCLE TRACK ADJACENT TO THE SIDEWALK.  FROM MANISTEE STREET TO THE WEST, THE TRAIL WILL REVERT TO A 10-FOOT WIDE SHARED USE PATH ON THE NORTH SIDE OF PONTIAC TRAIL.  ONCE PAST NORTON CREEK, THE SHARED-USE PATH WILL HEAD NORTH FOR A SHORT DISTANCE AND THEN IT WILL CURVE AND CONTINUE TO THE WEST ALONG THE FORMER RAILROAD LINE.  THE NEW SECTION OF TRAIL WILL CROSS OVER OLD PLANK ROAD WITH THE INSTALLATION OF AN RRFB AND CONNECT TO THE EXISTING HURON VALLEY TRAIL.  ;MICHIGAN AIRLINE TRAIL FROM WIXOM ROAD TO WIXOM CITY BORDER; HURON VALLEY TRAIL FROM MILFORD TOWNSHIP BORDER TO OLD PLANK ROAD; ,

THE TRAIL WILL THEN FOLLOW THE RAILROAD GRADE TO THE PORTAGE RIVER BRIDGE AND THE HAWKENS ROAD TRAIL HEAD. WORK WILL INCLUDE A PAVED NON-MOTORIZED PATH ALONG PARNALL ROAD AND A GRAVEL SURFACED PATH BETWEEN THE MDOC PROPERTY AND THE PORTAGE RIVER BRIDGE.;PARNALL RD/M-106 INTERSECTION TO PORTAGE RIVER BRIDGE, WEST OF HAWKENS RD IN JACKSON COUNTY; ,

B) THE TRAIL PROJECT IMPROVEMENT AREA TO BE GRADED TO MEET SAFE TOPOGRAPHIC AND DRAINAGE CONDITIONS, AND AS NEEDED UPGRADED SUBSURFACE DRAINAGE CONNECTIONS. PROJECT TITLE: PIERRE PART BAYOU TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: ESTABLISHMENT OF PIERRE PART BAYOU TRAILS WILL REQUIRE TWO TRAILHEADS LOCATED ALONG A 1.3 MILE PADDLE TRAIL. BANK ALONG BAYOU PIERRE PART WILL BE STABILIZED AND LAND EROSION RECOVERED BY INSTALLING 250' OF BULKHEAD PROVIDING A STAGING AREA TO UNLOAD PADDLE EQUIPMENT. A FLOATING 15'X30' ADA AND WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE DOCK WITH 2 LAUNCH SLOTS WILL BE PLACED PARALLEL TO THE BULKHEAD WITH ACCESS VIA GANGWAY. 8 PARKING SPACES INCLUDING HANDICAP WILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE STREET, FROM THE DOCK WITH A STAGING AREA AS WELL. A SECOND 15'X20' ADA FLOATING DOCK WITH 1 LAUNCH SLOT WILL BE INSTALLED 1.3 MILES AWAY PARALLEL TO THE EXISTING BULKHEADED LAND ON BAYOU PIERRE PART. ACCESS FOR BOTH FLOATING DOCK LAUNCHES IS VIA SMALL GANGWAYS.

PROJECT TITLE: NEW IBERIA HISTORIC DISTRICTS TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THIS PROJECT IS A PEDESTRIAN WALKWAY AND WILL INCLUDE CONNECTING WALKS, LED LIGHTING POLES, WAYFINDING SIGNAGE, TRAILHEAD MAPS AND CROSSWALK STRIPING ALONG EAST AND WEST MAIN ST. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO CONNECT ADJOINING NATIONAL REGISTER DISTRICTS IN ORDER TO CREATE A PEDESTRIAN WALKING TRAIL WITH A GRADE LEVEL REINFORCED ADA COMPLIANT SIDEWALK SYSTEM THAT WILL BE WELL LIT, LANDSCAPED AND PROPERLY DRAINED. IN ADDITION, NEW CONSTRUCTION WILL BE ALONG THE WESTERN FENCE LINE OF THE SHADOW-ON-THE- TECHE WHERE THERE IS PRESENTLY NO PATH OR SIDEWALK ALONG N. WEEKS ST. TO EAST MAIN ST. THE TRAIL WOULD THEN MEET AN EXISTING SIDEWALK ALONG BLOCKS (100- 900) EAST MAIN ST. AND BLOCKS (100-200) WEST MAIN ST.

PROJECT TITLE: RAMSEY LAKE STATE PARK - TRAIL REHABILITATION  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE BLACKBERRY HIKING TRAIL AT THE SITE HAS FALLEN INTO DISREPAIR AND NEEDS TO BE REHABILITATED.  THE TRAIL IS LOCATED ON THE WEST SIDE OF RAMSEY LAKE AND IS APPROXIMATELY 1.2 MILES IN LENGTH AND CONNECTS TWO DAY USE AREAS TOGETHER.  PARTS OF THE TRAIL UTILIZE AN ABANDONED ROAD SYSTEM.  EXISTING TRAILHEADS WITH PARKING AND RESTROOMS ARE ALREADY IN PLACE TO SUPPORT THE TRAIL DEVELOPMENT.   THE REPAIR WORK WILL CONSIST OF LIGHT GRADING, INSTALLATION OF CULVERTS WHERE NEEDED, DIVERSION BERMS TO DIRECT WATER OFF THE TRAIL WHERE NEEDED AND LIGHT REINFORCEMENT OF THE FINISHED TREAD WITH AGGREGATES.  THE AREA IN WHICH THE TRAIL IS LOCATED IS MOSTLY OAK-HICKORY FOREST AND MOST IF NOT ALL OF THE EXPECTED VEGETATIVE DISTURBANCE WILL BE CONFINED TO SMALL UNDERSTORY OR SHRUBS LESS THAN 6” DIA.  THE TRAIL WILL ALSO PROVIDE ACCESS TO STAFF CONDUCTING PRESCRIBED BURNING WHICH IS USED ON THIS AREA FREQUENTLY.  LIGHT GRADING IS REMOVING 2-3' OF FOREST FLUFF PRIOR TO INSTALLATION OF AGGREGATES.  THE TRAIL WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 6' WIDE.  THIS PROJECT HAS BEEN CERP REVIEWED AND APPROVED AT LEAST 2 PRIOR OCCASIONS.

PROJECT TITLE: WELDON SPRINGS STATE PARK TRAIL REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ENGINEERING SERVICES TO PREPARE PLANS TO REPLACE BRIDGE #1 AND BRIDGE #4 , AND A STAIRWAY ON THE LAKE TRAIL.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR ALL CONSTRUCTION ENGINEERING, MATERIALS, AND LABOR NECESSARY TO REMOVE & REPLACE TWO BRIDGE #1 AND BRIDGE #4  AND A STAIRWAY. THE PROJECT WILL BE BID THROUGH THE IDNR PROCUREMENT PROCESS AND CONTRACTED LABOR WILL PERFORM NEEDED REPAIRS ON THE FOOTBRIDGES AND TRAIL SURFACES

PROJECT TITLE: WAYNE FITZGERRELL STATE PARK - BIKE TRAIL REHABILITATION  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE BIKE TRAIL IS ABOUT 4.0 MILES IN LENGTH AND SERVES AS A PART OF THE GREATER REND LAKE BIKE TRAIL SYSTEM, A NATIONAL RECREATIONAL TRAIL.  THE WAYNE FITZGERRELL BIKE TRAIL CONNECTS REND LAKE COLLEGE WITH A STATE PARK AND THE TRAIL WILL BE CONNECTED WITH A SOON TO BE CONSTRUCTED TRAIL SECTION THAT IDOT WILL CONSTRUCT TO RUN ALONGSIDE IL RT. 154.   THERE ARE NINE (9) EXISTING STEEL CULVERTS THAT WERE INSTALLED AROUND 1998 AS PART OF THE ORIGINAL TRAIL CONSTRUCTION.  THESE CULVERTS ARE SEVERELY RUSTED AND SOME ARE IN DANGER OF COLLAPSING.  THE CULVERTS WILL BE REPLACED IN THE EXACT SAME LOCATION AND PROFILE AS THE EXISTING EXCEPT THE NEW CULVERTS WILL BE HDPE PLASTIC PIPES TO ENSURE LONGER LIFE.  ALL OF THE BIKE TRAIL IS AGGREGATE SURFACED AND THERE IS ABOUT A 600 L.F. SECTION OF TRAIL ADJOINING REND LAKE THAT IS SUBJECT TO FLOODING.  THIS SECTION OF TRAIL NEEDS TO BE REINFORCED WITH CONCRETE PAVING (10’ WD. X 600’) TO PREVENT GULLYING ON THE TRAIL ENDANGERING BICYCLISTS.  ALL OF THIS CONSTRUCTION WILL OCCUR ON AND WITHIN THE FOOTPRINT OF THE ORIGINAL BIKE TRAIL CONSTRUCTION.  NO RE-ALIGNMENTS OR NEW CONSTRUCTION IS NEEDED.

PROJECT TITLE: LINCOLN TRAIL HOMESTEAD REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF TWO SETS OF WOODEN STAIRWAYS AND REPAIR OR REPLACE THEM.  THE PROJECT WILL STABILIZE EROSION THAT IS OCCURRING AROUND AN EXISTING CULVERT AND PROVIDE ROCK ON THE TRAIL SURFACE WHERE NEEDED.  ALSO, SITE AMENITIES INCLUDING ONE GATE, ONE KIOSK, AND 4 BENCHES WITH CONCRETE BASES, WILL BE PROVIDED.

PROJECT TITLE: HENNEPIN CANAL BRIDGES 15/40 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: BRIDGE 15 SPANS THE NORTH AND SOUTH PORTIONS OF THE HENNEPIN CANAL STATE PARKWAY PARK.  THE HISTORIC BRIDGE (IDNR# 006-9914) IS AN IRON TRUSS BRIDGE, 120’ IN LENGTH X 18’ WIDTH, WITH A WOODEN PLANK DECK.  BRIDGE 40 AT LOCK 26 IS LOCATED EAST OF COLONA, ILLINOIS, AND INCLUDES A LIFT BRIDGE TO CROSS THE LOCK. THE HISTORIC BRIDGE (AKA BRIDGE #40 , IDNR #037-3016) IS AN IRON TRUSS LIFT BRIDGE, WITH GEARS, 40’ IN LENGTH X 18’ WIDTH, WITH A WOODEN PLANK DECK. THE DATE OF CONSTRUCTION FOR BOTH BRIDGES IS ASSUMED TO BE IN EARLY 1900’S.  THE DECK PLANKS ARE 4” X 12”, NOMINAL.  WORK WILL INCLUDE REMOVAL OF THE TEMPORARY PLYWOOD COVERING AND THE DETERIORATING BRIDGE DECK PLANKS, AND PROVIDING DECK REPLACEMENT IN KIND; PREPARATION AND RE-PAINTING OF THE PAINTED STEEL BRIDGE TRUSSES TO RESTORE FINISHES AND PROTECT FROM FURTHER RUSTING; SURFACE REPAIRS TO THE CONCRETE ABUTMENTS AND APPROACH PAVEMENTS AT THE BRIDGE INTERFACE  (EITHER ASPHALT PAVEMENT PATCH, EPOXY CRACK FILLING OR OTHER TBD IN DESIGN). THERE IS NO INTENT AT THIS TIME TO RESTORE THE FUNCTION OF THE LIFT GEAR ASSEMBLIES ON BRIDGE 40.

PROJECT TITLE: FOX RIVER EMBARRAS - BIKE TRAIL RESURFACING  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE PROJECT IMPROVEMENTS WOULD ELIMINATE EXISTING HAZARDS AND STABILIZE THE TRAIL SURFACE TO BETTER ACCOMMODATE BICYCLES AND OTHER USERS.
PROJECT TITLE: HENNEPIN CANAL STATE TRAIL  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL INSTALL A HANDICAP ACCESIBLE PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE, AND ACCESSIBLE PARKING SPOT AT THE LOCK 31 DAY USE AREA.

PROJECT TITLE: BLACKHAWK STATE HISTORIC SITE - RIVER SIDE TRAIL SYSTEM :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE PROJECT WILL REHABILITATE PORTIONS OF THE RIVER SIDE HIKING TRAIL INCLUDING REMOVAL AND REPLACEMENT OF A VIEWING PLATFORM, REPAIR OF SEVERE EROSION AREAS, AND INSTALLATION OF NEW DECKING, STAIRS AND HANDRAILS WHERE NEEDED.  REPAIRS WILL ADDRESS APPROXIMATELY 300 LINEAL FEET OF TRAIL SYSTEM OUT OF +/- 1700’.

PROJECT TITLE: GRAND ILLINOIS TRAIL  AND SUPPORT FACILITY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE ROCK ISLAND COUNTY FOREST PRESERVE DISTRICT PROPOSES TO CLOSE A GAP IN THE GRAND ILLINOIS
TRAIL AND RECONSTRUCT A RESTROOM FACILITY IN ILLINIWEK FOREST PRESERVE. THE 10-FOOT SEPARATED
TRAIL WILL CONNECT TO EXISTING SEPARATED TRAILS ON THE NORTH AND SOUTH ENDS OF THE PARK. THE RESTROOM WILL REPLACE THE OUTDATED EXISTING FACILITY THAT WAS BUILT IN 1973.

PROJECT TITLE: MCCORMICK RAVINE RECREATION TRAIL AND PRESERVE ACCESS IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A 1.38-MILE TRAIL SYSTEM MADE OF A COMBINATION OF CRUSHED AGGREGATE, BOARDWALK, AND MULCH WITH AN AVERAGE WIDTH OF 72” THROUGH A HIGH-QUALITY NATURAL AREA PEPPERED WITH A COMPLICATED WETLAND COMPLEX. THERE WILL BE A 120’ SUSPENSION BRIDGE THAT CONNECTS THE PRESERVE USERS WITH THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE SITE. AN EXISTING FAILED TRAIL SYSTEM WILL BE REMOVED OR REPLACED.

PROJECT TITLE: LAKE JACKSONVILLE RECREATION TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PROJECT CONSISTS OF INSTALLING A NEW 0.5 MILE 10’ WIDE ASPHALT PATH AND A 60’ BRIDGE OVER THE OUTFALL CREEK FROM THE SPILLWAY AT LAKE JACKSONVILLE. THE PROPOSED PATH AND BRIDGE WILL BE CONNECTED TO THE EXISTING 2.0 MILE ASPHALT PATH THAT THE CITY HAS ALREADY COMPLETED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE LAKE. THE PROPOSED PATH WILL CONNECT BOTH SIDES OF THE LAKE.

PROJECT TITLE: PRATT'S WAYNE WOODS TRAIL: WEST TRAIL TO LAKE TRAIL CONNECTOR :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PROJECT INVOLVES CONVERTING 0.3 MILES OF EXISTING 14’ WIDE TURF TRAIL WEST OF CAMP PRAIRIE TO A 10’
WIDE LIMESTONE SURFACED MULTIPURPOSE TRAIL WITH 2’ TURF SHOULDERS THAT WILL COMPLETE A PAVED LOOP
TRAIL BETWEEN WEST TRAIL AND LAKE TRAIL, IMPROVING YEAR-ROUND USE FOR VISITORS.

PROJECT TITLE: TINLEY CREEK TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE FOREST PRESERVE DISTRICT OF COOK COUNTY PROPOSES TO CONDUCT SURFACE REPAIRS ON 3 MILES OF THE TINLEY CREEK TRAIL AND IMPROVE ADA ACCESS AT TWO TRAILHEAD PARKING LOTS. IT ALSO INCLUDES REPAVING OF THE 151ST STREET TRAILHEAD PARKING LOT AND UPGRADED PORTABLE BATHROOMS TO BETTER ACCOMMODATE ADA USERS.

PROJECT TITLE: LEGENDS OF SUPERIOR TRAIL; IN PINAL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TRAILER ALLOW THE MAINTENANCE CREWS TO GET TO THE TRAILS MORE EFFICIENTLY, WHILE SERVICING MORE TRAILS, WHERE THE CREW WILL IDENTIFY ANY NEEDED TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS, REPAIR EROSION WHICH MIGHT POSE A DANGER, CLEAR DEBRIS, AND MAINTAIN SAFE, CLEAN,
QUALITY TRAILS AND RECREATION FOR ALL VISITORS. THE TRAINING, BY A TRAIL CONSULTANT, WILL BE HELD FOR 2 DAYS AND INCLUDE BOTH CLASSROOM AND OUTDOOR EDUCATION. THE TRAINING WILL INCLUDE TOOL SELECTION, FIRST AID, EQUIPMENT OPERATING TECHNIQUES, TRAIL DESIGN, MAINTENANCE AND TEAM COORDINATION. THE TOOLS PURCHASED WILL PROVIDE THE CREW WITH THE CORRECT IMPLEMENTS NEEDED FOR TRAIL WORK, AND THE HANDS ON TRAINING WILL TEACH PROPER USAGE, SELECTION OF TOOLS AND PREVENT INJURY. THIS SAFETY AND EDUCATION PROGRAM GRANT, WILL ENSURE THAT MORE TRAILS BE EFFICIENTLY MAINTAINED AND RESTORED, WHILE PROVIDING THE VOLUNTEER MAINTENANCE CREW WITH PROPER SAFETY STANDARDS, KNOWLEDGE AND THE CORRECT EQUIPMENT TO SUSTAIN THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT.

PROJECT TITLE: USFS HIGH BANK TRAILHEAD IMPVTS. (RTP-19) (S) :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: INSTALLATION OF A VAULT TOILET, TRASH RECEPTACLE, AND THE EXPANSION OF THE PARKING LOT AT HIGH BANK TRAILHEAD.

PROJECT TITLE: ADPT PINNACLE MT. STATE PARK SHARED-USE PATH (RTP-17) (S) :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TO CONSTRUCT A NEW 10' WIDE CONCRETE AND ASPHALT MULTI-USE TRAIL IN PINNACLE MOUNTAIN STATE PARK ALONG THE LITTLE MAUMELLE RIVER BETWEEN WEST SUMMIT PICNIC AREA AND THE ARKANSAS ARBORETUM.

PROJECT TITLE: WETLAND TRAIL (MAUMELLE) (RTP-15) (S) :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TO CONSTRUCT APPROXIMATELY 2,950' OF 8' WIDE GRAVEL TRAIL AND A PIER ON WHITE OAK BAYOU BEHIND THE MAUMELLE MIDDLE SCHOOL IN PULASKI CO.

PROJECT TITLE: CAHABA RIVER PARK TRAIL EXPANSION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCT A TRAILHEAD PAVILION AND APPROXIMATELY 9.5 MILES OF TRAILS CREATING CONNECTIONS TO EXISTING TRAILS AND PROMOTING A STACKED LOOP SYSTEM AT CAHABA RIVER PARK
PROJECT TITLE: HORSE CREEK TRAIL LIGHTING IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PURCHASE AND INSTALL LIGHTING FOR THE HORSE CREEK TRAIL

PROJECT TITLE: PINHOTI TRAIL INDIAN MOUNTAIN TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCT A 0.28-MILE ACCESS ROAD, TRAILHEAD, AND 2.75-MILE TRAIL TO THE PINHOTI TRAIL ON FOREVER WILD INDIAN MOUNTAIN PROPERTY.

PROJECT TITLE: BRIDGEPORT PARK TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REMOVE THE EXISTING BOAT RAMPS, CONSTRUCT NEW BOAT RAMPS, CONSTRUCT MAKE-READY AND TIE-DOWN LANES, CONSTRUCT A NEW BOAT DOCK, AND PROVIDE ADA COMPLIANT ACCESS TO THE NEW BOAT DOCK. PROJECT SPONSOR - CITY OF CAMDEN

PROJECT TITLE: UPPER HUFFMAN TRAILHEAD IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE ALASKA DIVISION OF PARKS AND OUTDOOR RECREATION (DPOR) IS PROPOSING TO IMPROVE THE UPPER HUFFMAN TRAILHEAD IN CHUGACH STATE PARK. THE TRAILHEAD IS ONE OF THE PRIMARY YEAR-ROUND ACCESS POINTS INTO CHUGACH STATE PARK. THE TRAILHEAD IMPROVEMENTS CONSISTS OF THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS:
1. PAVE APPROXIMATELY 50,000 SQUARE FEET OF EXISTING ROADWAY, PARKING, AND CONNECTOR TRAILS;
2. STRIPING THE FINISHED PAVEMENT; AND
3. REPLACING SITE SIGNAGE AS NEEDED.

PROJECT TITLE: BIRD VALLEY TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE THE BIRD VALLEY TRAIL, A POPULAR ATV AND SNOWMOBILE TRAIL LOCATED IN THE COMMUNITY OF BIRD, ALASKA, TO ITS DESIGN SPECIFICATIONS OUTLINED IN THE CHUGACH STATE PARK MANAGEMENT PLAN. UNDER THIS PROJECT, EXISTING TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SIGNAGE WILL BE UPDATED, AND EQUIPMENT WILL BE PURCHASED FOR CLEARING BRUSH TO MAKE THE RIDE SAFER AND MORE ENJOYABLE FOR USERS.

PROJECT TITLE: EAST COOK INLET ATV USE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PHASE 1 OF THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON AATV USE AT DEEP CREEK SRA. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE AND EXPAND DUNE FENCING, WOOD SLAT FENCING, AND LOG BARRIERS TO IMPROVE ATV BEACH ACCESS LANES TO LESSEN THE IMPACT OF ATV USE ON THE HABITAT - SPECIFICALLY FRAGILE GRASSY DUNE HABITAT AROUND THE CAMPGROUND. BEACH POSTS WITH EMERGENCY LOCATOR INFORMATION AND OTHER SIGNAGE WILL BE ADDED TO PRIMARY BEACH ACCESS AREAS. EXISTING BULLETIN BOARDS AND ONE ORIENTATION KIOSK WILL BE UPDATED TO ADDRESS CONSERVATION CONCERNS. ADDITIONALLY, A SMALL BROCHURE WILL BE CREATED TO INCLUDE ATV SAFETY, REGULATIONS, AND LOCAL IMPACTS.

PROJECT TITLE: PETERS CREEK VALLEY TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE THE PETERS CREEK VALLEY TRAIL, A POPULAR SNOWMOBILE TRAIL, TO ITS DESIGN SPECIFICATIONS OUTLINED IN THE CHUGACH STATE PARK MANAGEMENT PLAN. UNDER THIS PROJECT, EXISTING TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SIGNAGE WILL BE UPDATED, AND EQUIPMENT WILL BE PURCHASED FOR CLEARING BRUSH TO MAKE THE RIDE SAFER AND MORE ENJOYABLE FOR USERS.

PROJECT TITLE: BERRY TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A TRAIL BETWEEN 2 CLIMBING LOCATIONS, BLUEBERRY BLOCK AND RASPBERRY ROCK, CREATING ACCESS FOR BOULDERING AND CLIMBING. MUCH OF THE TRAIL WILL SKIRT THOMPSON LAKE, CREATING ACCESS FOR PEOPLE TO PUT IN KAYAKS AND PADDLE BOARDS, AS WELL AS FISHING THIS STOCKED LAKE.

PROJECT TITLE: DANGER POINT TRAIL RECONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL EXTEND THE CURRENT DANGER POINT TRAIL IN ANGOON, BY ENHANCING AN EXISTING UNDEVELOPED  PATH 0.4 MILES, FROM THE ANGOON CEMETERY TO DANGER POINT PENINSULA. THE ENHANCED GRAVEL TRAIL WITH BE 6FT WIDE, WITH RESTING BENCHES AND INTERPRETIVE SIGNAGE. THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE COMPLETED DANGER POINT TRAIL WILL BE 1.0 MILES.

PROJECT TITLE: MIRROR LAKE MULTI-USE TRAIL REALIGNMENT AND REHAB :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE REHABILITATION AND REALIGNMENT OF THE ENTRANCE SECTION OF THE EXISTING 2.5K MULTI-USE TRAIL AT MIRROR LAKE PARK. TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE FOCUSED NEAREST THE MAIN TRAIL HEAD AND PICNIC AREA. THIS SECTION OF OLD TRAIL CONNECTS THE TRAIL HEAD TO THE REST OF THE TRAIL SYSTEM, MOST OF WHICH WAS BUILT WITH RTP FUNDS IN 2016 AND 2018.

PROJECT TITLE: SKYVIEW TRAILHEAD IMPROVEMENTS  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A CONSOLIDATED STORAGE AREA AND SECURE, WEATHERIZED BUILDING TO RELOCATE TSALTESHI TRAILS ASSOCIATION MACHINERY, GROOMING EQUIPMENT AND STORAGE OFF OF TSALTESHI'S MAIN TRAILHEAD.

PROJECT TITLE: KAREN HORNADAY TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE PROJECT CONSTRUCTS 920 LINEAR FEET OF ADA-COMPLIANT PEDESTRIAN TRAIL PARALLEL TO A NEW KAREN HORNADAY PARK ENTRY ROAD ALIGNMENT. THE TRAIL CONNECTS FAIRVIEW AVENUE WITH THE PARKING AREA CROSSWALK, WHICH IS PROXIMATE TO THE PLAYGROUND AREA, PAVILIONS, CAMPFIRE CIRCLES, AND RESTROOMS. THE TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED WITH TYPE II FILL AND BE SEPARATED FROM THE ROAD BY A DRAINAGE DITCH. STRATEGIC PULLOUTS AT THE TRAIL ENTRANCE AND AT INTERMITTENT PULLOUTS ALONG THE WAY ALSO MAKE THE TRAIL MORE ACCESSIBLE TO INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY. THE PROJECT INCLUDES REGULATORY SIGNS, LANDSCAPING WITH NATIVE PLANTS ACCOMPANIED BY AN IDENTIFICATION/INTERPRETIVE SIGN IN ONE OF THE TRAIL PULLOUTS.

PROJECT TITLE: TRAIL UPGRADES FOR BIRCH HILL RECREATION & ADJACENT JOINT USE AREAS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TRAIL UPGRADES FOR BIRCH HILL RECREATION AREA AND ADJACENT JOINT USE AREAS.  THE UPGRADES ARE TO BRING THE TRAILS TO A UNIFORM STANDARD FOR ENVIRONMENTAL STABILITY, TRAIL SAFETY, AND EASE AND EFFICIENCY OF MAINTENANCE.

PROJECT TITLE: NEVADA REGIONAL TRAILS TRAINING, PHASE 3 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: AMERICAN TRAILS WILL CONDUCT A SERIES OF VIRTUAL AND ON-THE-GROUND TRAINING CLASSES IN NEVADA. PHASE 1 OF THIS PROJECT (RTP 2020-04) WAS FOCUSED ON CLASS DESIGN. PHASE 2 (RTP 2021-02) WAS FOCUSED ON INITIAL TRAININGS OF TRAIL STEWARDS IN THE RENO/TAHOE REGION. PHASE 3 WILL EXPAND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES ORIGINALLY DEVELOPED IN 2021 TO INCLUDE TRAININGS IN ALL REGIONS OF NEVADA AS WELL AS TRAININGS BUILDING MULTIPLE AGENCY CAPACITY AND FOR BOTH MOTORIZED AND NONMOTORIZED ADVOCATES. CLASSROOM TRAINING WILL BE FOLLOWED BY BRIEF TRAIL WORK, TO PRACTICE NEW SKILLS. TRIAL WORK WILL CONSIST OF MAINTENANCE UPON EXISTING TRAILS, UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF LANDOWNERS/MANAGERS.

PROJECT TITLE: RESPONSIBLE TRAIL USE FOR KIDS AND FAMILIES :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN OUTDOOR SCHOOL (GBOS) WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES FOR EXPLORATION AND STEWARDSHIP PROJECTS ON RENO-TAHOE AREA TRAILS.   GBOS PROGRAMS INCLUDE THE RESPONSIBLE TRAIL USE FOR KIDS AND FAMILIES PROGRAM THAT EMPHASIZES SAFETY AND RESPONSIBLE TRAIL USE.  THESE PROGRAMS WILL ALSO SAFELY INTRODUCE FAMILIES TO NEW TRAILS AND INVOLVE CHILDREN IN LEAVE NO TRACE ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS SUCH AS COLLECTING AND AUDITING LITTER FROM PARK TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: TMPF STUDENT STEWARDS PROGRAM :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TRUCKEE MEADOWS PARKS FOUNDATION’S STUDENT STEWARDS SUMMER CAMP FOCUSES ON ENGAGING SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, ARTS, AND MATHEMATICS (STEAM) ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO REDUCE SUMMER LEARNING LOSS AND KEEP ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS ACTIVE, HEALTHY, AND STEWARDS OF THEIR OUTDOORS.

PROJECT TITLE: TRAIL EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR NORTHERN NEVADA STUDENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SIERRA NEVADA JOURNEY’S (SNJ) TRAIL EDUCATION PROGRAM PROVIDES OUTDOOR SCIENCE AND NATURE EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO LOCAL STUDENTS UTILIZING VARIOUS TRAIL SYSTEMS LOCATED IN NORTHERN NEVADA.  THESE PROGRAMS INTRODUCE STUDENTS TO LOCAL PARKS, USE HANDS-ON ACTIVITIES LEARN PROPER TRAIL ETIQUETTE AND PRACTICE LEAVE NO TRACE PRINCIPLES.

PROJECT TITLE: YOUNG STEWARDS SERVICE LEARNING PROJECT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TAHOE RIM TRAIL ASSOCIATION (TRTA) JUNIOR TRAIL BUILDERS (JTB) PROGRAM ENGAGES YOUTH IN THE OUTDOORS THROUGH ON-TRAIL, SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCES.  THE PROGRAM WILL SERVE YOUTH FROM NORTHERN NEVADA OVER 9 DAYS OF PROGRAMING TO IMPROVE SECTIONS OF TAHOE RIM TRAIL (TRT).  THE TRTA WILL PARTNER WITH ONE TO TWO LOCAL, SOCIAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS TO HOST ONE 4- DAY TRAIL MAINTENANCE BACKCOUNTRY CAMP FOR 8-12 YOUTH AND FIVE SINGLE-DAY WORKDAYS FOR 40-60 YOUTH.

PROJECT TITLE: ANCHORAGE VIDEO TRAIL GUIDE TO CHUGACH STATE PARK :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE ANCHORAGE PARK FOUNDATION WILL CREATE A VIDEO TRAIL GUIDE (VTG) TO PROVIDE EDUCATION, SAFETY TIPS AND NAVIGATION TO HELP NEW AND DIVERSE USERS DISCOVER CHUGACH STATE PARK (CSP) IN THE ANCHORAGE AREA. (ANC VTG TO CSP) IT WILL FEATURE SAFETY, TRAIL ETIQUETTE AND DETAILS ABOUT ANCHORAGE MULTI-USE TRAILS AND TRAILHEADS WITH A FEW 'CURATED EXPERIENCES' FOR PEOPLE TO TRY, INCLUDING MOUNTAINS TO THE SEA—LINKING CHUGACH STATE PARK TO FAR NORTH BICENTENNIAL PARK AND THE MOOSE LOOP TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: SOUTHEAST REGION ORIENTATION & SAFETY PROJECT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR INTERPRETATION & EDUCATION SECTION PLANS TO CREATE 6 ORIENTATION PANELS (OP) AND 9 BULLETIN BOARD (BB) INFORMATIONALS FOR 5 SITES IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA. PROPOSED SITES AND ACTIVITY INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: JUNEAU AREA: ERNEST GRUENING STATE HISTORICAL PARK IN PARKING LOT/TRAILHEAD (1 OP, 1 BB). JUNEAU AREA: EAGLE BEACH STATE RECREATION AREA IN DAY USE AREA (1 OP, 3 BB). SITKA AREA: HALIBUT POINT STATE REC SITE IN PARKING LOT/TRAILHEAD (1 OP, 4 BB). SITKA AREA: MOSQUITO COVE TRAIL IN PARKING LOT/TRAILHEADS (2 OP). HAINES AREA: ALASKA CHILKAT BALD EAGLE PRESERVE, 25-MILE USE AREA (1 OP, 1 BB).

THIS PROJECT IS EXCLUSIVELY FOR CLEARANCE ACTIVITIES AND THERE WILL BE NO GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITIES.

OVER THE COURSE OF THE GRANT PERIOD, TRUCKEE MEADOWS PARKS FOUNDATION (TMPF) WILL IMPROVE AND/OR CONSTRUCT A MINIMUM OF TWO (2) MILES OF PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE TRAIL AT THE NATURE STUDY AREA.  THIS WILL INCLUDE REHABILITATING EXISTING TRAILS, RESURFACING EXISTING TRAILS WITH AN AGGREGATE SURFACE, MAKING NEW TRAILS, AND INSTALLING INTERPRETIVE SIGNAGE.

ROSE SUMMIT AND TAHOE MEADOWS TRAILHEADS. THESE ARE AREAS WITH HEAVY USE AND FAILING/DAMAGED TRAILHEAD STRUCTURES THAT ARE UNSUSTAINABLE. THE TRTA WILL ALSO INSTALL NEW PANELS WITH UPDATED MAPS AND INFORMATION AT ALL OTHER MAJOR TRT NEVADA-BASED TRAILHEADS.

THE RESTROOM IS INTENDED TO SERVE USERS OF THE TRUCKEE RIVER TRAIL SYSTEM.

THE TRAIL WILL BE ACCESSIBLE TO PEDESTRIANS AND MOUNTAIN BIKING ENTHUSIASTS.  THE ALIGNMENT WILL UTILIZE EXISTING SOCIAL TRAILS TO REDUCE THE DISTURBANCE TO THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT.

PROJECT TITLE: LINDSAY PARK TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE TRAIL WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 4500 FT. BY 10 FT. WIDE AND BE CONSTRUCTED OF CONCRETE. PROJECT TITLE: ST. LOUIS COUNTY, WILDWOOD, BABLER BICYCLE TRAIL RE-PAVE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ST. LOUIS COUNTY, WILDWOOD, RESURFACE AND REHABILITATE 2 SECTIONS OF THE PAVED BICYCLE TRAIL WITH A 2.5 AVERAGE ASPHALT OVERLAY. SECTION 1 IS FROM GUY PARK ROAD TUNNEL TO THE CAMPGROUND, STATION 0+10 THROUGH 41+00. SECTION 2 IS FROM CRYSTAL SPRINGS CCC RESTROOM TO GUY PARK TRAIL HEAD, STATION 55+00 THROUGH 85+25. THE TOTAL OF BOTH SECTIONS IS APPROXIMATELY 7,125 FEET LONG. DESIGN TRAIL WIDTH TO A TOTAL OF 10' WHERE TECHNICALLY FEASIBLE. 3 CULVERTS WILL BE REPLACED AT STATION 57+10 (SINGLE NO HEADWALL), 60+00 (SINGLE NO HEADWALL) & 83+45 (DOUBLE WITH STONE HEADWALLS). THE DOUBLE CULVERT HEADWALL WILL BE CONCRETE WITH STONE FACING; IF FEASIBLE & SUITABLE, RECOVERED HEADWALL STONE FOR THE FACING WILL BE USED. 2 AREAS, STATION 29+25 & 34+25 SHALL RECEIVE A LOW WATER CROSSING COMPRISED OF A FEW SMALL PVC PIPES IN THE 8' RANGE TO ALLOW FOR SMALL RAIN EVENTS AND SNOW MELT TO DRAIN THROUGH THE PIPE WITH THE TRAIL BEING RAISED ONLY A FOOT OR SO FROM EXISTING PROFILE.

PROJECT TITLE: SPITLER WOODS - SQUIRREL CREEK TRAIL REHABILITATION  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT (PHASE 2) PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ALL ENGINEERING SERVICES NECESSARY TO DESIGN AND PREPARE PLANS TO REPLACE BRIDGES #5, AND #7 LOCATED IN “SQUIRREL CREEK TRAIL. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR ALL MATERIALS AND LABOR NECESSARY TO REMOVE & REPLACE BRIDGE #7.  BRIDGE # 5 WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN ANOTHER PHASE.
OTHER WORK WILL INCLUDE REMOVING BRIDGES #1 #2 & #6 AND REPLACING THEM WITH CULVERTS, AND CORRECTING DRAINAGE ISSUES NEAR BRIDGE #7 TRAIL AND IMPROVING THE TRAIL SURFACE.

PROJECT TITLE: MORAINE HILLS - LAKE DEFIANCE BIKE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE EXISTING ASPHALT, MULTI-PURPOSE TRAIL CROSSES A HYDROLOGICAL CONNECTION BETWEEN 2 KEY MARSHES, YELLOW-HEAD MARSH AND WILLOW MARSH.   A CULVERT RECONSTRUCTION PROJECT WILL IMPACT THE EXISTING TRAIL.  THE TRAIL IS 20’ WIDE WHERE IT CROSSES THE EXISTING CULVERT SYSTEM.  THIS IS DUE TO 2 SEPARATE TRAILS SHARING THE SAME NARROW ISTHMUS OF LAND.  ONE TRAIL IS A DEDICATED BIKE TRAIL, THE OTHER A MULTI-PURPOSE PARK TRAIL.  DUE TO 2017 FLOODING OF THE FOX RIVER AND ITS BACKWATERS, THE ENGINEERING DESIGN FOR THE NEW WEIR OVERFLOW AND CULVERT STRUCTURE WILL REQUIRE THE TRAIL TO BE RAISED 18” HIGHER THAN THE EARLIER ENGINEERING DESIGNS.   THE ADJACENT AND PARALLEL ROADWAY, WHICH ALSO CROSSES THE SAME CULVERT SYSTEM, IS A MCHENRY COUNTY DOT ROADWAY, S. RIVER ROAD.  IT WILL ALSO BE REBUILT TO A RAISED LEVEL IN A COORDINATED EFFORT WITH IDNR.  RTP FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE IMPROVEMENT OF A RAISED AND CORRECTLY SLOPED TRAIL TO OCCUR.  

EXISTING PAVEMENT WILL BE REMOVED.  NEW 6” DEPTH ASPHALT TRAIL SURFACING WITH PAVEMENT PAINT WILL BE PLACED ATOP NEW EMBANKMENT, AND GRADED TO MAXIMUM 5% GRADE WITH CROSS SLOPE.  EXISTING TRAIL SIGNS WILL BE REMOVED AND RE-INSTALLED.
PROJECT TITLE: LAKE MURPHYSBORO - WALK A WAY TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: LAKE MURPHYSBORO STATE PARK - THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE SEVERAL FOOT BRIDGES ON THE 1.75 MILE WALK A WAY TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: LOWELL PARKWAY TRAIL ENHANCEMENT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT IS PROPOSING INCORPORATING EDUCATIONAL STATIONS (PLATFORMS), SAFETY FEATURES (LIGHTING, BLUE LIGHT SAFETY STATIONS), WAY-FINDING SIGNAGE, A LOOK OUT ALONG THE ROCK RIVER, A “PRAIRIE” VIEWING PLATFORM IN ADDITION TO REHABILITATING A SECTION OF THE TRAIL THAT REGULARLY WASHES OUT IN THE SPRING AND SUMMER MONTHS.

PROJECT TITLE: TINLEY CREEK TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE FOREST PRESERVE DISTRICT OF COOK COUNTY PROPOSES TO CONDUCT SURFACE REPAIRS ON 3 MILES OF THE TINLEY CREEK TRAIL AND IMPROVE ADA ACCESS AT TWO TRAILHEAD PARKING LOTS.  THE PROPOSED WORK INCLUDES MINOR IMPROVEMENTS TO TRAIL ACCESS WITH UPGRADED DROP-GATES AND ADA ACCESS IMPROVEMENTS IN TWO TRAILHEAD PARKING LOTS. IT ALSO INCLUDES REPAVING OF THE 151ST STREET TRAILHEAD PARKING LOT AND UPGRADED PORTABLE BATHROOMS TO BETTER ACCOMMODATE ADA USERS.

PROJECT TITLE: BUTLER POINT PARK RECREATIONAL TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE BUTLER POINT PARK RECREATIONAL TRAIL PROPOSED IS A .25-MILE TRAIL WITHIN THE VILLAGE OF CATLIN'S CURRENT BUTLER POINT PARK. THE TRAIL WILL BE A 10' CONCRETE PATH TO ALLOW PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO ENJOY. ALONG THE PATH, TEN FIT-TRAIL EXERCISE STATIONS WILL BE INSTALLED, AND A NO MOW SEED MIX WILL BE PLANTED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE OPEN SPACE OF THE PARK, ADDING BEAUTY TO THE TRAIL AND POLLINATION.

PROJECT TITLE: CALUMET CITY - RIVERWALK RECREATIONAL TRAIL DEVELOPMENT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW 0.46-MILE LONG TRAIL ALONG THE LITTLE CALUMET RIVER. THE TRAIL WILL BE 10- FEET WIDE AND MADE OF HOT-MIX ASPHALT. THE MULTI-USE TRAIL IS DESIGNED TO ENCOURAGE NONMOTORIZED TRANSPORTATION WITHIN A COMMERCIAL DISTRICT AND WILL PROVIDE A VITAL CONNECTION FROM THE REGIONAL BURNHAM GREENWAY TRAIL AND COOK COUNTY FOREST PRESERVE FACILITIES TO THE CALUMET CITY RIVERWALK PARK THAT IS SLATED FOR CONSTRUCTION IN 2021.

WORK WILL INCLUDE A PAVED NON-MOTORIZED PATH ALONG PARNALL ROAD AND A GRAVEL SURFACED PATH BETWEEN THE MDOC PROPERTY AND THE PORTAGE RIVER BRIDGE.;PARNALL RD/M-106 INTERSECTION TO PORTAGE RIVER BRIDGE, WEST OF HAWKENS RD IN JACKSON COUNTY; ,

PROJECT TITLE: RTP ADMIN. FUNDING FOR 2021-2022 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: ON DECEMBER 4, 2015, PRESIDENT OBAMA SIGNED INTO LAW THE FIXING AMERICA'S SURFACE TRANSPORTATION ACT, OR 'FAST ACT' - THE FIRST FEDERAL LAW IN OVER TEN YEARS TO PROVIDE LONG-TERM FUNDING CERTAINTY FOR SURFACE TRANSPORTATION. THE FAST ACT AUTHORIZES FHWA’S RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM, AS WELL AS MANY OTHER FEDERAL PROGRAMS AND BUDGETARY EXPENDITURES, OVER FISCAL YEARS 2016 THROUGH 2020. THE FAST ACT WAS EXTENDED FOR ONE YEAR BY CONGRESSIONAL CONTINUING RESOLUTION AND SIGNATURE BY PRESIDENT TRUMP ON OCTOBER 1, 2020. THE RTP ADMINISTRATION FOR 2021- 22 IS BUDGETED BY DCRT ALONG WITH THE NEW PROJECTS BEING SUBMITTED FOR FUNDING AS THE 2021 FHWA RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM FOR LOUISIANA GRANT AWARDS.

PROJECT TITLE: NEW IBERIA HISTORIC DISTRICTS TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THIS PROJECT IS A PEDESTRIAN WALKWAY AND WILL INCLUDE CONNECTING WALKS, LED LIGHTING POLES, WAYFINDING SIGNAGE, TRAILHEAD MAPS AND CROSSWALK STRIPING ALONG EAST AND WEST MAIN ST. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO CONNECT ADJOINING NATIONAL REGISTER DISTRICTS IN ORDER TO CREATE A PEDESTRIAN WALKING TRAIL WITH A GRADE LEVEL REINFORCED ADA COMPLIANT SIDEWALK SYSTEM THAT WILL BE WELL LIT, LANDSCAPED AND PROPERLY DRAINED. IN ADDITION, NEW CONSTRUCTION WILL BE ALONG THE WESTERN FENCE LINE OF THE SHADOW-ON-THE- TECHE WHERE THERE IS PRESENTLY NO PATH OR SIDEWALK ALONG N. WEEKS ST. TO EAST MAIN ST. THE TRAIL WOULD THEN MEET AN EXISTING SIDEWALK ALONG BLOCKS (100- 900) EAST MAIN ST. AND BLOCKS (100-200) WEST MAIN ST.
