PROJECT TITLE: 2021 RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM AND ADMINISTRATION & EDUCATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: RTP-RTP2(021)X - 2021 RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM AND ADMINISTRATION & EDUCATION

PROJECT TITLE: FOSTER PARK TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: AN 8' TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED USING A 10' ACCESS EASEMENT THAT WAS DONATED BY THE ADJACENT LAND OWNER. THE TRAIL WILL TIE INTO THE EAST PARKING LOT OF THE YOUNGSVILLE SPORTS COMPLEX AND RUN EAST TYING INTO THE SOUTH WEST SIDE OF FOSTER PARK'S TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: WOODLANDS TRAIL RECONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: A 1.3 MILE SECTION OF THE EQUESTRIAN TRAIL WILL BE REHABILITATED TO GRADE AND RESTORE APPROPRIAT DRAINAGE, RE-LINED WITH HIGHWAY MESH AND TOPPED WITH FINE LIMESTONE. ADDITIONALLY, A 1.3 MILE SECTION OF THE HIKING TRAIL WILL BE GRADED TO RESTORE DRAINAGE AND INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY. A LIGHT WEIGHT AMERICAN MADE TRACK LOADER WILL BE PURCHASED OR A CONTRACTOR HIRED TO GRADE BOTH THE EQUESTRIAN TRAIL AND THE HIKING TRAIL. THE EQUIPMENT PURCHASED/CONTRACTOR WITH EQUIPMENT WILL DROP LIMESTONE IN SECTIONS ALONG THE PATHWAY TO BE RESTORED. VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN SPREADING THE LIMESTONE EVENLY OVER THE HIGHWAY MESH. THE TRACK LOADER OR CONTRACTED EQUIPMENT OPERATOR WILL MOVE LIMESTONE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF 60 PARKING SPACES AND PLACE RAIL ROAD TIES TO SIGNIFY PARKING SPACES. FOLLOWING HERBICIDE TREATMENT OF INVASIVE VEGETATION, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN CLEARING FALLEN LIMBS AND TREES FORM THE TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: FRANKLIN TRAILS AND PADDLE TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: AT CITY PARK A 6' WIDE CONCRETE WALKING TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AROUND THE PERIMETER OF THE PARK, AS WELL AS THROUGH THE CENTER OF THE PARK. SIX (6) FITNESS STATIONS WILL BE INSTALLED AND STRATEGICALLY PLACED AROUND THE TRAIL. EACH STATION WILL HAVE A DIFFERENT PIECE OF EXERCISE EQUIPMENT AND INSTRUCTIONAL SIGN. BOLLARDS WILL BE PLACED AS NEEDED. AT CAFFERY PARK SIX (6) FITNESS STATIONS WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AND STRATEGICALLY PLACED AROUND AN ALREADY EXISTING WALKING TRAIL. A DIFFERENT PIECE OF EXERCISE EQUIPMENT AND INSTRUCTIONAL SIGN WILL BE INSTALLED AT EACH STATION. AT THE 5TH STREET FRANKLIN CANAL A PADDLEBOAT TRAILHEAD WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AND STRATEGICALLY PLACED TO ADD 1.1 MILES TO THE EXISTING FRANKLIN PADDLING TRAIL NETWORK. A PARKING AREA WILL ALSO BE INCLUDED FOR ECOTOURIST AND KAYAK/CANOE ENTHUSIAST PARKING.

PROJECT TITLE: LAFITTE DRIVE-IN PARK RECREATIONAL TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE PROPOSED PROJECT ENTAILS THE CONSTRUCTION OF 3,000 LINEAR FOOT WALKING, JOGGING, CYCLING, EXERCISE TRAIL. THIS RECREATIONAL TRAIL WILL BE TEN (10) FEET WIDE FOR A PORTION OF THE TRIAL FOR CYCLISTS AND THE REMAINDER SIX (6) FEET WIDE AND CONSTRUCTED WITH FOUR INCH THICK CONCRETE WHICH WILL BE AN EXCELLENT ALL WEATHER SURFACE FOR THE TRAIL. THIS NEW TRAIL WILL TIE INTO EXISTING HARD SURFACES.

PROJECT TITLE: LACOMBE OAK TREE TRAIL AND TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: CONSTRUCTION OF 2,000 FT. OF WALKING TRAIL WITHIN THE BAYOU LACOMBE PARK COMPLEX. THE WALKING PATHS WILL BE CONSTRUCTED OF 4' THICK UNREINFORCED CONCRETE 6' WIDE, WITH EXPANSION JOINTS EVERY 20' AND THE SCORED JOINTS EVERY 4-5 FT. THE WALK PATHS WILL BE FORMED AND POURED ON EXISTING GRADES. THE PATH WILL PROVIDE THE INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONNECT SEVERAL STRUCTURES THAT WILL BE BUILT IN THE FUTURE. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO CONSIST OF THE CONSTRUCTION OF A TRAILHEAD WITH CONNECTION TO THE TAMMANY TRACE.

PROJECT TITLE: BIKE MORGAN CITY - HELLENIC PROPERTY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: A MULTI-USE RECREATIONAL TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN MORGAN CITY FROM THE AUBURN LEVEE BEHIND THE MORGAN CITY VOLUNTEER FIRE STATION TO IN THE INTERSECTION OF LA 70 AND VETERANS BLVD. THE ASPHALT TRAIL WILL 4,514' LONG, 10' WIDE AND 4' DEEP WITH A STONE BASE OF 5' AND GEOTEXTILE FABRIC.

PROJECT TITLE: MENARD PED. BIKE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: CURRENTLY, THE EXISTING TRAILS ALONG MENARD STREET ARE NOT ADEQUATE OR WIDE ENOUGH TO ACCOMMODATE BOTH PEDESTRIANS AND CYCLISTS. THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION OF A 5,000 LINEAR FOOT JOINT PEDESTRIAN AND BICYCLE TRIAL, THIS PROJECT WILL CONNECT TRAILS ON THE NICHOLLS STATE UNIVERSITY CAMPUS TO A LIST OF SEVERAL OTHER EXISTING TRIALS IN AND AROUND HISTORIC DOWNTOWN THIBODAUX. IN ADDITION TO THE MULTI-USE TRAIL, APPROXIMATELY 700 LINEAR FEET OF EXISTING TRAILS ALONG MENARD STREET WILL BE REHABILITATED FOR CONTINUED USE BY PEDESTRIANS.

PROJECT TITLE: OLD PONCHATOULA HIGHWAY TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: CONSTRUCTION OF A 6' NATURE TRAIL CONNECTING THE MADISON RIDGE SUBDIVISION TO THE TOWN. THE TRAIL WILL GO DOWN THE EDGE OF THE OLD PONCHATOULA HIGHWAY ALONG THE SWAMP EDGE OF THE TOWN. THE NEW TRAIL WILL BE 1,620' LONG, FOUR INCHES THICK IN DEPTH.

PROJECT TITLE: NAPOLEONVILLE MULTI-TRAIL CONNECTOR :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THERE ARE THREE PRIMARY COMPONENTS TO THIS PROJECT PROPOSAL: 1) PURCHASE AND INSTALL OF A FLOATING DOCK AND ALL THE ANCHORING COMPONENTS. 2) LINKING THE EXISTING WALKING TRAIL TO THE NEW FLOATING DOCK WITH A PEDESTRIAN TRAIL AND ADA COMPLIANT TRANSITIONS. 3) CLEARING OF LOW CANOPY TREES AND BRUSH ALONG BAYOU LAFOURCHE FOR THE INSTALL OF 920' OF CONCRETE TRAIL AND 55' OF BOARDWALK. THIS TRAIL WILL CONNECT THE EXISTING WALKING TRAIL AND THE NAPOLEONVILLE PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE OVER BAYOU LAFOURCHE.

PROJECT TITLE: CYPRESS ISLAND PRESERVE BOARDWALK :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE THIS TRAIL PROJECT WILL REPLACE A 225-FOOT PORTION OF AN 895- FOOT BOARDWALK LOCATED AT THE NATURE ONSERVANCY'S (TNC) CYPRESS ISLAND PRESERVE, AN IMPORTANT 9400 ACRE NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL AREA LOCATED ADJACENT TO LAKE MARTIN IN ST. MARTIN PARISH. THE NEW 225- FOOT BOARDWALK WILL BE BUILT WITH INNOVATIVE AND SUSTAINABLE MATERIAL TO WITHSTAND THE WET ENVIRONMENT OF THE CYPRESS-TUPELO SWAMP OVER THE LONG-TERM. THE BOARDWALK AND PILINGS WILL BE COMPLETELY REMOVED AND REPLACED WITH PERMATRAK, A PRE- CAST CONCRETE SYSTEM SET ON HELICAL PILINGS MADE FOR DURABILITY AND LONG-TERM USE AND WILL BE ADA COMPLIANT.

PROJECT TITLE: NORTH TRAIL PARK CONNECTION (PH 2) :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE NORTH PARK TRAIL CONNECTION IS CONSIDERED AS PHASE 2 OF THE PLAQUEMINE RIVERFRONT RECREATIONAL TRAIL. NORTH PARK TRAIL CONNECTION IS LINKED TO NUMEROUS EXISTING HISTORICAL AND DESIGNATED AREAS. THESE AREAS INCLUDE: (1) THE PLAQUEMINE LOCK STATE HISTORIC SITE WHICH IS PART OF THE GREAT RIVER ROAD SCENIC BYWAY, GREAT RIVER ROAD INTERPRETIVE CENTER, AND NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES. (2) LOUISIANA GREAT RIVER ROAD SCENIC BYWAYS; (3) NATIONAL HERITAGE RIVER; (4) ATCHAFALAYA NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA; (5) BARATARIA-TERREBONNE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM; (6) BLUE STAR MEMORIAL HIGHWAY MEMORIAL  MARKER SITE AREA; (7) ADJACENT TO THE CITY'S BAYOU PLAQUEMINE WATERFRONT PARK WITH JOINING TRAILS; (8) DESIGNATED STATE PARK COMMEMORATIVE AREA; AND (9) IS A KEY DOWNTOWN ANCHOR SITE WITHIN THE CITY OF PLAQUEMINE HISTORIC AND MAIN STREET DISTRICT.

PROJECT TITLE: AUDUBON NATURE CENTER TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE AUDUBON NATURE INSTITUTE PLANS TO CONSTRUCT AN ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE TRAILHEAD FOR THE AUDUBON LOUISIANA NATURE CENTER (ALNC) THAT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS FROM JOE W. BROWN PARK TO THE ALNC'S 1.5 MILES OF NATURE TRIALS AND ONE MILE OF KID-FRIENDLY BOARDWALKS, INTERPRETIVE CENTER, AND INDOOR AND OUTDOOR TEACHING SPACES. CURRENTLY, A CHAIN LINK FENCE ON WHEELS SEPARATES THE ALNC AND ITS TRIALS AND BOARDWALKS FROM JOE W. BROWN PARK. PARK GUESTS MISINTERPRET THE FENCE AS A CONSTRUCTION ZONE AND BARRIER AND DO NOT FREELY CROSS INTO THE ALNC. WE PROPOSE TO CREATE AN INVITING TRAILHEAD, WITH GATE ANDCONNECTING TRAIL, LIGHTING, BENCHES, BIKE RACKS, AND A COMMUNITY EVENTS BOARD TO LINK THESE TWO COMMUNITY RESOURCES TOGETHER. THIS WILL ENSURE ACCESS TO ADDITIONAL SPACES TO RESIDENTS OF LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS AND FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES. THE TRAILHEAD WILL BE ADA COMPLIANT.

PROJECT TITLE: BIKE MORGAN CITY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: A RECREATIONAL TRAIL (WALKING, BIKING, HIKING, JOGGING) WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN MORGAN CITY FROM JUSTA STREET TO THE CAJUN COAST VISITORS AND CONVENTION WELCOME CENTER. THE CONCRETE TRIAL WILL BE 1370' LONG, 8.7'WIDE, AND 5' DEEP WITH A STONE BASE OF 4'. GEOTEXTILE FABRIC WILL BE USED TO AID IN CONSTRUCTION. BECAUSE THE TRAIL IS ON A LEVEE, ENGINEERING WILL BE A PART OF THE PROJECT, ALLOWING DESIGN AND INSPECTION TO OCCUR. THE WORK WILL BE DONE BY SURVEYING TO ENGINEERING SPECIFICATIONS TO MARK AND LAY OUT THE TRAIL DIMENSIONS, AND SHORING AS NEEDED. THE CONCRETE PATHWAY WILL THEN BE FORMED, POURED, AND FINISHED. THE CITY PLANNER AND CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE WILL OVERSEE AND INSPECT THE WORK. THE SURVEYOR ENGINEER WILL THEN EVALUATE THE WORK AND DECLARE THE WORK COMPLETE AS TO THE PROJECT DETAILS OF THIS GRANT. THE ENGINEERING FIRM WILL GIVE HIS/HER REPORT TO THE MAYOR AND COUNCIL AT A COUNCIL MEETING.

PROJECT TITLE: MONCUS PARK TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: LAFAYETTE CENTRAL PARK, INC. HAS ENGAGED THE SERVICES OF A PROFESSIONAL CONTRACTOR TO CONSTRUCT THE FIRST PHASE OF THE PARK GROUNDS TO INCLUDE THE MAIN PARK ENTRANCE FROM JOHNSTON STREET, OTHER PARK ELEMENTS, A 1-MILE TRIAL INCLUSIVE TO THE PARK PROPERTY AND THE EXTENSION OF THAT TRAIL AS PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION. USING CONSTRUCTION PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS PREPARED BY A LICENSED LANDSCAPE ARCHITECT, IT IS EXPECTED THAT IN ORDER TO SURFACE APPROXIMATELY 3,020 LINEAR FEET OF TRAIL, THE CONTRACTOR WILL BE REQUIRED TO PREPARE A SUBBASE FOR AN ASPHALT SURFACED TRAIL AND WILL ACCOMMODATE PEDESTRIAN TRAFFIC ONLY. THE PAVEMENT WILL BE 10' WIDE WITH A 3' GRAVEL SHOLDER ON ONE SIDE (SIMILAR DESIGN TO PROMENADE BEING CONSTRUCTED NOW). CONSIDERATIONS WILL BALSO BE MADE TO ACCOUNT FOR MAINTENANCE OF DRAINAGE AND INSTALLATION OF UTILITIES/LIGHTING. PARK STAFF ALONG WITH VOLUNTEERS, WILL THEN INSTALL BENCHES, SIGNS, PLANTINGS.

PROJECT TITLE: NEW IBERIA TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE NEW IBERIA TRAILHEAD WILL BE LOCATED ON A .42 ACRE SITE ON THE BANKS OF THE BAYOU TECHE IN THE NATIONAL REGISTER COMMERCIAL HISTORIC DISTRICT. THERE ARE THREE BASIC COMPONENTS TO THE PROPERTY. ONE IS THE FLOATING DOCK STRUCTURE, TWO IS THE ELEVATED PATHWAY TO THE DOCK AND THREE IS THE PUBLIC PARKING AND SIDEWALK SYSTEM USED TO ENTER THE SITE. THERE WILL ALSO BE KIOSK SIGNAGE IDENTIFYING THE HISTORIC NATURE OF THE PARK, AND PADDLING TRAIL SIGNAGE ALONG THE BAYOU TECHE, PREMANUFACTURED GANGPLANK - ALUMINUM 6' WIDE HINGED TO ACCOUNT FOR FLUCTUATING WATER LEVELS. TWO ACCESSIBLE CONCRETE WALKWAYS. PARKING (CONCRETE) 4' THICK X 6' WIDE. WALKWAY FROM DUPERIER ST. (GRAVEL WALKWAY) 4' WIDE X 4' THICK. WITHIN WALKWAYS WILL BE PROVISIONS FOR SIGNAGE AND INFORMATIONAL KIOSKS. KAYAK LAUNCH PLATFORM 6' ABOVE MEAN SEA LEVEL. GANGWWAY MEASURE 72' WIDE X 30' LONG. DUEL COMPONENT DOCK SYSTEM 10' X 16'.

PROJECT TITLE: ROCK ISLAND GREENWAY, PHASE 4 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CITY OF RUSTON IS PLANNING TO CONSTRUCT APPROXIMATELY 1250' OF 10' WIDE SHARED USE PATH FROM W. TEXAS AVE. ACROSS THE LOUISIANA TECH CAMPUS TO W. CALIFORNIA AVE. TRAIL WILL BE LIT WITH LED LIGHTS TO MATCH THE EXISTING LIGHTS IN THE AREA, AS WELL AS LANDSCAPING CANOPY TREES EVERY 50'. WE WILL INCORPORATE A TRAIL HEAD KIOSK NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF THE TRAIL AND W. TEXAS AVE., AND WE WILL CONTINUE TO PUT BENCHES AND GARBAGE RECEPTACLE'S INTERMITTENTLY ALONG THE TRAIL. THE TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED WITH APPROPRIATE SIGNAGE AND STRIPING AT EACH ROAD CROSSING. IT WILL ALSO BE TIED TO ALL SIDEWALKS IT INTERSECTS.

PROJECT TITLE: PLAQUEMINE RIVERFRONT RECREATIONAL TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE MASTER PLAN FOR THE PLAQUEMINE RIVERFRONT RECREATIONAL TRAIL INCLUDES THE CONSTRUCTION OF A ADA COMPLIANT MULTI-USE PEDESTRIAN AND BICYCLE TRAIL THAT IS APPROXIMATELY 1.3 MILES LONG ON TOP OF THE EXISTING MISSISSIPPI RIVER LEVEE BETWEEN RIVER MILE STATIONS 208 AND 210. TO COMPLY WITH THE MINIMUM AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF STATE HIGHWAY TRANSPORTATION OFFICIALS(AASHTO) STANDARDS, THE MULTI-USE TRAIL WILL BE A MINIMUM 10 FEET WIDE.

PROJECT TITLE: BAYOU TECHE NATIONAL PADDLE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF 8 FLOATING PADDLE TRAIL DOCKS WITH GANGWAYS ATTACHING THEM TO THE BANK LINE. THERE WILL BE ONE DOCK CONSTRUCTED AT EACH LOCATION. EACH DOCK SITE WILL HAVE VEHICLE ACCESS AND PARKING. INFORMATIONAL KIOSKS AND SIGNAGE (SAFETY, WAYFINDING) WILL BE INSTALLED IN THESE LOCATIONS AS WELL AS 6 ADDITIONAL TOWNS THAT ALREADY HAVE FLOATING DOCKS INSTALLED. THE DIMENSIONS OF THE FLOATING DOCKS ARE TYPICALLY 27 FEET LONG BY 10 FEET WIDE AND THE GANGWAYS ARE 6 FEET WIDE WITH VARYING LENGTHS FROM 20 TO 50 FEET. EACH DOCK WILL BE HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE AND THE GANGWAYS WILL HAVE RAILINGS. A LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT WITH EACH MUNICIPALITY WILL BE OBTAINED. THE MUNICIPALITY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL SITE PREPARATION (E.G., PARKING AREAS, SLOPING BANKS, CLEARING DEBRIS, AND INSTALLING THE CONCRETE PAD FOR GANGWAY ATTACHMENT) IN ADVANCE OF DOCK CONSTRUCTION. THE KIOSKS WILL BE DESIGNED IN COOPERATION WITH THE LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES/TRIBAL COUNCIL, AND WILL CONTAIN 1 TO 2, 2-SIDED HIGH-PRESSURE LAMINATE PANELS THAT HAVE A MINIMUM 10-YEAR LIFE. THE PANELS WILL INCLUDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE PADDLE TRAIL AND THE LOCAL MUNICIPALITY AND WILL HAVE BI-LINGUAL FEATURES.

PROJECT TITLE: TRENTON NATURE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROPOSED TRAIL WILL CONSIST OF APPROXIMATELY 3,600 FEET OF SIX FOOT WIDE CONCRETE TRAILS, 2,250 FEET OF STONE TRAILS, 150 FEET OF ELEVATED TRAILS, AND 455 FEET OF FLOATING, PONTOON BRIDGES. THE BRIDGES WILL BE DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE ITS IMPACT ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND WILL CREATE MULTIPLE POSSIBLE TRAIL CONFIGURATIONS. IN ADDITION TO THE EXISTING ENTRY POINT TO THE TRAIL, A NEW, STONE PARKING LOT WILL BE CONSTRUCTED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE TRAIL TO CREATE ANOTHER ENTRANCE POINT. THE DESIGN FOLLOW THE GUIDELINES OF THE AMERICAN WITH DISABILITIES ACT IN PROVIDING FOR TRAIL ACCESS.

PROJECT TITLE: CAMPBELL - PE, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND DESIGN ENGINEERING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A 6,000 LINEAR FOOT LOOP ALONG MARY INGLES HIGHWAY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PE, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND DESIGN ENGINEERING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A 6,000 LINEAR FOOT LOOP ALONG MARY INGLES HIGHWAY IN FORT THOMAS.

PROJECT TITLE: HOPKINS - CONSTRUCTION OF CHERRY PARK WALKING TRAIL IN THE CITY OF MADISONVILLE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ADD A PAVED WALKING TRAIL AROUND THE PERIMETER OF CHERRY PARK. THE TRAIL WILL BE 4 FT IN WIDTH, 1/2 MILE IN LENGTH AND WILL BE DESIGNED TO FACILITATE A COMBINATION OF NON-MOTORIZED USES. ALSO, THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO ADD A RESTROOM FACILITY, WATER FOUNTAINS AND A TRAILHEAD.
PROJECT TITLE: ROWAN - REHAB AND EXTEND THE TRIPLETT VALLEY TRAIL IN THE CITY OF MOREHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHAB AND EXTEND THE TRIPLETT VALLEY TRAIL IN THE CITY OF MOREHEAD

PROJECT TITLE: HENDERSON - CONSTRUCTION OF TRAIL ACCESS AND NEW TRAILS IN SANDY LEE WATKINS PARK IN HENDERSON :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF TRAIL ACCESS AND NEW TRAILS IN SANDY LEE WATKINS PARK IN HENDERSON.

PROJECT TITLE: JEFFERSON- TOM WALLACE RECREATIONAL AREA TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCT 0.5 MILES OF ADA ACCESSIBLE, 10-FT WIDE ASPHALT MULTI-USE TRAIL WITHIN THE TOM WALLACE RECREATION AREA OF JEFFERSON MEMORIAL FOREST. PROJECT WILL ALSO CONSTRUCT 0.9 MILES OF 8-FT WIDE GRAVEL PATH, TWO PEDESTRIAN BRIDGES, SIGNAGE, AND PERFORM RELATED SITE WORK.

PROJECT TITLE: MCCRACKEN - CONSTRUCTION OF A PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE AND TRAIL EXTENSION OVER PERKINS CREEK IN PADUCAH :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF A PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE AND TRAIL EXTENSION OVER PERKINS CREEK IN PADUCAH.

PROJECT TITLE: HANNA CITY RAIL-TRAIL CORRIDOR ACQUISITION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ACQUISITION OF 24.7 MILE CORRIDOR ALONG AN INACTIVE UNION PACIFIC RAIL LINE.  THE CORRIDOR RUNS FROM KICKAPOO CREEK IN PEORIA COUNTY TO ABOUT 5 MILES WEST OF FARMINGTON IN RURAL FULTON COUNTY.  THE HANNA CITY RAIL-TRAIL IS A VITAL LINK IN CREATING A REGIONAL TRAIL SYSTEM IN CENTRAL ILLINOIS.

PROJECT TITLE: TRAIL RECREATIONS EFFINGHAM COUNTY (TREC) PHASE VI-A :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE FIRST PHASE OF A LOOPED TRAIL THROUGH THE 55 ACRE AREA OF THE PROPOSED 
TREC PARK. THE END RESULT OF THIS GRANT WOULD BE A 1.4 MILE TRAIL USABLE BY WALKERS, RUNNERS, MOUNTAIN BIKES, AND HORSES.

PROJECT TITLE: CITY OF SILVIS, PHIPPS PARK TRAIL DEVELOPMENT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE CITY OF SILVIS PURCHASED THE PROPERTY ADJACENT TO PHIPPS PARK LAST FALL. THE ADDITIONAL 18 ACRES MAKES THE PARK 28 ACRES TOTAL. THE INTENT IS TO MAINTAIN A NATURAL AREA AND EXPAND THE WALKING AND HIKING TRAIL NETWORK. THE TRAIL WILL BE THE TRAIL WOULD BE BLACKTOP, EIGHT FEET WIDE AND 1,700 FEET IN LENGTH. THERE WILL ALSO BE A REST AREA WITH A SHELTER AND PICNIC TABLES.

PROJECT TITLE: PRAIRIE TRAIL, MCCULLOM LAKE ROAD TO ROUTE 120 RENOVATION PROJECT - MCHENRY COUNTY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT RENOVATES 1.3 MILES OF THE EXISTING PRAIRIE TRAIL, A MULTIPURPOSE RECREATIONAL TRAIL THAT TRAVELS 26.6 MILES FROM WISCONSIN STATE LINE TO KANE COUNTY BORDER & IS PART OF THE GRAND IL TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: JANE ADDAMS TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT - FREEPORT PARK DISTRICT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT INVOLVES THE RESTORATION OF CEDARVILLE BRIDGE AND THE RESTORATION OF A DAMAGED TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: STATEWIDE - DLNR FY2021 STATEWIDE RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM, HISTORIC TRAIL SURVEY, HAWAI'I ISLAND AND O'AHU :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TO DOCUMENT THE HISTORIC AND ANCIENT TRAILS (AS DEEMED STATE-OWNED PER THE HIGHWAYS ACT OF 1892) IN PREPARATION OF INCLUDING THEM AS NA ALA HELE PROGRAM TRAILS (AND RECREATIONAL PROGRAM TRAILS) AND OPENING THEM TO PUBLIC RECREATIONAL USE

PROJECT TITLE: FORT YARGO TRAIL BOARDWALK CONSTRUCTION  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW WOOD FRAMED BOARDWALK BRIDGE (APPROXIMATELY 10FT WIDE X 320FT LONG) CONNECTING THE VISITOR CENTER TO THE EXISTING HIKING/BIKING TRAIL TO PREVENT HIKERS AND BIKERS FROM HAVING TO USE THE MAIN PARK ROAD AND NARROW VEHICLE BRIDGE TO ACCESS THE TRAIL SYSTEM.

PROJECT TITLE: SINERR NATURE TRAIL REHAB :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: MAJOR REHABILITATION OF THE BOARDWALK AND NATURAL SURFACE NATURE TRAIL MAINTAINED BY SINERR, TO INCLUDE REPLACING ABOUT 1000LF OF WOODEN BOARDWALK SEGMENTS.
PROJECT TITLE: CITY OF CUMMING - CITY CENTER TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF TRAIL AND BOARDWALK THAT WILL MEANDER ABOVE THE KELLY MILL BRANCH STREAM, ITS TRIBUTARIES, AND WETLANDS.

PROJECT TITLE: FLINT RIVER TRAILS - ALBANY DOWNTOWN CONNECTOR TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: COMPLETE THE 1.9-MILE ALBANY DOWNTOWN CONNECTOR OF THE LARGER 30+ MILE TRAIL NETWORK KNOWN AS FLINT RIVER TRAILS. THE FINISHED TRAIL PROJECT WILL INCLUDE A TRAILHEAD WITH PARKING AND A TRAIL SPUR TO THE RIVERFRONT TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: CITY OF YOUNG HARRIS - CUPID FALLS TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTING AND REHABILITATING TRAILS TO IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY AT CUPID FALLS PARK. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE ADDITION OF AN ADA ACCESSIBLE RAMP BETWEEN THE UPPER FALLS TRAIL AND THE LOWER FALLS TRAIL AND THE EXPANSION OF A BOARDWALK ALONG THE UPPER FALLS TRAIL FOR MORE ADA ACCESS AND EASE OF USE.

PROJECT TITLE: COVINGTON CENTRAL PARK RED TRAIL - PHASE 2 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: COMPLETE THE FINAL SECTION OF THE NEW RED TRAIL IN COVINGTON CENTRAL PARK. THE RED TRAIL ACCOMMODATES BOTH WALKERS AND CYCLISTS JUST A FEW BLOCKS FROM THE CITY SQUARE.

PROJECT TITLE: CITY OF CAIRO, SOUTHERN TERRACE PARK TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SOUTHERN TERRACE PARK IS CURRENTLY LOCATED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE CITY OF CAIRO OFF 1ST SW (30°51'52.94'N, 84°12'37.58W). THE PARK IMPROVEMENTS WILL CONSIST OF CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW .5 MILE PAVED WALKING TRAIL, PARKING LOT IMPROVEMENT AT THE TRAILHEAD, SAFETY FENCING BETWEEN THE TRAIL AND TRAFFIC, TRAIL SIGNAGE, AND ASSOCIATED DESIGN AND ENGINEERING COSTS.
PROJECT TITLE: CHATTOOGA RANGER 'DISTRICT - CHATTAHOOCHEE OCONEE NATIONAL FOREST :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHAB OF 19 MILES OF OHV TRAIL, TRAIL DRAINAGE AND TRAILHEAD FACILITIES.

PROJECT TITLE: OCONEE RANGER DISTRICT - CHATTAHOOCHEE - OCONEE NATIONAL FOREST :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHABILITATION OF THE TOWN CREEK ATV/MOTORCYCLE TRAIL (TCATV) TRAIL SYSTEM PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIRT BIKES AND OHV VEHICLES LESS THAN 50” IN WIDTH AND THEIR SUPPORTING TRAILHEAD FACILITIES. MAINTENANCE CONSISTS OF GRADING AND SHAPING OF TRAIL TREAD WITH MECHANIZED EQUIPMENT. HEAVY MAINTENANCE WILL CONSIST OF SURFACE HARDENING USING PAVERS, GRAVEL AND TIMBERS, ARMORING OF TREAD IN SELECT PLACES WITH RESHAPING OF DRAINAGE STRUCTURES SUCH AS ROLLING GRADE DIPS AND REROUTES. THIS TRAIL SYSTEM IS A COMBINATION OF NATURAL SURFACING WITH ROCK AND GRAVEL PLACED TO PROTECT TREAD IN CERTAIN AREAS. APPROXIMATELY 1  MILE OF THE TRAIL IS IN NEED OF REROUTES. AFTER CONSTRUCTION, THE EXISTING UNSUSTAINABLE TRAIL WILL BE DECOMMISSIONED.

PROJECT TITLE: BLUE RIDGE RANGER DISTRICT - CHATTAHOOCHEE - OCONEE NATIONAL FOREST :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHABILITATION OF 30.5 MILES OF EXISTING MOTORIZED TRAILS AT DAVENPORT MOUNTAIN, WHISSENHUNT, AND BEASLEY KNOB.  REHABILITATION WORK WILL INCLUDE RESTORATION OF TREAD, CLEANING AND REPAIR AND INSTALLATION OF DRAINAGE STRUCTURES (EARTHEN DRAIN DIPS, BOARDWALK, CAUSEWAYS, RETAINING WALLS), CLOSURE OF ILLEGAL SOCIAL TRAILS, AND BRUSHING/CLEARING OF BLOWDOWN AND INFRINGING VEGETATION. SOME SIGNAGE WORK SUCH AS REPAIRS AND REPLACEMENTS WILL ALSO BE ACCOMPLISHED ALONG THE TRAIL AND WITHIN THE TRAILHEADS.THE WORK WILL CONSIST OF (1) TRAIL RESTORATION OF 24 MILES OF TRAIL, (2) RESTORATION AND INSTALLATION OF DRAINAGE FEATURES, (3) ~ 7 MILES OF TRAIL RE-ROUTES, (4) HAZARD TREE REMOVAL AND (5) MAINTENANCE OF TRAILHEAD FACILITIES, INFRASTRUCTURE, AND VISITOR AMENITIES.

PROJECT TITLE: CONASAUGA RD MOTORIZED TRAIL RESTORATION AND MAINTENANCE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: TO CONDUCT MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ON THREE MOTORIZED TRAIL SYSTEMS PROVIDING 48.6 MILES OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR FULL SIZE VEHICLES, DIRT BIKES AND OHV VEHICLES.  TRAILS INCLUDE WINDY GAP, MILMA CREEK, TIBBS, ROCK CREEK, TATUM LEAD, AND HOUSTON VALLEY OHV TRAILS.  ALL OF THESE ROUTES WILL BE MAINTAINED TO FOREST SERVICE STANDARD FOR MANAGING CLASS 3 MOTORIZED TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: MEMORIAL TREE TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: EXPAND THE MEMORIAL TREE TRAIL BY CONSTRUCTING APPROXIMATELY 1,250 LF OF ADA ACCESSIBLE BOARDWALK AT THE GRAHAM CREEK NATURE PRESERVE. PROJECT SPONSOR - CITY OF FOLEY

PROJECT TITLE: CENTENNIAL PARK TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: RESURFACE THE EXISTING ASPHALT WALKING TRAIL AND INSTALL LED LIGHTS AND BALLASTS IN CENTENNIAL PARK. PROJECT SPONSOR: CITY OF SLOCOMB

PROJECT TITLE: SHOUP BAY TRAIL, PHASE II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: VALDEZ ADVENTURE ALLIANCE PLANS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO SHOUP BAY TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE WHERE PHASE I OF TRAIL WORK FINISHED IN THE SUMMER OF 2020, AND WILL INCLUDE CLEARING, LEVELING, AND RESURFACING 620 FEET OF TRAIL BEFORE THE BRIDGE.  WORK WILL ALSO INCLUDE ADDING DIRECTIONAL SIGNAGE AT EAGAN STREET, ADDING SKIER LEGAL NOTICE SIGNAGE AT TRAILHEAD, REHABILITATION OF THE BRIDGE, REPAIRING DRAINAGE TRENCH AT TRAILHEAD, LANDSCAPING AT TRAILHEAD, AND PURCHASING AND INSTALLING A BENCH.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, AND PRODUCTION OF A SMALL FOURTH-GRADE LEVEL 'FIELD GUIDE' SPECIFIC TO THE TRAIL, WITH EMPHASIS ON NATIVE USES OF THE PLANTS.

PROJECT TITLE: SEA LION COVE STATE MARINE PARK TRAIL REPAIRS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SITKA TRAIL WORKS PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO SEA LION COVE STATE MARINE PARK TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE TRAILTREAD TO CREATE A SAFER AND MORE SUSTAINABLE TRAIL SURFACE ON THIS 2.5 MILE LONG TRAIL TO A LARGE BEACH.  THE GOALS OF THE REPAIR PROJECT ARE TO CREATE A MORE SUSTAINABLE TRAIL THAT REDUCES LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS AND MAKE THE TRAIL ACCESSIBLE TO MOST HIKERS AS A MODERATE-DIFFICULTY HIKE.

PROJECT TITLE: REFLECTIVE WANDS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PETERSVILLE COMMUNITY NON-PROFIT CORPORATION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO VARIOUS TRAILS WITHIN PETERSVILLE, AK.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF 600 REFLECTIVE WANDS, AND PLACING THE REFLECTIVE WANDS ACROSS VARIOUS AREAS WITHIN THE EXISTING TRAIL SYSTEM IN PETERSVILLE, AK, CONSISTING OF OVER 150 MILES.  THIS WILL IMPROVE VISIBILITY DURING WINTER TRAIL-USE AND PROMOTE SAFETY FOR MOTORIZED TRAIL-USERS.

PROJECT TITLE: TRACKS FOR TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: WILLOW AREA COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE WILLOW AREA / WEST GATEWAY TRAIL SYSTEM.
THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF A SET OF MATTRACKS, A RUBBER TRACK CONVERSION SYSTEM, ON A WILLOW TRAIL COMMITTEE OWNED PICKUP TRUCK.  THIS WILL ALLOW WILLOW AREA COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE BETTER QUALITY SNOW GROOMING OF THE WEST GATEWAY TRAIL SYSTEM.

PROJECT TITLE: SKEETAWK SUMMER TRAILS CONSTRUCTION, PHASE I :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: HATCHER ALPINE XPERIENCE PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO SKEETAWK SUMMER TRAILS IN HATCHER PASS, ALASKA.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE TRAIL DESIGN FOR THIS PHASE, NEW TRAIL CONSTRUCTION TO CONNECT EXISTING TRAILS, AND ENHANCING PUBLIC OPPORTUNITY.

PROJECT TITLE: EAGLE RIVER NATURE CENTER TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FRIENDS OF EAGLE RIVER NATURE CENTER, INC. PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO EAGLE RIVER NATURE CENTER TRAILS.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN UPGRADED TRAIL ACCESS BETWEEN A LOWER PARKING LOT AND THE NATURE CENTER BUILDING.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF LUMBER TO REPAIR BOARDWALK, GRAVEL TO REPAIR ERODED TRAILS, AND A MINI BOBCAT ATTACHMENT FOR CLEARING SNOW FROM TRAIL ACCESS POINTS AND VIEWING DECKS.

PROJECT TITLE: ISBERG EAST-WEST MULTI-USE TRAIL, PHASE II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH PLANS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO ISBERG EAST-WEST TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE WHERE PHASE I OF TRAIL CONSTRUCTION ENDED IN THE SUMMER OF 2020 AND RESTORE APPROXIMATELY 1,300 ADDITIONAL LINEAR FEET OF DEGRADED TRAIL BY ADDING DURABLE, GRAVEL MATERIALS AND INSTALLING DRAINAGE FEATURES.  THIS PROJECT PHASE CROSSES THE WETTEST, MOST DAMAGED SEGMENT OF THE TRAIL.  THE TRAIL CONNECTS THE OBOE COURT TRAIL HEAD PARKING IN THE WEST WITH THE UPLAND TRAILS ON THE PARK'S EAST SIDE.  THE NEW SURFACE WILL HOLD UP TO THE INTENDED MOTORIZED AND NON-MOTORIZED USES, REDUCE TRAIL BRAIDING AND ALLOW NATURAL VEGETATION TO REGROW ALONG THE TRAIL CORRIDOR.

PROJECT TITLE: CHENA LAKE RIVER PARK TRAILS REROUTES :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO CHENA LAKE RIVER PARK TRAILS.
THIS PROJECT WILL REROUTE SECTIONS OF THE CHENA LAKE RIVER PARK SKI TRAILS AND NATURE TRAIL WHERE THE CHENA RIVER HAS ERODED LARGE SECTIONS OF TRAIL ALONG THE RIVERBANK.  FOUR (4) SECTIONS OF TRAIL MAY BE REROUTED, CONSTRUCTING UP TO APPROXIMATELY 1,500 LINEAR FEET OF NEW TRAIL ROUTE.  CONSTRUCTION WILL REQUIRE CLEARING VEGETATION ALONG THE NEW TRAIL CORRIDOR, PLACING A HARDENED GRAVEL SURFACE, AND INSTALLING DRAINAGE FEATURES.

PROJECT TITLE: TOTEM BIGHT TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO TOTEM BIGHT TRAIL.
THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE ADA ACCESS INTO TOTEM BIGHT STATE HISTORICAL PARK BY RESURFACING AND ADDING REST POINTS ALONG THE TRAIL SYSTEM.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO ADDRESS SEVERAL MAINTENANCE AND SAFETY CONCERNS, REPAIRING ROTTEN AND DAMAGED AREAS OF THE BOARD WALK AND REMOVING HAZARDOUS TREES FROM ALONG THE TRAIL SYSTEM.

PROJECT TITLE: POINT BRIDGET STATE PARK TRAILS, PHASE II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE POINT BRIDGET STATE PARKS TRAILS.

THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE WHERE PHASE I COMPLETED, AND WILL INCLUDE CLEARING THE EXISTING TRAIL CORRIDOR, RESURFACING THE TRAIL TREAD, AND REPAIRING TRAIL STRUCTURES TO THE NEXT PUBLIC USE CABIN AND RECREATION ACCESS POINT.

PROJECT TITLE: HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION SITE LATRINE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION SITE LATRINE.

THE PROJECT WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT RESTROOM FACILITY AT HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION SITE BY REMOVING THE CURRENT UNUSABLE LATRINE AND REPLACING WITH A SIMILAR LATRINE IN THE SAME FOOTPRINT.

PROJECT TITLE: HALIBUT POINT SRS & MOSQUITO COVE TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION SITE AND MOSQUITO COVE TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE BUILDING AN ORIENTATION KIOSK, HARDENING TWO (2) MILES OF TRAIL TREAD, AND REPLACING AN ENTRANCE SIGN AT HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION SITE.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE CUTTING BRUSH AND LIMBS ALONG THE TRAIL CORRIDOR AT MOSQUITO COVE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: HAINES AREA MULTI-USE TRAIL MAINTENANCE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE HIRED TRAIL CREW ASSISTING HAINES AREA STATE PARKS STAFF WITH MAINTENANCE OF YEAR-ROUND MULTIPLE-USE TRAILS LOCATED WITHIN THE VICINITY OF 25 MILE HAINES HIGHWAY WITHIN THE CHILKAT BALD EAGLE PRESERVE.  WORK WILL CONSIST OF BRUSHING, THINNING AND LIMBING TREES, AND THE LONG-TERM RENTAL OF A WOOD CHIPPER TO ASSIST WITH DISPOSAL.  THIS PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES IMPROVING A FACILITY BUILT BY VOLUNTEER LABOR BY ADDING A FIRE RING AND AN INTERPRETIVE PANEL TO THE EXISTING KIOSK AT THE TRAILHEAD.

PROJECT TITLE: SADDLE TRAIL TREAD RESHAPING :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KENAI REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO SADDLE TRAIL WITH TREAD RESHAPING.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE RESHAPING TREAD SURFACE, DRAIN DIPS, DRAINS, DITCHES, BACKSLOPE, CRITICAL EDGE, OUTSLOPE OF THE TRAIL, AND SLOPE BELOW THE TRAIL ON SHALLOW SLOPES TO ENSURE WATER RUNS OFF THE TRAIL WITH MINIMAL EROSION.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE REPLACING STORM DAMAGED CAUSEWAY WITH A TURNPIKE WITH DRAIN.

PROJECT TITLE: NINILCHIK STATE PARKS TRAIL GROOMING EQUIPMENT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KENAI REGION PLANS TO PURCHASE TRAIL GROOMING EQUIPMENT, AND CONDUCT WINTER TRAIL GROOMING FOR NINILCHIK STATE RECREATION AREA.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF THREE (3) TRAIL GROOMING ATTACHMENTS TO MAINTAIN WINTER RECREATION TRAILS.  THE FIRST USED FOR ROLLING AND COMPACTING THE TRAILS AFTER A HEAVY OR DEEP SNOW; THE SECOND USED FOR CREATING A SMOOTH, 60-INCE-WIDE SKIING LANE; AND THE THIRD USED FOR SETTING TRACKS FOR CLASSIC SKIING.  THE EQUIPMENT WILL BE USED TO GROOM 1.1 MILES OF NON-MOTORIZED WINTER TRAILS AT THE NINILCHIK STATE RECREATION AREA.

PROJECT TITLE: CAINES HEAD SRA TRAIL MAINTENANCE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KENAI REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO CAINES HEAD STATE RECREATION AREA TRAILS.

THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES GENERAL MAINTENANCE NEEDS SUCH AS BRUSHING, REPAIRING AND HARDENING TRAIL TREAD, AND REPLACING ROTTING LOG PUNCHEON AND STAIRS ON THE ALPINE AND RAINFOREST TRAILS WITHIN CAINES HEAD STATE RECREATION AREA.  WORK WILL ALSO TAKE PLACE ON THE FORT AND SOUTH BEACH TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: DELTA RIVER WALK PARK, PHASE I :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DELTA JUNCTION TRAILS ASSOCIATION PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO DELTA RIVER WALK PARK.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE STORM WATER POLLUTION PREVENTION PLAN & MOBILIZATION; DESIGN & LAYOUT TO NORDIC X-COUNTRY SKI TRAIL STANDARDS; AND CLEARING, EXCAVATING, AND FINISH-IT TO CREATE TURNPIKE (RAISED TREAD) USING MATERIAL EXCAVATED FROM TRAILSIDE.

PROJECT TITLE: LITTLE O'MALLEY PEAK TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALASKA TRAILS PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO LITTLE O'MALLEY PEAK TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL RE-ROUTE A STEEP AND TREACHEROUS ROUTE UP THE O'MALLEY GULLEY TO A SUSTAINABLE AND MORE GRADUAL ASCENT.  TRAIL CREW WILL PERFORM ALL WORK WITH HAND TOOLS, FOR A TOTAL LENGTH OF TRAIL REMAINING TO BE CONSTRUCTED OF APPROXIMATELY 1.0 MILE AND INCLUDE SEVERAL RETAINING WALLS TO STABILIZE SWITCHBACKS.

ALASKA TRAILS WILL COLLABORATE CLOSELY WITH CHUGACH STATE PARK ON ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: NEW IBERIA HISTORIC DISTRICTS TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THIS PROJECT IS A PEDESTRIAN WALKWAY AND WILL INCLUDE CONNECTING WALKS, LED LIGHTING POLES, WAYFINDING SIGNAGE, TRAILHEAD MAPS AND CROSSWALK STRIPING ALONG EAST AND WEST MAIN ST. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO CONNECT ADJOINING NATIONAL REGISTER DISTRICTS IN ORDER TO CREATE A PEDESTRIAN WALKING TRAIL WITH A GRADE LEVEL REINFORCED ADA COMPLIANT SIDEWALK SYSTEM THAT WILL BE WELL LIT, LANDSCAPED AND PROPERLY DRAINED. IN ADDITION, NEW CONSTRUCTION WILL BE ALONG THE WESTERN FENCE LINE OF THE SHADOW-ON-THE- TECHE WHERE THERE IS PRESENTLY NO PATH OR SIDEWALK ALONG N. WEEKS ST. TO EAST MAIN ST. THE TRAIL WOULD THEN MEET AN EXISTING SIDEWALK ALONG BLOCKS (100- 900) EAST MAIN ST. AND BLOCKS (100-200) WEST MAIN ST.

PROJECT TITLE: TRENTON NATURE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROPOSED TRAIL WILL CONSIST OF APPROXIMATELY 3,600 FEET OF SIX FOOT WIDE CONCRETE TRAILS, 2,250 FEET OF STONE TRAILS, 150 FEET OF ELEVATED TRAILS, AND 455 FEET OF FLOATING, PONTOON BRIDGES. THE BRIDGES WILL BE DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE ITS IMPACT ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND WILL CREATE MULTIPLE POSSIBLE TRAIL CONFIGURATIONS. IN ADDITION TO THE EXISTING ENTRY POINT TO THE TRAIL, A NEW, STONE PARKING LOT WILL BE CONSTRUCTED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE TRAIL TO CREATE ANOTHER ENTRANCE POINT. THE DESIGN FOLLOW THE GUIDELINES OF THE AMERICAN WITH DISABILITIES ACT IN PROVIDING FOR TRAIL ACCESS.

PROJECT TITLE: FORT YARGO TRAIL BOARDWALK CONSTRUCTION  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW WOOD FRAMED BOARDWALK BRIDGE (APPROXIMATELY 10FT WIDE X 320FT LONG) CONNECTING THE VISITOR CENTER TO THE EXISTING HIKING/BIKING TRAIL TO PREVENT HIKERS AND BIKERS FROM HAVING TO USE THE MAIN PARK ROAD AND NARROW VEHICLE BRIDGE TO ACCESS THE TRAIL SYSTEM.
PROJECT TITLE: CHATTOOGA RANGER 'DISTRICT - CHATTAHOOCHEE OCONEE NATIONAL FOREST :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHAB OF 19 MILES OF OHV TRAIL, TRAIL DRAINAGE AND TRAILHEAD FACILITIES.

PROJECT TITLE: OCONEE RANGER DISTRICT - CHATTAHOOCHEE - OCONEE NATIONAL FOREST :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHABILITATION OF THE TOWN CREEK ATV/MOTORCYCLE TRAIL (TCATV) TRAIL SYSTEM PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIRT BIKES AND OHV VEHICLES LESS THAN 50” IN WIDTH AND THEIR SUPPORTING TRAILHEAD FACILITIES. MAINTENANCE CONSISTS OF GRADING AND SHAPING OF TRAIL TREAD WITH MECHANIZED EQUIPMENT. HEAVY MAINTENANCE WILL CONSIST OF SURFACE HARDENING USING PAVERS, GRAVEL AND TIMBERS, ARMORING OF TREAD IN SELECT PLACES WITH RESHAPING OF DRAINAGE STRUCTURES SUCH AS ROLLING GRADE DIPS AND REROUTES. THIS TRAIL SYSTEM IS A COMBINATION OF NATURAL SURFACING WITH ROCK AND GRAVEL PLACED TO PROTECT TREAD IN CERTAIN AREAS. APPROXIMATELY 1  MILE OF THE TRAIL IS IN NEED OF REROUTES. AFTER CONSTRUCTION, THE EXISTING UNSUSTAINABLE TRAIL WILL BE DECOMMISSIONED.

PROJECT TITLE: SHERMAN LAKE TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE CONSTRUCTION OF TWO SEPARATE, BUT RELATED, TRAIL SEGMENTS WITHIN THE CORPORATE LIMITS OF THE TOWN OF COLUMBIA. THE GOAL OF BOTH TRAIL SEGMENTS IS TO CONNECT THE FUTURE LAKE SHERMAN TRAIL SYSTEM WITH THE DOWNTOWN AREA OF COLUMBIA (NORTHERN TRAIL SECTION) AND WITH THE HISTORICAL COLUMBIA CEMETERY HILL (SOUTHERN TRAIL SECTION). THE LAKE TRAIL SECTION WILL BE CONSTRUCTED USING PRIVATE FUNDS AS PART OF THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE LAKE SHERMAN PARK AND RECREATION AREA. THE PROPOSED TRAIL OUTSIDE OF THE LAKE WILL 5' WIDE WITH A 4' STONE BASE COVERED WITH 2' OF AN ASPHALTIC WEARING COURSE. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT ONE EASEMENT WILL NEED TO BE ACQUIRED BY THE TOWN THROUGH MR. JOHN STRINGER'S PROPERTY ALONG THE SOUTHERN TRAIL SECTION.

PROJECT TITLE: 2020-2021 RTP ADMININSTRATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: ON DECEMBER 4, 2015, PRESIDENT OBAMA SIGNED INTO LAW THE FIXING AMERICA'S SURFACE TRANSPORTATION ACT, OR 'FAST ACT' - THE FIRST FEDERAL LAW IN OVER TEN YEARS TO PROVIDE LONG-TERM FUNDING CERTAINTY FOR SURFACE TRANSPORTATION. THE FAST ACT AUTHORIZES FHWA'S RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM, AS WELL AS MANY OTHER FEDERAL PROGRAMS AND BUDGETARY EXPENDITURES, OVER FISCAL YEARS 2016 THROUGH 2020. THE RTP ADMINISTRATION FOR 2020-21 IS BUDGETED BY DCRT ALONG WITH THE NEW PROJECTS BEING SUBMITTED FOR FUNDING AS THE 2019 FHWA RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM FOR LOUISIANA GRANT AWARDS.

PROJECT TITLE: NSU BAYOUSIDE TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: CREATE A WATER TRIAL HEAD AND CONNECT TO EXISTING LANDBASED TRAILS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT INCLUDES THE CLEARING OF TREES, EARTH WORK, OFF-STREET PARKING SPACE (ENTRANCE/EXIT, PARKING, LOADING/UNLOADING AREA), HARD SURFACE TRAIL FROM PARKING AREA TO AN ADA RAMP AND STEPS WHICH LEADS TO A BAYOU-SIDE BOARDWALK. THE BOARDWALK WILL HAVE FIXED GANGPLANK WHICH PROVIDES ACCESS TO A FLOATING DOCK ON BAYOU LAFOURCHE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE A COVERED PAVILION RESTING AREA.

PROJECT TITLE: BASTROP TRAILS CONNECTOR :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS BASTROP TRAILS CONNECTOR WITHIN THE SMITH-WILSON MEMORIAL PARK PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE 800 LINEAR FEET - 5' WIDE - OF WALKING TRAILS AND 1110 LINEAR FEET OF 10' WIDE PED BIKE TRAIL FOR THE CITY OF BASTROP'S INITIAL WALKING TRAILS CONNECTOR. THIS TRAILS PROJECT WILL CONNECT TO OTHER CITY PARKS, THE FARMER'S MARKET, CITY HALL, AND OTHER ESTABLISHMENTS ALONG ITS CONNECTING TRAIL ROUTES. A NORTHEAST TO SOUTHWEST COMBINATION BIKE AND PEDESTRIAN TRAIL WILL CONNECT EAST MADISON/EAST JEFFERSON TO EAST HICKORY AVENUE. A DRAINAGE CREEK RUNS THROUGH THE PARK'S CENTER ISOLATING THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE PARK FORM OTHER PARK ACTIVITY AREAS. A TRAIL CREEK CROSSING BRIDGE ENABLES THE RECAPTURING OF PARK AREAS THAT ARE NOT CURRENTLY IN USE. TO ACCOMPLISH THE WORK, AN ENGINEERING FIRM WILL BE HIRED TO OVERSEE THIS PROJECT. THE PAVING WORK WILL BE DONE BY AN ASPHALT PAVING COMPANY, THE CITY OF BASTROP EMPLOYEES, VOLUNTEERS, CIVIC AND SOCIAL ORGANIZATIONS, CHURCH GROUPS, SCHOOL GROUPS AS FULFILLMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVICE OBLIGATIONS.

PROJECT TITLE: WINNFIELD TRAILHEAD &TRAIL RESTORATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE L&A TRAILS, INC. OWNS AND OPERATES THE 65-MILE LOUISIANA TRAIL, A FORMER RAIL CORRIDOR THAT RUNS THROUGH WEBSTER, BIENVILLE, NATCHITOCHES AND WINN PARISHES. THE CORRIDOR MEASURES NO LESS THAN 100 FEET WIDE WITH SOME AREAS AS WIDE AS 200 FEET. THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT AN AGGREGATE AND ASPHALTIC CONCRETE TRAIL SURFACE FROM LA 501 TO WINNFIELD WITH A TRAILHEAD IN WINN PARISH AND TO RESTORE, AS NEEDED, THE EXISTING TRAIL SURFACE, BRIDGES AND APPROACHES, GATES AND SIGNAGE THROUGHOUT THE 65 MILE LENGTH OF THE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: RESTOR OF TRAIL BTWN JAMESTOWN & SIBLEY :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE L & A TRAILS, INC. OWNS AND OPERATES THE 65-MILE LOUISIANA TRAIL, A FORMER RAIL CORRIDOR THAT RUNS THROUGH WEBSTER, BIENVILLE, NATCHITOCHES AND WINN PARISHES. THE CORRIDOR MEASURES NO LESS THAN 100' WIDE WITH SOME AREAS AS WIDE AS 200'. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RESTORE THE TRAIL FROM JAMESTOWN TO SIBLEY.

PROJECT TITLE: OPELOUSAS REG.-TRAIL MAINT. EQUIP. ACQ. :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE MAJOR PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST IS TO ACQUIRE HEAVYEQUIPMENT TO FACILITATE THE ANNUAL MAINTENANCE, RENOVATION, REPAIR, AND IMPROVEMENT OF OVER 135 MILES OF MOTORIZED TRAILS ON WMA'S WITHIN THE OPELOUSAS REGION AND OVER 493 MILES OF MOTORIZED TRAILS ON WMA'S STATE WIDE. SUCH EQUIPMENT CAN INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO BULLDOZER, EXCAVATOR, DUMP TRUCK, TRACTORS, AND TRACTOR IMPLEMENTS SUCH AS BUSHOGGS, DISKS, GRADER BLADES, AND DITCHING IMPLEMENTS. ANNUALLY, REGIONAL BUDGETS ARE APPROVED FOR THE ACQUISITION OF SUCH EQUIPMENT. UPON APPROVAL OF SUCH, EQUIPMENT WOULD BE ACQUIRED WITH THIS FUNDING TO UTILIZE FOR THE ABOVE MENTIONED ACTIVITIES ON MOTORIZED TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: MOREY PARK TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE WALKING TRAIL WILL CONSIST OF A COMBINATION OF CONCRETE AND BOARDWALK. THECONCRETE IS 6' WIDE AND 4' THICK ON A COMPACTED SUBGRADE, 625' OF CONCRETE AND 250' OF TREATED WOOD. INCLUDED IS A PRELIMINARY DESIGN FOR A KAYAK LAUNCH WITH BULKHEADING AND TIE DOWNS. THE PROJECT WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY CONTRACTORS AND MUNICIPAL WORKERS.

PROJECT TITLE: DEWEY WILLS WMA - JAKEY ATV TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REPAIR 3.1 MILES OF ATV TRAIL THAT HAS BEEN DEGRADED THROUGH NORMAL WMA USE OVER TIME. CONTRACTED HEAVY EQUIPMENT WILL CLEAR VEGETATION TO RECLAIM A 50'TRAIL RIGHT OF WAY THE LENGTH OF THE TRAIL. CONTRACTED EQUIPMENT WILL RESHAPE AND RE-CROWN THE EXISTING TRAIL ROADBED, EXCAVATE SHALLOW AND PARALLEL V-DITCHES ON BOTH SIDES OF THE TRAILS, AND INSTALL CULVERTS AS NEEDED TO FACILITATE DRAINAGE AND NATURAL HYDROLOGIC PROCESSES. CONTRACTED HEAVY EQUIPMENT WILL BE UTILIZED FOR THE PLACEMENT OF RIP RAP AGGREGATE TO STABILIZE TRAIL SIDES WHERE MAJOR CULVERTS ARE PLACED.

PROJECT TITLE: OPELOUSAS PARKS PED-BIKE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROPOSED TRAIL WILL BEGIN AT NORTH CITY PARK IN OPELOUSAS AND THEN TRAVEL TO SOUTH CITY PARK AND BACK. THE TRAIL WILL UTILIZE SHARED ROADWAY, BIKE LANES AND SIDEWALKS. TRAILHEADS WILL BE LOCATED AT NORTH PARK, SOUTH PARK AND DOWNTOWN OPELOUSAS. SUGGESTED AND APPROPRIATE ROAD MARKINGS, SIGNAGE AND TRAFFIC DEVICES WILL BE INSTALLED ALONG THE ROUTE. DELIVERABLES THAT WILL BE CREATED UNDER THIS PROJECT INCLUDE INFORMATIONAL KIOSK, BENCH, WATER FOUNTAINS AND BIKE RACKS.

PROJECT TITLE: TUNICA HILLS WMA YEAR ROUND TRAM TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REPAIR TWO SELECTED PORTIONS OF AN ATV TRAIL SYSTEM THAT HAS BEEN DEGRADED THROUGH NORMAL EROSIONAL PROCESSES AND THROUGH WMA USE OVER TIME, AS WELL AS REPAIR ERODED PORTIONS OF THE TRAIL WITH APPROPRIATE EROSION CONTROL FEATURES.

PROJECT TITLE: SAHARA WOODS RECREATIONAL TRAIL AND CAMPGROUND CONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW 30-UNIT, CLASS A – FULL SERVICE CAMPING FACILITY AT THE SAHARA WOODS OHV AREA. IT IS EXPECTED THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING; 1.) CONSTRUCT MAIN CAMPGROUND CIRCULATION ROAD ACCESSIBLE FROM THE LOOPING TRAIL NETWORK, WHICH IS CURRENTLY IN DEVELOPMENT, +-3,000 L.F. 2.) CONSTRUCT 20 TYPICAL RV CAMPSITES WITH RV PAD, WITH 50-AMP ELECTRIC SERVICE, WATER AND SEWER HOOKUPS, 1 CAR PARKING SPACE, LIVING AREA, FIRE RING, PERMANENT PICNIC TABLE AND LANTERN POST. 3.) CONSTRUCT 10 COMBINATION RV CAMPSITES FOR TWO CAMPERS TO PARK SIDE BY SIDE WITH THE SAME TYPICAL AMENITIES. 4.) CONSTRUCT A 4-UNIT, SHOWER BUILDING FACILITY USING A PRE-ENGINEERED BUILDING W/PRE-CAST CONCRETE CONSTRUCTION, 6 CAR PARKING LOT AND MISC. SIDEWALKS AS NEEDED, CONSTRUCT 3-4 VAULT TOILET BUILDINGS.
THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF THE OHV AREA, WHICH WILL REQUIRE THE RENTAL/LEASE OF SEVERAL PIECES OF EQUIPMENT ESSENTIAL TO MANAGE THE OHV TRAIL SYSTEM AND ENVIRONS AS WELL AS THE MAIN TRAILHEAD FACILITY. THE EQUIPMENT TO BE RENTED/LEASED WILL BE USED TO MANAGE VEGETATION ADJOINING TRAILS AND PREVENT ENCROACHMENT, REPAIR TREADS AND HEAVILY ERODED AREAS, REPAIR STEEP EMBANKMENTS AS NEEDED, MAINTAIN CULVERT CROSSINGS, MAINTAIN TURF AREAS AND TO TRANSPORT MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT THROUGHOUT THE 1,300 ACRES OF THE OHV SITE.

PROJECT TITLE: PRAIRIE PARK LAKE TRAIL LOOP PATH :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: A NEW PEDESTRIAN/BICYCLE TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN THE CITY-OWNED PRAIRIE PARK AT THE EAST EDGE OF LASALLE TO ROTARY PARK.  THE TRAIL WILL BE A 1.1-MILE IN LENGTH AND 10-FOOT WIDE LOOPING ASPHALT TRAIL ACCESSED BY EXISTING TRAIL OFF TROY ROAD FROM THE SOUTHEAST OR 24TH ST. FROM THE NORTHWEST.

PROJECT TITLE: FOX RIVER BLUFFS FOREST PRESERVE HORSE AND HIKE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT IS FOR NEW CONSTRUCTION ON A 1.05 MI TRAIL WITH A CRUSHED LIMESTONE SURFACE AT FOX RIVER BLUFFS FOREST PRESERVE NEAR YORKVILLE, IL. THE FOREST PRESERVE IS LOCATED OFF FOX ROAD AND WILL HAVE A LOOP AND SPUR TRAIL THAT WILL BEGIN AND END AT THE PARKING AREA OF THE PRESERVE.

PROJECT TITLE: HIGH FALLS STATE PARK - HISTORIC TRAIL REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHABILITATION OF THE APPROXIMATELY 0.2-MILE LINEAR HISTORIC TRAIL (ADA COMPLIANT TRAIL) WITH GRAVEL AND SAFETY RAILING, AND WILL INCLUDE TWO OVERLOOKS, BRIDGE IMPROVEMENTS, AND PARKING IMPROVEMENTS (INCLUDING ADA SPACES).

PROJECT TITLE: FORT YARGO STATE PARK - TRAIL BRIDGE RECONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: RECONSTRUCT A DILAPIDATED TRAIL BRIDGE ALONG THE LAKE LOOP TRAIL THAT IS AN IMPORTANT CONNECTING ELEMENT OF THE PARK’S TRAIL SYSTEM. THE LAKE LOOP TRAIL SERVES PRIMARILY HIKERS, ALTHOUGH IT IS ALSO OPEN TO BICYCLES, AND IS USED SEVERAL TIMES A YEAR FOR RACES CONDUCTED IN THE PARK.

PROJECT TITLE: TROUP COUNTY - THREAD 7 - PANTHER PARK :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS WILL BE A CONTINUATION OF THE THREAD, A CONCRETE MULTI-USE TRAIL THAT HAS BEEN PLANNED AND UNDER CONSTRUCTION FOR THE LAST TWO AND A HALF YEARS. AS OF TODAY, THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 7.5 MILES OF THE THREAD THAT ARE BUILT OUT OF A TOTAL 29 MILES PLANNED. THE SUBJECT OF THIS APPLICATION IS A GREENWAY PIECE CONTINUING FROM THE LAGRANGE COLLEGE CAMPUS WHERE THE LAST RTP-FUNDED TRAIL SECTION ENDED AT CLEAVELAND FIELD. THE TRAIL WILL CONTINUE THROUGH A PARK SPACE BORDERING THE HILLSIDE NEIGHBORHOOD.  THE TOTAL ACREAGE OF THESE PROPERTIES IS 14.75 ACRES. HOWEVER, CONSTRUCTION OF THE TRAIL WILL ONLY TAKE A SWATH OF LAND, TYPICALLY A 25-FOOT CORRIDOR, TOTALING AN ESTIMATED 1.5 ACRES. THIS TRAIL SEGMENT WILL ADD APPROXIMATELY 0.5 OF A MILE (2600 LINEAR FEET) TO THE EXISTING TRAIL SYSTEM. AS WITH OTHER SECTIONS OF THE THREAD, TRAIL SIGNAGE, BENCHES AND TRASH/RECYCLING/PET WASTE RECEPTACLES WILL BE PROVIDED ALONG THE ROUTE.

PROJECT TITLE: ROCKDALE COUNTY - SOUTH RIVER WATER TRAIL LAUNCH & TAKE OUT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CREATE WATER TRAIL ACCESS TO THE SOUTH RIVER FOR KAYAKING AND CANOEING. THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT A LAUNCH ON THE SOUTH RIVER AT LORRAINE PARK AND TRAILHEAD AND CONSTRUCT A TAKEOUT AREA AND PARKING LOT AT OGLESBY BRIDGE ROAD. AS THE PATH WILL BE ALONG 6.5 MILES OF THE SOUTH RIVER, GRANT FUNDS WILL BE EXPENDED TO CREATE TWO LOCATIONS FROM WHICH USERS CAN LAUNCH AND TAKEOUT.

THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE REMOVING HAZARDOUS TREES, REPAIRING EXISTING TRAIL TREAD AND TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE, AND BRUSHING TRAIL CORRIDORS TO ENHANCE TRAIL USER ACCESS ON THE HAINES AREA STATE PARK TRAILS.

PROJECT TITLE: LUNCH FALLS TRAIL REPAIRS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION PLANS TO PROVIDE REPAIRS TO LUNCH FALLS TRAIL NEAR SETTLER'S COVE STATE RECREATION SITE.

THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE DEMOLITION AND REPLACEMENT OF THE EXISTING LUNCH FALLS TRAIL LOWER STAIRS AND BOARD WALK.  THE PROJECT WOULD RESULT IN REPLACING AND IMPROVING POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT IS BEYOND ITS CURRENT USEFUL LIFE.

PROJECT TITLE: SHOUP BAY TRAIL, PHASE I :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: VALDEZ ADVENTURE ALLIANCE PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SHOUP BAY TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND DIRELY NEEDED MAINTENANCE/REPAIR ON THE FIRST 1,500 FEET OF SHOUP BAY TRAIL IN VALDEZ, AK, SPECIFICALLY TO CLEAR/BRUSH AND PLACE AND COMPACT FABRIC AND GRAVEL FILL 6 FEET WIDE AND 1 FOOT DEEP.  THIS IS PHASE I.  WE PLAN TO CONTINUE TO RAISE FUNDS AND CONTINUE TO REPAIR PAST THE FIRST 1,500 FEET, AS IS POSSIBLE.

PROJECT TITLE: TURNAGAIN PASS TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE UNITED STATES FOREST SERVICE, CHUGACH NATIONAL FOREST PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TURNAGAIN PASS TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WOULD BRING THE RELATIVELY RECENTLY CONSTRUCTED TURNAGAIN PASS TRAIL BACK TO STANDARDS TO ACCOMMODATE HIGHER USE LEVELS IN CONJUNCTION WITH NEW BRIDGES (SEPARATE, NON-RTP, USFS PROJECT) BEING INSTALLED THAT WILL MAKE THE TRAIL MORE FUNCTIONAL AND EASIER TO CONNECT OTHERWISE SEPARATED SEGMENTS.  WORK FOR THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE BRUSHING OUT THE EXISTING TRAIL TREAD AND ASSOCIATED TRAIL CORRIDOR, AND CLEANING OUT PREEXISTING DRAINAGE FEATURES INCLUDING DITCHES, CULVERTS, DIPS, WATERBARS, AND TURNPIKES.

PROJECT TITLE: SEA LION COVE STATE MARINE PARK TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SITKA TRAIL WORKS PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO SEA LION COVE STATE MARINE PARK TRAIL.

SEA LION COVE STATE MARINE PARK TRAIL REPAIR PROJECT WILL IMPROVE TRAIL TREAD TO CREATE A SAFER AND MORE SUSTAINABLE TRAIL SURFACE ON THIS 2.5 MILE LONG TRAIL TO A LARGE BEACH.  GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR LABOR, MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES, REMOTE CAMP, AND MARINE TRANSPORTATION TO THIS SITE 2.5 HOURS BY BOAT FROM SITKA TO COMPLETE REPAIRS.  THE GOALS OF THE REPAIR PROJECT ARE TO CREATE A MORE SUSTAINABLE TRAIL THAT REDUCES LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS AND MAKES THIS WORLD-CLASS, UNIQUE TRAIL ACCESSIBLE TO MOST HIKERS AS A MODERATE DIFFICULTY HIKE.

PROJECT TITLE: SETTLERS BAY COASTAL PARK INTERPRETIVE TRAIL SIGNAGE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: MATANUSKA-SUSITNA BOROUGH PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SETTLERS BAY COASTAL PARK BY INSTALLING INTERPRETIVE TRAIL SIGNAGE.

DEVELOP A SETTLERS BAY COASTAL PARK INTERPRETIVE PLAN.  DEVELOP AND INSTALL SEVERAL INTERPRETATION PANELS.
- INTERPRETIVE PLAN.
- DRAFT INTERPRETIVE PLAN.
- FINAL INTERPRETIVE PLAN.

PROJECT TITLE: ESKA STRIP MINE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: MATANUSKA-SUSITNA BOROUGH PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE ESKA STRIP MINE TRAIL.

ESKA STRIP MINE TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS WILL CONSIST OF SPREADING PIT RUN ON THE SECTIONS OF THE EXISTING TRAIL WITH INSUFFICIENT COBBLE TO SUPPORT THE LINEAR CRUSHER.  A LINEAR CRUSHER WOULD THEN MAKE TWO PASSES OVER THE EXISTING TRAIL FOLLOWED BY A DOZER AND EXCAVATOR TO RESHAPE THE TRAIL BED.

PROJECT TITLE: GIRDWOOD LOWER IDITAROD NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL, PHASE II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: GIRDWOOD TRAILS COMMITTEE PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE GIRDWOOD LOWER IDITAROD NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL.

THIS 0.75 MILE SEGMENT IS PHASE II OF A MULTI-PHASE PROJECT ON THE GIRDWOOD LOWER IDITAROD NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL.  PHASE II WILL INCLUDE BRUSHING THE TRAIL SEGMENT, ADDING TRAILHEAD AND WAYPOINT SIGNAGE, IMPROVING TRAIL TREAD AND DRAINAGE.  FINISHED TRAIL WILL BE 6' WIDE, 10-14' ABOVE EXISTING GRADE, WITH A HARD-PACKED GRAVEL SURFACE.  TRAIL WILL FOLLOW THE EXISTING ALIGNMENT, WHICH HAS BEEN DESIGNATED BY THE USFS.  TRAILHEAD AND WAYPOINT SIGNAGE WILL BE ADDED ALONG THE TRAIL TO PROVIDE SAFETY AND LOCATIONAL INFORMATION TO TRAIL USERS.

PROJECT TITLE: TANANA LAKES RECREATION AREA :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TANANA LAKES RECREATION AREA.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TRAILHEAD INFORMATION TO USERS OF THE BOROUGH'S TANANA LAKES RECREATION AREA, THE TANANA RIVER, AND THE TANANA FLATS TRAINING AREA OPERATED BY THE U.S. ARMY.  THE SCOPE OF THIS GRANT INCLUDES INSTALLING MULTIPLE TRAILHEAD KIOSKS, EQUIPPED WITH MAPS AND TRAIL ACCESS INFORMATION.

PROJECT TITLE: ROSIE CREEK VALLEY TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT PROPOSES RECREATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS TO A SYSTEM OF NARROW AND SCENIC FORESTRY ROADS IN THE ROSIE CREEK UNIT OF THE TANANA VALLEY STATE FOREST:
- REGRADING AND RESURFACING AN 18-MILE SYSTEM OF EXISTING FORESTRY ROADS TO REPAIR RUTS AND EROSION, AND CLEARING BRUSH FROM PORTIONS OF EXISTING FORESTRY ROADS.
- REGRADING AND REMOVING JUNK CARS FROM A MATERIAL SITE ON THE PARKS HIGHWAY TO PROVIDE PARKING.
- CONSTRUCTING AND INSTALLING AN INFORMATION AND MAP KIOSK NEAR THE TRAIL HEAD TO SHOW THE ROAD SYSTEM AND EXPLAIN TIMBER MANAGEMENT IN THE FOREST, AND A LINK TO AN ONLINE GPS MAP.
- INSTALLING INFORMATIONAL AND DIRECTIONAL SIGNS ON THE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: POINT BRIDGET STATE PARK TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION, POINT BRIDGET STATE PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE POINT BRIDGET STATE PARK TRAILS.

THE POINT BRIDGET TRAIL PROJECT WILL CLEAR THE EXISTING TRAIL CORRIDOR, RESURFACE THE TREAD, AND REPAIR TRAIL STRUCTURES.

PROJECT TITLE: HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION AREA SITE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR SOUTHEAST REGION, HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION SITE PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE HALIBUT POINT STATE RECREATION AREA SITE TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL REPAIR AND IMPROVE THE TRAIL TREAD, CLEAR THE TRAIL CORRIDOR, AND IMPROVE DIRECTIONAL, REGULATORY, AND EDUCATIONAL SIGNAGE.

PROJECT TITLE: CHENA RIVER STATE RECREATION AREA MOTORIZED TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR NORTHERN REGION, CHENA RIVER STATE RECREATION AREA PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE CHENA RIVER STATE RECREATION AREA MOTORIZED TRAILS.

REESTABLISH THE OUT SLOPE AND MAINTAIN THE TREAD ON THREE MULTI-USE TRAILS LOCATED IN CHENA RIVER STATE RECREATION AREA, 30 MILES NORTHEAST OF FAIRBANKS, ALASKA.  THE TRAILS ARE COMPEAU TRAIL (18 MILES), ANGEL CREEK HILLSIDE TRAIL (11 MILES), AND STILES CREEK TRAIL (15 MILES).  A TOTAL OF 44 MILES OF TRAIL WILL BE REPAIRED.

PROJECT TITLE: GOLD MINT TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR MAT-SU REGION, GOLD MINT TRAILHEAD PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO GOLD MINT TRAIL.

THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON REDUCING VEGETATION AND PROVIDING REPAIRS TO THE EXISTING TRAIL TREAD ALONG THE GOLD MINT TRAIL LOCATED WITHIN EAST HATCHER PASS MANAGEMENT AREA.  THIS WORK WILL TAKE PLACE DURING THE SUMMER OF 2020 AND 2021.

PROJECT TITLE: EAST RED SHIRT LAKE AND CHICKEN LAKE CROSS PARK TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON REDUCING VEGETATION, HAZARD TREE REMOVAL, AND REPAIRS TO EXISTING DAMAGED TRAIL TREAD ALONG THE EAST RED SHIRT LAKE TRAIL AND THE CHICKEN LAKE CROSS PARK TRAIL LOCATED WITHIN NANCY LAKE STATE RECREATION AREA.  THIS WORK WILL TAKE PLACE DURING THE SUMMER OF 2020 AND 2021.

PROJECT TITLE: WEST SHUYAK ISLAND STATE PARK TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KODIAK REGION, SHUYAK ISLAND STATE PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE WEST SHUYAK ISLAND STATE PARK TRAILS.

UTILIZE ONE PAID CREW LEADER AND VOLUNTEERS TO REPLACE PLANKS THAT ARE ROTTEN OR FAILING ON APPROXIMATELY 24 TRAIL PUNCHEONS (BOARDWALKS) ACROSS 7.5 MILES OF BACKCOUNTRY TRAIL.  THIS IS PART OF AN EXTENSIVE 15 MILE TRAIL SYSTEM THAT SERVES A DIVERSITY OF PARK USERS INCLUDING: HIKERS, KAYAKERS, PACK RAFTERS, BIRDERS, PHOTOGRAPHERS, FISHERMEN, HUNTERS, CAMPERS, AND PUBLIC USE CABIN RENTERS.

PROJECT TITLE: LAKE GERTRUDE LOOP TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KODIAK REGION, FORT ABERCROMBIE STATE HISTROCIAL PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE LAKE GERTRUDE LOOP TRAIL.

IMPROVE TREAD ON SECTIONS OF TRAIL THAT ARE MUDDY, UNEVEN, AND HOLD WATER BY TRANSPORTING, SPREADING, AND COMPACTING GRAVEL.  CLEAN AND STAIN THE LONG STAIRCASE AT LAKE GERTRUDE TO KEEP TRAIL USERS SAFE AND ENSURE THAT THIS HIGH-INVESTMENT TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE LASTS FOR YEARS TO COME.  ADD SIGNS AND A MAP TO A PORTION OF THE TRAIL WHERE PEOPLE OFTEN REPORT GETTING LOST WILL IMPROVE SAFETY AND RECREATIONAL EXPERIENCE.

PROJECT TITLE: AFOGNAK TRAIL AND PUBLIC USE CABINS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KODIAK REGION, AFOGNAK ISLAND STATE PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE AFOGNAK TRAIL AND THREE PUBLIC USE CABINS: PILLAR LAKE CABIN, LAURA LAKE CABIN, AND DISCOVERER BAY CABIN.

IMPROVE ACCESS AND FACILITIES AT THREE PUBLIC USE CABINS THAT SERVE AS TRAIL HEADS TO 3.5 MILES OF MAINTAINED BACKCOUNTRY TRAIL AND DOZENS OF MILES OF LOGGING ROADS THAT SERVE AS TRAILS ON AFOGNAK ISLAND.  BY REPLACING STAIRS AT TWO OF THE CABINS WITH RAMPS AND SMALL PORCHES WITH HANDRAILS AND IMPROVING THE TREAD OF THE TRAIL TO THE THIRD CABIN, WE CAN IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY TO MORE PERSONS.  THE SCOPE OF THE PROJECT WOULD ALSO INCLUDE PAINTING/STAINING THE CABINS AND STAINING THE NEW RAMPS/PORCHES TO ENSURE THESE TRAIL STRUCTURES LAST FOR YEARS TO COME.

PROJECT TITLE: GREWINGK VALLEY AND CHINA POOT LAKE AREA TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR KENAI REGION, KACHEMAK BAY STATE PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE GREWINGK VALLEY AND CHINA POOT LAKE AREA TRAILS.

RESTORE 20 MILES OF TRAIL IN THE HIGH-USE AREAS OF GREWINGK VALLEY AND CHINA POOT LAKE BY REESTABLISHING OVERGROWN TRAIL CORRIDORS, REPLACING EXISTING TRAIL MARKERS WITHIN THE CORRIDOR, IN ALPINE AND OPEN VALLEY AREAS, AND RECONSTRUCTING TREAD TO DEFINE THE TREAD SURFACE.

PROJECT TITLE: PTARMIGAN VALLEY TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR CHUGACH REGION, CHUGACH STATE PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE PTARMIGAN VALLEY TRAIL.

DURING THE SUMMER OF 2020, CHUGACH STATE PARK WILL WORK TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS ON THE PTARMIGAN VALLEY TRAIL.  THE WORK WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:
- BRUSHING OF SPECIFIC AREAS OF THE TRAIL, TOTALING 1.75 MILES.
- RESURFACE 100' OF TRAIL JUST BELOW THE OFF-TRAIL RIDING BOUNDARY.
- REPLACE OLD SIGNS AS WELL AS INCLUDE NEW SIGNS ALONG THE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: IDITAROD NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (CROW PASS), PHASE II :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DNR DPOR CHUGACH REGION, CHUGACH STATE PARK PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO CROW PASS.

DURING THE SUMMER OF 2020, CHUGACH STATE PARK WILL WORK TO IMPROVE THE IDITAROD NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (CROW PASS).  IN PHASE II, CHUGACH STATE PARK WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING TASKS:
- BRUSH 2.75 MILES OF TRAIL BETWEEN ICICLE CREEK AND TWIN FALLS.
- RESURFACE 250 FEET OF TRAIL NEAR ICICLE CREEK.

PROJECT TITLE: BIRD TO GIRD TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALASKA TRAILS PLANS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE BIRD TO GIRD TRAIL.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD ENTAIL ACCOMPLISHING THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES:
- CLEARING BRUSH THAT HAS ENCROACHED INTO THE TRAIL CORRIDOR.
- REPAIRING AND RESEALING CRACKS IN THE PACED TRAIL SURFACES.

PROJECT TITLE: WINNFIELD TRAILHEAD &TRAIL RESTORATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE L&A TRAILS, INC. OWNS AND OPERATES THE 65-MILE LOUISIANA TRAIL, A FORMER RAIL CORRIDOR THAT RUNS THROUGH WEBSTER, BIENVILLE, NATCHITOCHES AND WINN PARISHES. THE CORRIDOR MEASURES NO LESS THAN 100 FEET WIDE WITH SOME AREAS AS WIDE AS 200 FEET. THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT AN AGGREGATE AND ASPHALTIC CONCRETE TRAIL SURFACE FROM LA 501 TO WINNFIELD WITH A TRAILHEAD IN WINN PARISH AND TO RESTORE, AS NEEDED, THE EXISTING TRAIL SURFACE, BRIDGES AND APPROACHES, GATES AND SIGNAGE THROUGHOUT THE 65 MILE LENGTH OF THE TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: ABITA SPRINGS TRAILS, PHASE 2 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: CONSTRUCT 3,160' OF FIBER REINFORCED WALKWAYS THAT ARE 4' WIDE, 4000 PSI AT LOCATIONS ON HICKORY ST., LIVE OAK ST., GROVER ST., AND LAUREL STREETS. THE THICKNESS WILL BE 4' IN AREAS WITH NO VEHICULAR TRAFFIC. WHERE THERE IS VEHICULAR TRAFFIC, THE THICKNESS OF THE CONCRETE WILL BE HIGH EARLY STRENGTH, 6' THICK AND REINFORCED WITH 6' BY 6' GAGE HIGHWAY MESH.

PROJECT TITLE: SAHARA WOODS RECREATIONAL TRAIL AND CAMPGROUND CONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW 30-UNIT, CLASS A – FULL SERVICE CAMPING FACILITY AT THE SAHARA WOODS OHV AREA. IT IS EXPECTED THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING; 1.) CONSTRUCT MAIN CAMPGROUND CIRCULATION ROAD ACCESSIBLE FROM THE LOOPING TRAIL NETWORK, WHICH IS CURRENTLY IN DEVELOPMENT, +-3,000 L.F. 2.) CONSTRUCT 20 TYPICAL RV CAMPSITES WITH RV PAD, WITH 50-AMP ELECTRIC SERVICE, WATER AND SEWER HOOKUPS, 1 CAR PARKING SPACE, LIVING AREA, FIRE RING, PERMANENT PICNIC TABLE AND LANTERN POST. 3.) CONSTRUCT 10 COMBINATION RV CAMPSITES FOR TWO CAMPERS TO PARK SIDE BY SIDE WITH THE SAME TYPICAL AMENITIES. 4.) CONSTRUCT A 4-UNIT, SHOWER BUILDING FACILITY USING A PRE-ENGINEERED BUILDING W/PRE-CAST CONCRETE CONSTRUCTION, 6 CAR PARKING LOT AND MISC. SIDEWALKS AS NEEDED, CONSTRUCT 3-4 VAULT TOILET BUILDINGS.
THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF THE OHV AREA, WHICH WILL REQUIRE THE RENTAL/LEASE OF SEVERAL PIECES OF EQUIPMENT ESSENTIAL TO MANAGE THE OHV TRAIL SYSTEM AND ENVIRONS AS WELL AS THE MAIN TRAILHEAD FACILITY. THE EQUIPMENT TO BE RENTED/LEASED WILL BE USED TO MANAGE VEGETATION ADJOINING TRAILS AND PREVENT ENCROACHMENT, REPAIR TREADS AND HEAVILY ERODED AREAS, REPAIR STEEP EMBANKMENTS AS NEEDED, MAINTAIN CULVERT CROSSINGS, MAINTAIN TURF AREAS AND TO TRANSPORT MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT THROUGHOUT THE 1,300 ACRES OF THE OHV SITE.

PROJECT TITLE: HIGH FALLS STATE PARK - HISTORIC TRAIL REHABILITATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REHABILITATION OF THE APPROXIMATELY 0.2-MILE LINEAR HISTORIC TRAIL (ADA COMPLIANT TRAIL) WITH GRAVEL AND SAFETY RAILING, AND WILL INCLUDE TWO OVERLOOKS, BRIDGE IMPROVEMENTS, AND PARKING IMPROVEMENTS (INCLUDING ADA SPACES).

PROJECT TITLE: 2019-2020 RTP ADMINISTRATION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: ON DECEMBER 4, 2015, PRESIDENT OBAMA SIGNED INTO LAW THE FIXING AMERICA'S SURFACE TRANSPORTATION ACT, OR 'FAST ACT' - THE FIRST FEDERAL LAW IN OVER TEN YEARS TO PROVIDE LONG-TERM FUNDING CERTAINTY FOR SURFACE TRANSPORTATION. THE FAST ACT AUTHORIZES FHWA'S RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM, AS WELL AS MANY OTHER FEDERAL PROGRAMS AND BUDGETARY EXPENDITURES, OVER FISCAL YEARS 2016 THROUGH 2020. THE RTP ADMINISTRATION FOR 2019-20 IS BUDGETED BY DCRT ALONG WITH THE NEW PROJECTS BEING SUBMITTED FOR FUNDING AS THE 2019 FHWA RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM FOR LOUISIANA GRANT AWARDS.

PROJECT TITLE: MILLER WOODS TRAIL ENHANCEMENT PROJECT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CREATION OF A SHORT ADA ACCESSIBLE TRAIL LOOP, REPLACEMENT OF A BRIDGE ON THE ADA TRAIL, REPAIRS TO TWO HIKING BRIDGES, REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 200 YARDS OF BOARDWALK, TRAILHEAD SIGNS AND DIRECTIONAL MARKERS.

PROJECT TITLE: NORTH FORK JOHN DAY TOWER UNIT TRAILS :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE HEAVY RESTORATION OF IMPASSABLE FIRE-DAMAGED TRAILS IN THE TOWER UNIT OF THE NORTH FORK JOHN DAY (NFJD) WILDERNESS.

PROJECT TITLE: CHITWOOD TRAILHEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: EXPAND THE CHITWOOD TRAILHEAD CAPACITY TO INCLUDE PARKING SPACES FOR TEN SEDAN-SIZED VEHICLES AND SIX STOCK TRAILERS AS IDENTIFIED FOR IMPLEMENTATION IN THE 2014 OREGON BADLANDS WILDERNESS MANAGEMENT PLAN.

PROJECT TITLE: MCBRIDE CREEK TRAIL SYSTEM - PHASE 1  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCT A NATURAL SURFACE, SINGLE USE PEDESTRIAN HIKING TRAIL, THREE FEET IN WIDTH AND 1/4 MILE IN LENGTH, MEANDERING ALONG THE BANKS ABOVE MCBRIDE CREEK.

PROJECT TITLE: OREGON COAST TRAIL OVER CASCADE HEAD :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: REOPEN THE OREGON COAST TRAIL (FS-1310) OVER CASCADE HEAD. DAMAGE FROM A 2008 STORM CLOSED THE TRAIL TO THE PUBLIC. THIS GRANT WILL FUND HEAVY RESTORATION WORK TO CUT OUT AND RETREAD AN APPROXIMATELY 2.5 MILE SECTION OF TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: YAMHELAS WESTSIDER TRAIL: BRIDGE CONSTRUCTION :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR CONSTRUCTION OF A PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE OVER THE STAG HOLLOW CREEK IN YAMHILL COUNTY. THE PROJECT AREA IS PARALLEL TO OR-47 AND THE FIRST PHASE IN DEVELOPING THE COUNTY'S FIRST REGIONAL TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: RYAN RANCH SITE IMPROVEMENT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ADA RECREATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE RYAN RANCH TRAILHEAD AND THE DESCHUTES RIVER TRAIL TO ENHANCE ACCESS AND USER EXPERIENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION OF THE RYAN RANCH WETLAND.

PROJECT TITLE: WHISKEY RUN MOUNTAIN BIKING TRAILS - PHASE 2  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DEVELOP A 30 MILE BIKE OPTIMIZED SINGLE TRACK TRAIL SYSTEM THAT APPEALS TO LOCAL RIDERS AND HIGH VALUE TOURISTS. THIS PROPOSAL IS FOR PHASE 2, WHICH WILL CONSTRUCT APPROXIMATELY 7 MILES TO COMPLIMENT THE 10 MILES THAT EXIST.

PROJECT TITLE: CHETCO BAR REHAB :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: RESTORE AN APPROXIMATELY SEVENTY MILE CIRCUIT OF TRAILS THAT HAVE BEEN BURIED, FILLED IN WITH STACKS OF DOWNED LOGS, AND SWALLOWED BY BRUSH FOLLOWING THE 2017 CHETCO BAR FIRE. MOUNT TRAIL SIGNS AND PUBLISH TRAIL DATA ONLINE.

PROJECT TITLE: LAKE TAHOE NEVADA STATE PARK TRAIL MAINTENANCE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE WILL MAINTAIN AND REHABILITATE TRAILS THROUGHOUT LAKE TAHOE NEVADA STATE PARK. THE PRIORITIES FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE MARLETTE FLUME, MARLETTE LAKE, SUNFLOWER HILL, NORTH CANYON, AND SNAPDRAGON TRAILS. IF OBJECTIVES ARE MET ON THESE PRIORITIES, OTHER TRAILS WILL BE ADDRESSED. CREWS WILL FOCUS ON SAFETY ISSUES THROUGH, TREAD REPAIR, OUTSLOPE/BACKSLOPE REHAB, INSTALLATION OF DRAINAGE FEATURES, SMALL-SCALE SOIL RETENTION STRUCTURES, AND RE-ESTABLISHMENT OF PROPER CORRIDORS.

DIRECTIONAL AND REGULATION SIGNS WILL BE UPDATED AND INSTALLED.  FIVE EXISTING INTERPRETIVE SITES WILL BE UPDATED.  AT ROAD CROSSINGS AND PROPERTY BOUNDARIES, BARRIERS WILL BE CONSTRUCTED TO PREVENT ILLEGAL MOTORIZED ACCESS TO THE TRAIL SYSTEM.

PROJECT TITLE: FERNE CLYFFE STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE LAKE TRAIL IS A SCENIC HIKING LOOP TRAIL AROUND FERNE CLYFFE LAKE. AT THREE LOCATIONS WHERE INTERMITTENT STREAMS FEED INTO THE LAKE, THE TRAIL NEEDS RAISED AND CULVERTS INSTALLED TO ALLOW PEDESTRIANS TO CROSS. OTHER AREA NEED SLIGHT REGRADING AND AGGREGATES PLACED TO REDUCE EROSION. AT WISE RIDGE FUNDS WILL PROVIDE AND INSTALL NEW WAYSIDE EXHIBITS AT THE MAIN ACCESS TRAILHEAD NEXT TO THE TUNNEL HILL STATE TRAIL. THERE WILL BE EROSION REPAIR AND INSTALLATION OF NEW WATER DIVERSIONS ON OLD LOGGING ROAD. REINFORCE SECTIONS OF ERODED TRAIL WITH AGGREGATES WHERE NEEDED. BIG ROCKY HOLLOW: 1500 LF OF TRAIL NEEDS TO BE REINFORCED WITH AGGREGATE.

PROJECT TITLE: GIANT CITY STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL RENOVATE AND IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY OF ABOUT 900 L.F. OF EXISTING POST OAK TRAIL SYSTEM BY REMOVING THE DILAPIDATED, ASPHALT WALKWAY, PLACE AND COMPACT A NEW AGGREGATE BASE AND INSTALL A NEW CONCRETE WALKWAY +-5’ WIDE. IN ADDITION, A NEW ADA PARKING SPACE WITH SIGNAGE WILL BE INSTALLED (16’ WD. X 20’ DEEP), AT THE TRAILHEAD, AND INSTALL OF A NEW STRIPED ADA CROSSWALK; REPLACE FIVE (5) SMALL WOOD BRIDGES WITH NEW STRUCTURES, INSTALL ONE NEW ADA FLOATING BOAT DOCK SECTION ON POND FOR INTERPRETATION PURPOSES. ON THE GIANT HORSE TRAIL, A +-1.5 MILE SECTION OF TRAIL NEEDS REPAIRED. THE REPAIRS WILL CONSIST OF INSTALLING WATER DIVERSION BERMS, REINFORCING TREADS WITH AGGREGATES, REPAIR GULLIES, INSTALL EROSION CONTROL MEASURES

PROJECT TITLE: STEPHEN A. FORBES STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCT NEW EQUESTRIAN TRAILHEAD AGGREGATE PARKING LOT FOR APPROXIMATELY 24 TRUCK/TRAILER COMBINATIONS WITH ACCESS TO LOCAL COUNTY ROAD, CONSTRUCT ONE (1) STANDARD IDNR MASONRY OR PRE-CAST CONCRETE VAULT TOILET, CONSTRUCT ADA PARKING SPACE AND MISC. SIDEWALKS TO CONNECT RESTROOM AND PARKING, INSTALL (2) POTABLE WATER HYDRANTS.

PROJECT TITLE: LINCOLN'S NEW SALEM STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL REPLACE AN EXISTING DETERIORATED SET OF STEPS CONNECTING THE HISTORIC GRISTMILL WITH THE VILLAGE TRAIL THROUGH THE HISTORIC VILLAGE. THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION REPLACEMENT STRUCTURE WILL BE APPROXIMATELY, +/- 6’WIDE X 185’ LONG WOOD TIMBER STRUCTURE, FLOORING AND HANDRAILS, FOOTINGS, DEMOLITION AND DISPOSAL REQUIRED. MINOR TRAIL WIDTH IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE REQUIRED TO ACCESS THE WORK AREA.

PROJECT TITLE: LINCOLN'S NEW SALEM STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE PROJECT ON THE HISTORIC MENTOR GRAHAM TRAIL WILL REMOVE AND REPLACE EXISTING DAMAGED TRAIL BRIDGE. PROPOSED SCOPE OF WORK TO INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: DOWNED TREE REMOVAL, DEMOLITION CARPENTRY AND STONE ABUTMENTS, EARTH EXCAVATION, CONCRETE FORMWORK, CONCRETE ABUTMENT, WOOD CARPENTRY, STONE MASONRY, STREAM EDGE AND FLOWLINE REINFORCEMENT, TRAIL FINISH GRADING, SEEDING, FERTILIZING, MULCHING.

PROJECT TITLE: CLINTON LAKE STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE LAKESIDE TRAIL AT CLINTON LAKE STATE PARK CONNECTS THE PARK’S CONCESSION AND BEACH AREAS TO THE CAMPGROUND. THIS ONE MILE LONG (10-FOOT WIDE) LIMESTONE TRAIL WAS CONSTRUCTED USING SFY09 RTP FUNDS AND HAS BEEN VERY POPULAR WITH PARK VISITORS. THIS PROJECT WOULD REHABILITATE AND IMPROVE THE SURFACE FOR WHEELCHAIR USERS AND YOUNGER VISITORS BY ADDING AN A2 OIL AND CHIP OVERLAY TO THE EXISTING LIMESTONE BASE. VARIOUS WOODEN FOOTBRIDGES ON THE LAKESIDE TRAIL NEED REPAIRS.

PROJECT TITLE: LINCOLN TRAIL STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE RENTAL/LEASE EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS TO GRADE THE EXISTING THREE-MILE MOUNTAIN BIKE TRAIL LOOP AT LINCOLN TRAIL STATE PARK: THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE INTERPRETIVE AND DIRECTIONAL SIGN FOR TRAIL USERS. SITE STAFF WILL ALSO REMOVE AND SPRAY INVASIVE VEGETATION IN THE MOUNTAIN BIKE AREA AND CONSTRUCT WOODEN BOARDWALKS IN LOW LYING AREAS WHERE NEEDED.

PROJECT TITLE: TREC PHASE VI-A :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION:  THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE FIRST PHASE OF A LOOPED TRAIL THROUGH THE 55-ACRE AREA OF THE PROPOSED TREC PARK. IT WILL ALSO CONNECT THE TRAIL SYSTEM TO WEST EVERGREEN AVE. THIS PHASE OF THE PROJECT (VI-A) WILL CONSIST OF TREE AND BRUSH REMOVAL. A PIPE CULVERT AND GUARD RAIL WILL BE INSTALLED AT A DRAINAGE DITCH. AN ELEVATED WALKWAY CONSTRUCTED OF WOOD AND HELICAL STEEL PILES WILL BE INSTALLED ACROSS MILTON BRANCH NEAR THE EXISTING LITTLE WABASH RIVER BRIDGE. APPROXIMATELY 100-FOOT OF CONCRETE TRAIL WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AT THE ELEVATED WALKWAY. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE TREC PARK AREA IMMEDIATELY, BY USE OF THE CLEARED AREAS AND THE STREAM/DITCH CROSSINGS. IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE ACCESS FOR CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT IN FUTURE PHASES OF THE PROJECT. THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE A 1.4-MILE MULTI-USE TRAIL ACCESSIBLE TO WALKERS, RUNNERS, MOUNTAIN BIKES, AND HORSES.
PROJECT STATUS DATES

PROJECT TITLE: LEROY OAKS INTERPRETIVE TRAIL & SIGNAGE STATE :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL FEATURE NEW CONSTRUCTION AND REHABILITATION AND IMPROVE ADA ACCESSIBILITY ON 1.75 MI OF HIKING/INTERPRETIVE TRAIL IN THE LEROY OAKS FOREST PRESERVE.  TRAILHEAD WILL BEGIN AT THE CREEK BEND NATURE CENTER LOCATED IN THE PRESERVE AND LOOP THROUGHOUT THE PRESERVE WITH MULTIPLE INTERPRETIVE SIGNS USED ALONG THE TRAIL.  TRAIL STRETCHES TO INCLUDE THE FARMSTEAD AND SCHOOL HOUSE MUSEUM ALONG ITS ROUTE.

PROJECT TITLE: DANADA-HERRICK LAKE REGIONAL TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT IS FOR CONSTRUCTION OF .4 MILES OF 10' WIDE LIMESTONE SURFACED MULTI-USE TRAIL TO CONNECT CROMWELL DR AT BUTTERFIELD RD TO THE EXISTING DANADA HERRICK LAKE REGIONAL TRAIL. SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS AT BUTTERFIELD RD & CROMWELL DR TO INCLUDE PEDESTRIAN SIGNALS, CROSSWALK STRIPING & DETECTABLE WARNING AT ROADWAY INTERSECTIONS WHERE THE TRAIL CROSSES ROADWAYS. FROM BUTTERFIELD ROAD THE TRAIL WILL HEAD WEST TO ENTER THE DANADA FOREST PRESERVE PAST THE WETLANDS. ONCE IN THE PRESERVE THE TRAIL WILL HEAD SOUTH TO CONNECT TO THE EXISTING DANADA HERRICK LAKE REGIONAL TRAIL.

PROJECT TITLE: BIKE PACKING ROOTS WILD WEST ROUTE RESOURCE; IN PRESCOTT :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: DEVELOPING THE FOLLOWING: NAVIGATION AND LOGISTICS PLANNING TOOLS INCLUDING A 926-MILE-LONG GPS TRACK WITH 524 WAYPOINTS MARKING RELIABLE WATER SOURCES, FOOD RESUPPLY LOCATIONS, COMMERCIAL LODGING OPPORTUNITIES, BIKE SHOPS, NOTABLE SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS, MEDICAL FACILITIES, AND NEARBY TOWNS. A SMARTPHONE ROUTE APP IS BEING DEVELOPED TO SHOW THE ROUTE, TOPOGRAPHY, ALTERNATE ROUTE OPTIONS IN NUMEROUS AREAS, RESUPPLY LOCATIONS, WATER SOURCES, CAMPGROUNDS, PUBLIC LANDS WHERE DISPERSED CAMPING IS PERMITTED, ROAD/TRAIL SURFACES, AND TECHNICAL AND PHYSICAL CHALLENGE RATINGS. A PRINTABLE PDF ROUTE GUIDE WILL DOCUMENT ADDITIONAL ROUTE LOGISTICS, SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS AND ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS IN ADDITION TO THE AFOREMENTIONED INFORMATION. THE PDF GUIDE WILL ALSO PROVIDE A NARRATIVE OF THE ROUTE GEOGRAPHY AND HIGHLIGHT NATURAL HISTORY AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION TOPICS RELEVANT TO THE ROUTE

PROJECT TITLE: LINCOLN'S NEW SALEM STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL REPLACE AN EXISTING DETERIORATED SET OF STEPS CONNECTING THE HISTORIC GRISTMILL WITH THE VILLAGE TRAIL THROUGH THE HISTORIC VILLAGE. THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION REPLACEMENT STRUCTURE WILL BE APPROXIMATELY, +/- 6’WIDE X 185’ LONG WOOD TIMBER STRUCTURE, FLOORING AND HANDRAILS, FOOTINGS, DEMOLITION AND DISPOSAL REQUIRED. MINOR TRAIL WIDTH IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE REQUIRED TO ACCESS THE WORK AREA.

PROJECT TITLE: LINCOLN TRAIL STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE RENTAL/LEASE EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS TO GRADE THE EXISTING THREE-MILE MOUNTAIN BIKE TRAIL LOOP AT LINCOLN TRAIL STATE PARK: THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE INTERPRETIVE AND DIRECTIONAL SIGN FOR TRAIL USERS. SITE STAFF WILL ALSO REMOVE AND SPRAY INVASIVE VEGETATION IN THE MOUNTAIN BIKE AREA AND CONSTRUCT WOODEN BOARDWALKS IN LOW LYING AREAS WHERE NEEDED.

PROJECT TITLE: ILLINOIS BEACH STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE EXISTING TRAIL NETWORK IN THE NORTH UNIT OF THE PARK HAS UNDERGONE SOME CHANGE IN USE AND HAS BECOME VICTIM TO LAKESHORE EROSION, THEREBY NECESSITATING A REORGANIZATION AND REPAIR OF THE OVERALL SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM IS MADE UP OF TURFED/MOWN PEDESTRIAN TRAILS AND LIMESTONE SCREENINGS MULTI-USE TRAILS. THE TRAILS SERVE AS A KEY REGIONAL TRAIL CONNECTION AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO NATURE PRESERVE LANDS FOR THIS UNIQUE REGIONAL RIDGE AND SWALE ECOSYSTEM. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO INSTALL A GATEWAY TRAIL SIGN, KIOSK, AND SITE FURNISHINGS NEAR THE ACCESS. ANOTHER PORTION OF (TURFED) TRAIL HAS INCURRED SOIL SETTLEMENT NEAR A PREVIOUS CULVERT INSTALLATION. THIS HAS MADE FOR A DIFFICULT WALKING CONDITION, SO WORK WILL INCLUDE GRAVEL FILL FOR APPROX. 80 LINEAR FEET, TO RE-LEVEL. ADDITIONAL TRAIL SIGNAGE WILL BE REQUIRED TO CLOSE SOME TRAIL SEGMENTS WHICH HAVE LOST LINKAGE TO TRAIL SYSTEM DUE TO LAKESHORE EROSION. THE INCREASED USAGE ON ADJACENT SECTIONS OF HIKING TRIAL, 2000 LINEAR FEET, AND MULTI-USE TRAIL, 1500 LINEAR FEET, REQUIRES (BOTH GRAVEL TRAILS) REQUIRES RE-LEVELING AND TOPDRESSING TO RESTORE THE TRAIL QUALITY.

PROJECT TITLE: BAYOU TECHE NATIONAL PADDLE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF 8 FLOATING PADDLE TRAIL DOCKS WITH GANGWAYS ATTACHING THEM TO THE BANK LINE. THERE WILL BE ONE DOCK CONSTRUCTED AT EACH LOCATION. EACH DOCK SITE WILL HAVE VEHICLE ACCESS AND PARKING. INFORMATIONAL KIOSKS AND SIGNAGE (SAFETY, WAYFINDING) WILL BE INSTALLED IN THESE LOCATIONS AS WELL AS 6 ADDITIONAL TOWNS THAT ALREADY HAVE FLOATING DOCKS INSTALLED. THE DIMENSIONS OF THE FLOATING DOCKS ARE TYPICALLY 27 FEET LONG BY 10 FEET WIDE AND THE GANGWAYS ARE 6 FEET WIDE WITH VARYING LENGTHS FROM 20 TO 50 FEET. EACH DOCK WILL BE HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE AND THE GANGWAYS WILL HAVE RAILINGS. A LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT WITH EACH MUNICIPALITY WILL BE OBTAINED. THE MUNICIPALITY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL SITE PREPARATION (E.G., PARKING AREAS, SLOPING BANKS, CLEARING DEBRIS, AND INSTALLING THE CONCRETE PAD FOR GANGWAY ATTACHMENT) IN ADVANCE OF DOCK CONSTRUCTION. THE KIOSKS WILL BE DESIGNED IN COOPERATION WITH THE LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES/TRIBAL COUNCIL, AND WILL CONTAIN 1 TO 2, 2-SIDED HIGH-PRESSURE LAMINATE PANELS THAT HAVE A MINIMUM 10-YEAR LIFE. THE PANELS WILL INCLUDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE PADDLE TRAIL AND THE LOCAL MUNICIPALITY AND WILL HAVE BI-LINGUAL FEATURES.

PROJECT TITLE: ILLINOIS BEACH STATE PARK  :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE EXISTING TRAIL NETWORK IN THE NORTH UNIT OF THE PARK HAS UNDERGONE SOME CHANGE IN USE AND HAS BECOME VICTIM TO LAKESHORE EROSION, THEREBY NECESSITATING A REORGANIZATION AND REPAIR OF THE OVERALL SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM IS MADE UP OF TURFED/MOWN PEDESTRIAN TRAILS AND LIMESTONE SCREENINGS MULTI-USE TRAILS. THE TRAILS SERVE AS A KEY REGIONAL TRAIL CONNECTION AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO NATURE PRESERVE LANDS FOR THIS UNIQUE REGIONAL RIDGE AND SWALE ECOSYSTEM. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO INSTALL A GATEWAY TRAIL SIGN, KIOSK, AND SITE FURNISHINGS NEAR THE ACCESS. ANOTHER PORTION OF (TURFED) TRAIL HAS INCURRED SOIL SETTLEMENT NEAR A PREVIOUS CULVERT INSTALLATION. THIS HAS MADE FOR A DIFFICULT WALKING CONDITION, SO WORK WILL INCLUDE GRAVEL FILL FOR APPROX. 80 LINEAR FEET, TO RE-LEVEL. ADDITIONAL TRAIL SIGNAGE WILL BE REQUIRED TO CLOSE SOME TRAIL SEGMENTS WHICH HAVE LOST LINKAGE TO TRAIL SYSTEM DUE TO LAKESHORE EROSION. THE INCREASED USAGE ON ADJACENT SECTIONS OF HIKING TRIAL, 2000 LINEAR FEET, AND MULTI-USE TRAIL, 1500 LINEAR FEET, REQUIRES (BOTH GRAVEL TRAILS) REQUIRES RE-LEVELING AND TOPDRESSING TO RESTORE THE TRAIL QUALITY.

PROJECT TITLE: BAYOU TECHE NATIONAL PADDLE TRAIL :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: SCOPE: THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF 8 FLOATING PADDLE TRAIL DOCKS WITH GANGWAYS ATTACHING THEM TO THE BANK LINE. THERE WILL BE ONE DOCK CONSTRUCTED AT EACH LOCATION. EACH DOCK SITE WILL HAVE VEHICLE ACCESS AND PARKING. INFORMATIONAL KIOSKS AND SIGNAGE (SAFETY, WAYFINDING) WILL BE INSTALLED IN THESE LOCATIONS AS WELL AS 6 ADDITIONAL TOWNS THAT ALREADY HAVE FLOATING DOCKS INSTALLED. THE DIMENSIONS OF THE FLOATING DOCKS ARE TYPICALLY 27 FEET LONG BY 10 FEET WIDE AND THE GANGWAYS ARE 6 FEET WIDE WITH VARYING LENGTHS FROM 20 TO 50 FEET. EACH DOCK WILL BE HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE AND THE GANGWAYS WILL HAVE RAILINGS. A LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT WITH EACH MUNICIPALITY WILL BE OBTAINED. THE MUNICIPALITY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL SITE PREPARATION (E.G., PARKING AREAS, SLOPING BANKS, CLEARING DEBRIS, AND INSTALLING THE CONCRETE PAD FOR GANGWAY ATTACHMENT) IN ADVANCE OF DOCK CONSTRUCTION. THE KIOSKS WILL BE DESIGNED IN COOPERATION WITH THE LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES/TRIBAL COUNCIL, AND WILL CONTAIN 1 TO 2, 2-SIDED HIGH-PRESSURE LAMINATE PANELS THAT HAVE A MINIMUM 10-YEAR LIFE. THE PANELS WILL INCLUDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE PADDLE TRAIL AND THE LOCAL MUNICIPALITY AND WILL HAVE BI-LINGUAL FEATURES.
